5:07.race_name: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap

runners.name: Collective Power
runners.comment: Ran a cracker over C&D on return from a break; go close again with repeat of that up 2lb
runners.spotlight: Seven time winner including four on AW but it has been just over a year since the last of those; however, ran a cracker over C&D on return from a break, just denied and a repeat of that off 2lb higher will put him right there again.

quotes.race: Racing TV Club Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Collective Power had a chance I thought. They didn't go much of a gallop early on and I was taking him back the whole time. He met a bit of interference but he quickened up well - Sorcha Woods, rider

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Handicap
quotes.quote: Collective Power travelled sweetly, took me there well, and I was mindful not to get there too soon. They went a good gallop which is important for him - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.name: Fair Taxes
runners.owner: Mrs N Mccreevy & J Mccreevy & P Mccreevy & J Mccreevy

prev_owners.owner: Mrs N McCreevy & J McCreevy & P McCreevy & J McCreevy

runners.comment: Some decent runs in defeat last autumn incl' on AW; can go well if ready enough for return
runners.spotlight: Won over this trip at Fairyhouse last summer and some decent runs in defeat since over 5f-6f including on AW; can go well if ready enough for return.

quotes.race: Soil.ie Sobac Healthy Grass Handicap
quotes.quote: Fair Taxes was sharp away and on a straight track you would probably go back to five but around a bend he's okay at six. That was a lovely race in his own age group and we'll try to find something like that again - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Inishmot Prince
runners.comment: Disappointing over C&D last time and has over 5l to find with Collective Power on that run
runners.spotlight: Nine of his 10 wins have come on AW; however, was disappointing over C&D last time after a three month break and has over 5l to find with Collective Power on that run.

quotes.race: Kilberry Handicap
quotes.quote: I would have been disappointed if Inishmot Prince had got beaten because of the form he was in at home. Since Bellewstown, he really came on very well. He is 21lb lower on grass than he is on all-weather, but he needed every yard of it! - Tom McCourt, trainer.

runners.name: Clonmacash

prev_owners.owner: Mark Devlin/Nigel O'Hare/Gary Devlin/Kabin Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: Has improved recently at this track, mainly over 7f; shouldn't be far away again
runners.spotlight: His three wins have come on AW over 6f-7f; largely consistent over the winter at this track and has improved recently, mainly over 7f; shouldn't be far away again.

quotes.race: Book Online At DundalkStadium.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Clonmacash was found out here last day but the extra furlong suited and he did it well today - Wayne Hassett, rider

runners.name: Velvet Skies
runners.comment: Won over C&D last month and not a bad effort on testing ground at Naas since; considered
runners.spotlight: Won for the second time when scoring over C&D last month and not a bad effort on testing ground at Naas since; down 1lb and back on this surface can help so considered.

runners.name: Dandys Derriere
runners.comment: Well beaten both Irish starts at this track and not easy to fancy; new yard
runners.spotlight: Four wins in the UK with three on AW but well beaten both Irish starts at this track and not easy to fancy; new yard.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We'd been running this horse over the wrong trip, we felt Dandys Derriere needed a bit further, and the handicapper's given us a hand as well - Colin Gorman, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Yaxchilan
runners.comment: Some decent runs last year but became regressive; has to get back to best for a new yard
runners.spotlight: Some decent runs in defeat for Dermot Weld last year but became regressive; has to get back to best form on return for a new yard.

runners.name: Circles
runners.comment: Scored at this venue a week ago over 7f; up 6lb and this trip is a question
runners.spotlight: Won her fourth race on AW (all over 7f) when scoring at this venue a week ago; up 6lb for that and has run well over 6f in the past but others make more appeal.

quotes.race: Book Online @ DundalkStadium.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Circles had been running well without winning but she is probably a bit stronger now. We left it late but I didn't want to get there early and get caught - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

5:42.race_name: Saturday 12th July Ladies Day At Dundalk Stadium Handicap

runners.name: Amavasya
runners.comment: Doesn't look well handicapped on turf form but might find improvement switched to AW
runners.spotlight: Finished in midfield in two Curragh maidens last year and a similar effort on return at the same track; doesn't look particularly well handicapped on that form but might find improvement switched to AW.

runners.name: Brigids Cloak
runners.comment: Drops in trip but also dropping in class today; can go close with cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run consistently well in defeat over 7f at this venue lately; the drop in trip probably isn't a big issue as she is also dropping in class today; can go close with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Belle Yeux
runners.comment: Handicap/AW debut after an absence; yard is going well and needs a market check; hood on
runners.spotlight: Showed regressive form in three turf maidens last year from 5f-7.5f; makes handicap/AW debut after an absence but yard is going well and needs a market check; hood added.

runners.name: Charanda
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Basically regressive filly; down 4lb from last AW run but needs more
runners.spotlight: Maiden has run respectably in defeat at times on turf and AW but is basically regressive; down 4lb from last AW run but needs more.

runners.name: Movin And Groovin

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs Theresa Marnane

runners.comment: Below-par effort over 7f when last seen but has been freshened up since and can go well
runners.spotlight: Ran three times at this track in January; won over this trip before a solid effort over a mile; a below-par effort over 7f on last occasion but has been freshened up since and can go well.

runners.name: Zaraahmando
runners.comment: Runner-up in a Down Royal nursery last year but was well below that form here next time
runners.spotlight: Best effort when 5.5l runner-up in a Down Royal nursery last autumn but was well below that form at this track next time; doesn't make a lot of appeal on return.

runners.name: Eric Lock
runners.comment: Best effort came on testing ground last time; not guaranteed to repeat that form on AW
runners.spotlight: Ran well at times in defeat at this track over the winter but best effort came at Naas on testing ground last time over 5f; not guaranteed to repeat that form back on AW.

runners.name: James The Second
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on return at Naas but was 3/1 fav' then; has to rebound on AW debut
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 10 turf starts was beaten a long way on return at Naas but was 3/1 fav' then; has to rebound on AW debut.

6:45.race_name: Dundalk Stadium Open All Summer Maiden

runners.name: Angel Harry
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on heavy ground at Naas on debut; best watched for future reference
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on heavy ground at Naas on debut and is best watched for future reference.

runners.name: Cabot Sq
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on heavy ground at Naas on debut; best watched for future reference
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on heavy ground at Naas on debut and is best watched for future reference.

runners.name: First Wave
runners.owner: D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Boasts the best form in this field and a repeat of that will make him difficult to beat
runners.spotlight: Beaten by stablemates on his first two starts, including over C&D last year; a similar level of form when again runner-up on return at the Curragh over a mile; was 2.25l in front of Raykir then that is the best form in this field and a repeat of that will make him difficult to beat.

runners.name: Knockmark
runners.comment: Beaten 14l on debut last year; gelded since and a tongue-tie on; major  improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred and cost Euro75,000 as a yearling; beaten 14l on debut at the Curragh last summer; gelded since and a tongue-tie added for today; lots of improvement needed.

runners.name: Never Ambling
runners.comment: By a leading sire but unsold for Eur47,000 as a yearling; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; brother to 1m AW winner Instrumental (RPR 80), half-brother to winners incl' Mince (6f inc 2yo/Group 3; 116), Stomp (6f inc HK; 95) and Skate (5.7f-1m inc 2yo/Qatar; 89); dam 5f 2yo winner (inc Listed; 99); by a leading sire but unsold for Eur47,000 as a yearling; worth a market check.

runners.name: Pedro Nunes
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: By a leading US-based sire and a decent damline; this surface should suit; market check
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam US 8.5f turf 2yo winner (inc Listed), out of US Graded stakes-placed 1m/8.5f winner; cost USD110,000 as a yearling; by a leading US-based sire and from a decent damline; this surface should suit; yard going well and needs a market check.

runners.name: Raykir
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: Needs to find more to beat First Wave but looks the main danger to that rival
runners.spotlight: Similar efforts in maidens at Leopardstown last October and the Curragh on return, both over a mile; has 2.25l to find with First Wave on that latter run and looks the main danger to that rival.

runners.name: Send Harry
runners.comment: The best of two runs last year came over 6f here; still needs plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: The best of two runs last year came over 6f at this venue; still needs to make plenty of improvement on that form.

runners.name: Southgreen
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in two maidens last year and needs to find loads of improvement
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in two maidens last year and needs to find loads of improvement for a new yard.

runners.name: Starford
runners.comment: Homebred hails from a useful pedigree and respected yard; worth a market look
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-brother to 1m turf/1m3f AW winner Jack Sparowe (RPR 80); dam 7f-1m4f winner (inc 2yo/Listed; 98), half-sister to useful 1m winner Laelaps; homebred hails from a useful pedigree and respected yard; worth a market look.

runners.name: Voice Of Northeast
runners.comment: Beaten 11l by a useful rival on debut over C&D and has to make lots of progress to score
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11l by a useful rival on debut over C&D and has to make lots of progress to score.

runners.name: Gee Gee Hadid
runners.comment: Cost Eur22,000 as a yearling; by a useful sire; yard in flying form; worth a market look
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to 7f-9.5f winner Final Credit (inc Italy; RPR 78); dam US 8.5f dirt/1m1f turf winner, half-sister to Canadian 1m1f/1m3f Grade 3 winner Raylene; cost 3,000gns as a foal and Eur22,000 as a yearling; by a useful sire and yard in flying form; worth a market look.

runners.name: Havana Goodtime
runners.comment: Beaten 6l on debut but a lot further twice since and looks one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Beaten 6l on debut but a lot further twice since and looks one for handicaps.

runners.name: Sea View Lady
runners.comment: Beaten 9l by a useful rival on debut over 6f here; has to make a lot of progress
runners.spotlight: Beaten 9l by a useful rival on debut over 6f here; has to make a lot of progress.

7:15.race_name: Dundalk Stadium Group Deals Available Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: River Derwent
runners.comment: Last year ended on a low note and slow starts have become an unwanted habit
runners.spotlight: Has plenty of form here but last year ended on a low note and slow starts have become an unwanted habit.

quotes.race: Dundalk Stadium Gift Vouchers Available Online Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: River Derwent was starting to show a little bit of form of late. Adam (Caffrey) was outstanding on him, it's nice to see him recapture a bit of form. He handled that surface well and we'll keep coming here - Dick Donohoe, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Foxrock Maiden
quotes.quote: River Derwent is a good looking horse. When he goes up to a mile and a quarter he should be even better. He's a nice horse going forward - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Dubirango
runners.comment: Has win/place form at this track but now returns from a mammoth absence
runners.spotlight: Was 7lb higher when winning over 7f here more than three years ago; some good runs afterwards as well but now returns from a mammoth absence.

runners.name: Camachero
runners.comment: Got no luck in running when sent off favourite here last week; can be given another chance
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden but was close up behind Harry The Rogue here on his penultimate run and got no luck in running when sent off favourite here last week; can be given another chance.

runners.name: Harry The Rogue
runners.comment: No wins in 16 but has knocked on the door here a few times
runners.spotlight: No wins in 16 but has knocked on the door here a few times and can be forgiven a blip here two weeks ago as usually consistent; enters the reckoning.

runners.name: Gatsby Cap
runners.comment: Four-time course winner who is entitled to strip fitter for last week's run here
runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner (7f-1m) and hasn't had much racing since the latest of those 14 months ago; only midfield last week but 1m2f form isn't that convincing and he was returning from an absence; better expected back at 1m.

quotes.race: GAIN Equine Nutrition Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap is tough in fairness to him, he hasn't been spared. We'll just keep pooching away with him - Fozzy Stack, trainer.

quotes.race: LMFM Dual Race Night Friday 3rd May Handicap
quotes.quote: Gatsby Cap travelled well through the race and did it easily. He did it very easy off that rating and I can see him going well in better company - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Bungle Inthedesert
runners.comment: C&D winner on a good mark but hasn't shown much for a while now
runners.spotlight: C&D winner a year ago off 9lb higher but has achieved precious little since then despite plenty of tweaks with headgear.

quotes.race: Friday 12th July Ladies Day At Dundalk Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bungle Inthedesert was there to be shot at and had plenty to do in the last furlong, but in fairness to him he did it. Thankfully, we stayed in front and he was good and game - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.comment: Lightly raced and there have been some positives to take from two runs here
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and there have been some positives to take from two runs here, in a 7f maiden and 1m handicap; reportedly still green last time when beaten about 5l and could have some improvement lurking.

runners.name: Blue Wood
runners.comment: Both wins have been over 7f; has a strike-rate of 2-31 and looks cold at the minute
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been over 7f (one here); has a strike-rate of 2-31 and looks cold at the minute.

runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.comment: Ran well when beaten 2.5l in a big field at Leopardstown last weekend
runners.spotlight: A 20-race maiden but was only 2l away in a C&D handicap late last year and ran well when beaten 2.5l in a big field at Leopardstown last weekend; possibilities.

runners.name: Clifton Light
runners.comment: Was 80-1 when beating one home on handicap debut here two weeks ago; lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Only had the four races (6f-1m) but was 80-1 when beating one home on handicap debut here two weeks ago; lots to prove.

runners.name: Carrickfinn
runners.comment: No wins in 11 and has struggled badly in three starts since moving yards
runners.spotlight: No wins in 11 and has struggled badly in three starts since moving yards; needs help from more new headgear.

runners.name: Camevere
runners.comment: Promising fourth over 1m here in November and should make a better 3yo
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the very smart Duke De Sessa (1m-1m4f); defied market weakness (33-1) with a promising fourth over 1m here in November and should make a better 3yo; entered in the Irish Oaks; stable appears to be forward having had a double last weekend.

runners.name: Floresta
runners.comment: Half-sister to Listed-class Angels Wrath and needs checking in the market
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to winners Angels Wrath (Listed-placed 7f; RPR 103) and Draco Pulchrac (10.6f/1m4f AW; 72); dam 1m4f/1m5f winner (93); needs checking in the betting with the owners also represented by Camevere.

runners.name: Head To Head
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Denied by a newcomer here before down the field at Newmarket; remains promising
runners.spotlight: Denied by a fellow newcomer (unraced since) in a 7f maiden here in September before finishing down the field at Newmarket; remains promising and this should be more her trip.

runners.name: Jerpoint Abbey
runners.comment: USD275,000 yearling and has entries in the Irish 1,000 Guineas/Oaks; commands respect
runners.spotlight: A USD275,000 yearling and has entries in the Irish 1,000 Guineas/Oaks; commands respect, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.name: Lady Mcc
runners.breeder: Mr Gary Davis & Ms Sharon Davis
runners.comment: Sister to winners Gold Haze (French 1m1f; RPR 98) and Lord Normandy (1m2f AW 2yo; 75)
runners.spotlight: A 36,000euros yearling; sixth foal; sister to winners Gold Haze (French 1m1f; RPR 98) and Lord Normandy (1m2f AW 2yo; 75); dam 1m4f AW winner (84) out of half-sister to outstanding miler Goldikova; plenty to like on paper and the betting can guide.

runners.name: Umala
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Was 5-1 for a 1m maiden here two months ago and she finished well from off the pace
runners.spotlight: A 120,000euros yearling; sent off 5-1 for a 1m maiden here two months ago and she finished well from off the pace (beaten 5l); further improvement seems assured.

8:15.race_name: View Restaurant Summer Offer Just 29 Euro Handicap

runners.name: Scatchwah
runners.comment: Throws in the odd howler (as last time) but dangerous to dismiss as a 1m4f winner
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two maidens here but improved to win a 1m4f handicap at Roscommon and placed at the Curragh since then; throws in the odd howler (as last time) but dangerous to dismiss.

runners.name: Beauparc
runners.comment: Finished strongly for a near miss over 1m2f here in December; big shout
runners.spotlight: 1m1f winner on turf; bang there in her last two races at this track, her strong finish taking her mighty close over the extended 1m2f last time; that was in December but clear claims if in the same form after a break; gives the impression that she'll stay.

runners.name: Gracesolution
runners.comment: Back in good form and only 3lb higher than for her narrow C&D win three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Her third here in January worked out well and she duly went two places better back here three weeks ago, again over 1m4f; solid chance off just 3lb higher.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought I had got up, it was nip and tuck. Gracesolution had a nice run here the last day and she likes to run fresh. She needs cover, I was delighted with the lack of pace and was there ready to pounce. I knew she had a good turn of foot, I was trying to nurse her for as long as I could, she got there and parked a little bit -Donagh O'Connor, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Lake Isle Of Innisfree Handicap
quotes.quote: Gracesolution was a little bit harder on herself and maybe she has learned to race a bit better now, so you wouldn't mind stepping her up in trip a little bit, maybe up to 1m4f at some point - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Darkened
runners.comment: Hit hard by the handicapper for the win here in February; others might be better in
runners.spotlight: Hit hard by the handicapper for his clearcut win here in February and that surely a factor in latest defeat when back in a handicap; others might be better in.

quotes.race: Axa Smart Farm Insurance Midlands National Day Friday 8th July Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Darkened went on and did it well to the line. He was comfortable the whole way - J.J. Slevin, rider.

quotes.race: Ardilaun Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Darkened could be nice for a bigger handicap later in the year. It took us a while to figure him out and he had a few issues, but he is where we want him now and hopefully he can keep progressing - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Dromore Glory
runners.comment: Consistent of late in 1m4f handicaps but he's up the weights in a better race now
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 1221 in C&D handicaps since returning from a break; good value for narrow winning margin the last time (under Nicola Burns) so a 5lb rise should be manageable; this does look a better race, though.

runners.name: Numidia
runners.comment: Clearcut winner here in November but effectively 13lb higher now with no claimer up top
runners.spotlight: Exposed 7yo with a strike-rate of 3-39 but he won by clear daylight over the extended 1m2f here when last seen in November; effectively 13lb higher now as they claimed 7lb last time, so has more on his plate.

runners.name: Picpoul

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Mrs S M Rice

runners.comment: Down the field after a break here two weeks ago and needs to leave that run well behind
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been here, two over this trip; however, did finish down the field after a break here two weeks ago and needs to leave that run well behind.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From All At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's great to get Picpoul back on track, hopefully she'll now go on from this, next week there is another one for her. During the summer she had physio for a back problem but we have her back and I'm delighted with that. We wanted to try hurdling but she won't jump a pole! - Michael Rice, trainer, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: DundalkStadium.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Picpoul is the first Flat horse that I've trained so I might be looking at getting a few more in! She's a decent filly. We might step her up in trip. There is a two mile race here on Friday week so we'll have a look at that - Michael Rice, trainer.

runners.name: Highland King
runners.comment: Course winner but 1-31 overall and hasn't found his form this year
runners.spotlight: Won over shorter here 13 months ago but that remains his only success in 31 starts and hasn't found his form this year.

quotes.race: CT1 Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Highland King has turned the corner now and hopefully he can go on and win another one. He has form on the turf and would probably jump a hurdle - John McConnell, trainer

runners.name: My Girl Sioux
runners.comment: Consistent in defeat lately; just denied over C&D last time; can run well off 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 41 starts came over 5f at this venue last November but has been consistent in defeat since; just denied over 6f last time under this rider and should run well off 3lb higher.

runners.name: Hasiyna
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Two C&D wins over the winter but two lesser runs lately and has to get back to her best
runners.spotlight: Notched two C&D wins over the winter and some solid efforts in defeat but two lesser runs lately and has to get back to her best.

runners.name: Havana Notion
runners.comment: Was 3rd over C&D two starts back; well below that form over 7f since when raced awkwardly
runners.spotlight: Raced keenly but was a close third over C&D two starts back; well below that form over 7f since when raced awkwardly and has to rebound.

quotes.race: Botanica International Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Havana Notion has been a frustrating horse but he's never been beaten too far. He was a bit unlucky the last day at Down Royal - John Feane, trainer.

runners.name: Rattletheonionbag
runners.comment: Went closest two starts ago; however, a lesser effort since and has to rebound
runners.spotlight: Maiden has been largely consistent over the winter, going closest two starts ago; however, a lesser effort since and has to rebound.

runners.name: Jackandthefox
runners.comment: This trip is a question and has to find improvement from somewhere
runners.spotlight: Maiden has posted identical RPR's on last three starts over 7f-8f, solid efforts; this trip is a question and has to find improvement from somewhere.

runners.name: Villemacho
runners.comment: Regressive sort drops in trip; the champion jockey will have to conjure plenty more
runners.spotlight: Ex-French-trained has been regressive for this yard and drops in trip; the champion jockey will have to conjure plenty more.

runners.name: Hezahunk

prev_owners.owner: Nigel O'Hare & Philip Smith & Mark Devlin

runners.comment: Has been regressive lately and cheekpieces replace the usual visor; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a C&D maiden claimer last September; has been regressive lately and cheekpieces replace the usual visor; others preferred.

3:45.race_name: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)

runners.name: Kish Bank
runners.comment: Decent level of form at 2m in much softer conditions; upped in trip and ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner who won a heavy-ground Punchestown bumper on Rules debut; runner-up on latest two of three maiden hurdle runs at 2m, at Gowran and when clear of remainder at Fairyhouse in late February; upped in trip here and encounters much quicker ground than before.

stable_tour.quote: You'd have to say he was a bit disappointing at Galway on Saturday. We think he's better than that and we will look for a similar sort of maiden hurdle for him next time. 28-10-24

runners.name: Colorado Charlie
runners.comment: Fair debut at Roscommon last August; two failures to complete since then; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Fair debut at Roscommon last August; two failures to complete since then; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Tennesse Boy
runners.comment: Three maiden runs on soft-heavy poor, can only be watched for now
runners.spotlight: Three maiden runs on soft-heavy poor, can only be watched for now.

runners.name: Watchful Protector
runners.comment: Has looked to be crying out for this step up in trip so likely improver
runners.spotlight: Cheap store purchase with a staying pedigree but ran well on debut when clear third in 2m Limerick bumper January, faded tamely (having hung throughout) in similar contest last month, however; in between 15l off second-placed Kish Bank in 2m Fairyhouse maiden hurdle, staying on; this longer trip could well bring improvement and could well get closer to that rival now.

runners.name: Mister Frostie
runners.comment: Navan run encouraging; slight drop in trip may suit but good bit more likely required
runners.spotlight: Bumper form modest but some promise on second attempt hurdling in 2m6f Navan maiden last month; slight drop in trip may suit but good bit more likely required.

runners.name: Pacheco
runners.comment: 100-1 shot on recent Navan debut, on the retreat when faller two out; best watched
runners.spotlight: Brother to point and chase winner Overworkdunderpaid, half-brother to two point winners; dam point winner; 100-1 shot on recent Navan debut, on the retreat when faller two out; best watched.

runners.name: Stonecarthy
runners.comment: Well held in maiden hurdles at Gowran and Limerick in October when last seen
runners.spotlight: Made no impression in four bumpers and again in maiden hurdles at Gowran and Limerick in October when last seen; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Happy Me
runners.comment: Thurles second over this trip and on similar ground makes him a major player
runners.spotlight: Steady improvement since returning in November, notably latest on good ground in 2m4f Thurles maiden when a clear second (winner won again next time) although hung left on run-in; nice weight allowance here and should make a bold bid on favoured ground.

runners.name: Ufouria
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Philip Byrne & Mrs Deirdre A Kelly

prev_owners.owner: Philip Byrne & Mrs Deirdre A Kelly
Philip Byrne & Mrs Deirdre A Kelly & J R Brennan

runners.comment: Recent fourth here makes her a contender if staying this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Returned from over a year's absence in December, winning 2m Cork bumper second start (yielding-to-soft) before last-flight faller (well held) on hurdles debut at Fairyhouse (Kish Bank second); more encouraging fourth in 2m mares maiden here latest on better ground and contender if staying this longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: I couldn't believe it when she won so easily at Cork. She's a smart mare, but has had problems. She's put it all together at home lately and seems in a very good place. She'll run in a maiden hurdle at Fairyhouse on Saturday and could head to Cheltenham if she happens to win that. I like her.  20-2-25

runners.name: Fortunate Lighting
runners.comment: Lightly raced 7yo has definite ability and longer trip could bring improvement here
runners.spotlight: Galway bumper win in 2023 came on soft; seen just twice since in maiden hurdles, okay effort at Tipperary but never a threat at Punchestown in February after 307-day absence; has definite ability and longer trip could bring improvement here.

4:20.race_name: Tomcoole Farm Ltd. Mares Maiden Hurdle

runners.name: Abelene
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Wings Of Eagles mare; hooded for debut, all the better for the experience
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Wings Of Eagles mare is second foal of an unraced sister to winners The Happy Chappy (3m1f-3m4f hurdle/chase) and The Reaping Race (3m hurdle); hooded for debut, likely all the better for the experience.

runners.name: Alpha Zeta
runners.comment: Bumper promise and related to several winning hurdlers; respected
runners.spotlight: Couple of solid runs in bumpers last summer on decent ground at Listowel and Tipperary; half-sister to several hurdle winners so could well improve for the switch to timber.

runners.name: Anni Day Now
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in admittedly better-class maidens, including here last month
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in admittedly better-class maidens, including here last month.

runners.name: Aravcaria
runners.comment: Veteran mare, impossible to make a case for on only two previous runs
runners.spotlight: Veteran mare, impossible to make a case for on only two previous runs.

runners.name: Clody Diamond
runners.comment: Punchestown debut run encouraging; improvement likely here back on better ground
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner in October (good-to-yielding) for Rob James was sold for GBP42,000 after; ran well for a long way on hurdles debut in decent Punchestown mares' maiden in January on possibly unsuitably heavy ground so improvement likely here back on better ground.

runners.name: Conflict Lady
runners.comment: Never sighted on debut here last month (2m); appears the lesser likely of the yard's pair
runners.spotlight: Never sighted on debut here last month (2m); appears the lesser likely of the yard's pair.

runners.name: Cookes Lass
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Saubouas
runners.comment: 70,000Euros 3yo; newcomer demands obvious respect from top yard
runners.spotlight: Authorized mare cost 27,000Euros as a yearling and 70,000Euros as a 3yo; first foal; dam useful 2m hurdle/2m5f chase winner, out of unraced half-sister to smart jumpers Sun Storm and Tamarindo; debutante demands respect from top yard.

runners.name: Full Of Life
runners.comment: Recent Leopardstown third over this trip makes her a leading contender; tongue-tied now
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner a year ago and solid form in three attempts hurdling this campaign, most recently only fading from last when third over this trip at Leopardstown last month (yielding); tongue-tie now tried and seems sure to be thereabouts.

runners.name: Meetmeinstlouis
runners.comment: Sign of ability in maiden and two bumpers but lots more needed here; cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Flemensfirth mare is a sister to Ballyburn among others; some sign of ability in a maiden hurdle and two bumpers but lots more likely needed here; cheekpieces tried.

runners.name: Nashville Notions
runners.comment: Modest in point-to-points and soundly beaten on recent Clonmel hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Find A Fortune; dam 2m hurdle/chase winner; modest in point-to-points and soundly beaten on recent Clonmel hurdles debut.

runners.name: Shell Be Kept
runners.comment: Second in Limerick claiming hurdle on heavy; new yard and quicker ground here
runners.spotlight: Nice bit of improvement to chase home a clear all-the-way winner in 2m5f Limerick claiming hurdle in January (heavy) on final start for Sean Allen; since joined Cian Collins and interesting to see if she can continue improvement on this better ground.

runners.name: Sugar Cookie
runners.comment: Flopped on recent yard debut, but demands respect on previous bumper run
runners.spotlight: Promising debut two years ago for Nina Walsh when a clear second to a now stablemate in Leopardstown mares bumper (yielding) but after two-year absence never featured in same event last month for new yard; remains of interest, however, and step up in trip could suit (a half-sister won over 3m) now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Tiffinys Girl
runners.comment: Small step forward when remote third in 2m Gowran maiden but plenty more required here
runners.spotlight: Small step forward when remote third in 2m Gowran maiden last month but plenty more required here.

runners.name: Whiskeyforluck
runners.comment: Shown nothing in bumpers and a couple of maiden hurdles; blinkers tried
runners.spotlight: Shown nothing in bumpers and a couple of maiden hurdles; blinkers tried.

runners.name: Menas Miracle
runners.comment: Points winner but poor recent hurdles debut doesn't augur well; first reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won a mares' maiden point-to-point in December but both Rules' outings poor, latest in Gowran maiden last month.

runners.name: Music Of Life
runners.comment: Midfield in both maiden hurdles, beaten a long way; hard to fancy; second reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; fair third at Tramore on the second of three bumper runs and midfield in both maiden hurdles, beaten a long way; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Misty Milan
runners.comment: Limited handicapper has failed to complete the last twice; visor now tried; third reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; limited handicapper has failed to complete the last twice; visor now tried.

4:55.race_name: Wexford Racecourse Supporters Club Rated Novice Hurdle

runners.name: Ira Hayes
runners.comment: Bumper winner here in October, looks to have a bit to find on hurdles form so far
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner won bumper here in October before making all on hurdles debut in 2m4f Carlisle maiden; not at that level after a break in poorly-contested 2m4f Wetherby novices' in February; upped in trip here and races on better ground.

runners.name: Machismo
runners.comment: Ground okay but stamina concerns after recent Cork run at this trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; off the mark at third attempt in Tramore maiden hurdle (2m6f, heavy) on New Year's Day and handled good ground well when second in Thurles handicap over same trip; not sure if he stayed 3m at Cork last time.

runners.name: Now So Jake
runners.comment: Bled at Galway last summer; questions to answer but has conditions to suit on return
runners.spotlight: Ready winner of Cork maiden over this trip (good) last summer but reportedly had blood in nostrils when well beaten at Galway a month later; back from a long break with questions to answer but has conditions to suit and yard had a winner yesterday.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Now So Jake is a lovely horse. He's still weak and backward and there is still a fair bit to come from him - Harry Kelly, trainer.

runners.name: Artic Lane
runners.comment: Out of depth tough last time; blinkers discarded and tries a new trip; ground okay
runners.spotlight: Thurles maiden win came at 2m on good ground; tough ask last time in Grade 2 on soft ground when blinkers tried (now left off); unproven over this far.

runners.name: The Story So Far
runners.comment: Suited by a stamina test and could feature if handling this quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner got off the mark hurdling in Cork maiden over this trip in January; contested handicaps since, keeping on over inadequate 2m4f at Punchestown and again over 2m7f at Navan; balance of form on soft, this is the quickest ground he has raced on; big chance if handling it.

runners.name: Birmingham Alabama
runners.comment: Progressive mare got this trip last time; handles ground too so should go well
runners.spotlight: Progressive mare won her maiden here last summer and more recently has added handicaps at Punchestown and last month over this trip at Leopardstown, getting up at the post on yielding; stiffest task yet but should go well.

runners.name: Flemensface
runners.comment: Lightly raced 8yo a potential improver but quicker ground may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (Cork) in 2023 and returned from long absence for new yard in November with decent efforts in heavy-ground maiden hurdles at Punchestown and Navan; remains open to improvement but ground may not be ideal here (withdrawn recently on good ground).

quotes.race: Pegus Horse Feed Point-To-Point Flat Race
quotes.quote: Flemensface is as good as I've trained and a brilliant jumper of a fence. He is for sale - Michael Griffin, trainer.

runners.name: Camino Rock
runners.comment: Good run latest over inadequate trip; contender back at 3m and ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Finally off the mark when winning 3m1f Kilbeggan handicap in September (yielding); easily pick of three runs since on latest when third in quite competitive 2m4f Gowran handicap in February (soft); return to longer trip should suit as should better ground.

runners.name: Newtown Rambler
runners.comment: Absent since November; unproven over this far but has his ground
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in an ordinary maiden at Downpatrick before making all in 2m5f Sligo maiden in October (yielding); had a break since below-par run in Navan handicap in November; unproven over this far but has his ground.

runners.name: Onlymammycanloveme
runners.comment: Drop to 2m may not have suited here last month (quicker ground) and big step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner and came good under rules when taking 2m3f Clonmel maiden hurdle in February on heavy; drop back to 2m may not have suited here last month (quicker ground) and big step up in trip here.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Onlymammycanloveme is a fine, big horse. He has a real stamp of a chaser and hopefully that's what he'll go on to do. I think the further in trip he goes the better - Seamus Neville, trainer.

runners.name: King Roly
runners.comment: Ground against him last time, ground to suit now; more expected from British challenger
runners.spotlight: Early this season won Perth bumper and a 2m7f Worcester maiden hurdle (second won next time) both on good ground; pulled up after never featuring on unsuitably soft ground on last month's comeback at Ayr; ground back in his favour now and more expected of here from British challenger.

runners.name: Rue Taylor
runners.comment: Ground may not have suited on latest; worth another chance at this trip on better ground
runners.spotlight: Hexham bumper winner and retrospectively promoted to first in a 2m4f maiden hurdle here in October; soft ground may not have suited on recent handicap debut so worth another chance at this trip back on better ground.

runners.name: Therellbguddaysyet
runners.comment: Recent Thurles third encouraging and possibly more to come back at 3m
runners.spotlight: Thurles maiden win came over 2m5f on good ground; first run since on similar ground when staying on third in 2m6f handicap at same venue last month; stays 3m and first attempt on decent ground at the trip; place claims.

quotes.race: Killinan Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I rode Therellbguddaysyet myself last week when I felt the ground was a bit solid and he wants further. He's a kind horse who was only broken when he was six and Jack de Bromhead actually rode him when he was a breaker. Jack used to come up to us during the summer and was a wonderful kid. He might be looking down on us today - Michael O'Connor, trainer.

runners.name: Aeros Luck
runners.comment: Still every chance when last-fence faller at Leopardstown; big player
runners.spotlight: 126-rated hurdler won Listowel maiden on this sort of ground; favourite, every chance of making successful start to chasing career at Leopardstown last month although marginally going second-best when faller at the last, having jumped well to that point (Lisnagar Fortune the beneficiary for second); major player if that fall hasn't affected his confidence.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Aeros Luck deserved that. He was very keen last day but he settled much better today. He's learning still. I would say he'll go on any ground but he is just a horse that can be hard on himself - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second in three maiden hurdles before finally getting off the mark at Listowel in September. He received a high handicap mark after that, so he's gone on a break and we'll aim him at the spring. 10-11-23

runners.name: Aspire Tower

prev_owners.owner: North Yorkshire B'Stock And B McNeill

runners.comment: Smart hurdler in his prime; first run over fences in over a year since a fall
runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 2 hurdles winner in his pomp back in 2020/21; missed two full seasons before returning in October 2023 and hasn't looked the same horse, though he did win over this trip at Punchestown in October and okay run at Leopardstown latest; limited opportunities over fences, placed twice in decent Thurles beginners and being challenged when last-fence faller at Leopardstown over a year ago.

quotes.race: William Hill Committed To Top Prices Hurdle
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower obviously missed a bit of time and came back and it's great to see him go do that. He likes a nice gallop and he picked up from the bend when I got stuck into him. He jumped well and enjoyed himself. I was happy with the way he lengthened away coming to the last and he'll definitely come on for it - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: WKD Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: He was so good at Christmas last year and I just felt after that his form just didn't look as good. He's a big four-year-old and he had only just come off the flat and maybe everything caught up with him a little bit as the season went on. Rachael [Blackmore] was brilliant on him, he is tough out and he did it the hard way on his first run since March. I'm delighted with Jason (The Militant) as well, he ran really well and Paul (Townend) thought he would come on from that - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Aspire Tower

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower was a bit free early on but it was his jumping that let him down. He still ran well, though - Rachael Blackmore, jockey

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I thought he did it really impressively. He went a really good gallop and jumped great. The Grade 1 back here in February is an obvious race to go for, but we'll talk to the owners and see what they want to do. He had the profile of one on the Flat that you would like to go hurdling with. I'd imagine good jumping ground would be alright for him as he's run on faster ground on the Flat - Henry de Bromhead, trainer of Aspire Tower

quotes.race: Download The BETDAQ App 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Aspire Tower wasn't helped by the other horse but fair play to Rachael for getting him around. He ticked a lot of boxes coming to us and it's nice to see him go and do it. Leopardstown at Christmas is a race we'll definitely look at - Henry De Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: Tuckergardner Lettings Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I rode Aspire Tower to be second on heavy ground at Goodwood so I knew he would handle this fine. The longer trip has suited him and he's a nice prospect for next year. - Harry Bentley, jockey

stable_tour.quote: We were delighted with him when he won over hurdles at Punchestown last month, which was his first win since 2020 as he had a long layoff and then did well without winning over fences last season. We probably got it wrong at Wincanton the other day as the ground was quick on a sharp track and at a sharp trip, so he never looked comfortable. He might mix it between hurdles and fences, maybe leaning more towards hurdling. There are plenty of options for him. 18-11-24

He's another youngster who is progressing with each run. Last season he won a Grade 2 before finishing a fine second in the JCB Triumph Hurdle. This season he came out at Down Royal and won the Grade 2 WKD Hurdle from Abacadabras before putting up a career-best when second to Sharjah in the Grade 1 Matheson Hurdle over Christmas. Despite that great effort last time, he actually let himself down with poor jumps at the third-last and penultimate flights. However, as ever, he toughed it out up the straight. He's highly likely to go straight to Cheltenham now for the Champion Hurdle. 03-02-21

runners.name: Clarens
runners.comment: 118-rated hurdler; belated chasing debut and looks to have a lot on his plate
runners.spotlight: Rated 118 over hurdles, all four wins over 2m on varying types of ground; belated chasing debut and looks to have a lot on his plate.

quotes.race: Hotel Park St. Johann In Tirol Austria Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clarens was second last year and it was in my mind to come back here. He was well in with Alex Harvey's claim and we got there in time. He loves it here and we might look for something else here - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Navan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I would say Clarens learnt more today than ever before because he was shuffled back further than we wanted, and to be fair to Jack [Foley], he sat with him and had to come wide. Thankfully he jumped the last well and stayed going. It was lovely. He's improving all the time. Today was the plan, but there is a novice handicap in Leopardstown on St Stephen's Day and we might go there - John Flavin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Clarens is a lovely little horse that has taken time to come to himself. I told Jack to ride him good and positive and he jumped very well. I was hopeful of a good run - John Flavin, trainer.

runners.name: Harsh
runners.comment: Down the field in Martin Pipe, will need to improve for switch to fences to play a role
runners.spotlight: 122-rated hurdler, two wins include 2m4f handicap at last year's Punchestown festival; down the field in Martin Pipe at Cheltenham recently and will need to improve for switch to fences to play a role here.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Harsh like a big field and I thought he won well. The hustle and bustle suited him, he travelled and jumped great - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Lisnagar Fortune
runners.comment: Anything but natural jumper so far chasing; yard have stronger contender in Westport Cove
runners.spotlight: Bumper win came on this sort of ground, hurdles winner on soft; has looked anything but a natural jumper in three attempts chasing since returning in January although did well in the circumstances to stay on late for second at Leopardstown last time (Aeros Luck faller at the last); good bit to find with Aeros Luck on that form and jumping doesn't inspire confidence; yard have a stronger contender in Westport Cove.

quotes.race: Mick The Tent INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Lisnagar Fortune was as green as grass and it took him all day to learn to race in the straight. He was only getting going at the line. He is sure to stay and I would imagine he will go hurdling in the autumn - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He gave a great account when winning on his only start in a bumper at the Punchestown festival. He goes hurdling and with his pedigree, being a half-brother to Stayers' Hurdle winner Lisnagar Oscar, he looks a novice capable of tackling trips of two and a half miles and upwards. 07-11-22

runners.name: Maidenstreetprince
runners.comment: Fair level of form chasing but fair bit to find with both Aeros Luck and Lisnagar Fortune
runners.spotlight: Has had plenty of chances over fences, only fourth at Leopardstown so fair bit to find with Lisnagar Fortune and Aeros Luck; similar level of form at Clonmel since when tried at 2m4f; others preferred.

quotes.race: Keith Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maidenstreetprince had a good run the last day and was getting a few pounds today. He was a bit free and there is room for improvement in his jumping. He stuck it out well. We'll see what the handicapper does - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Run For Harry
runners.comment: 123-rated hurdler; didn't jump well on only previous try chasing back in December 2023
runners.spotlight: Dictated from the front when landing back-to-back handicap hurdles at Kilbeggan and Downpatrick last summer, both on decent ground; held by handicapper more recently; didn't jump well on only previous try chasing back in December 2023.

runners.name: Westport Cove
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Had What's Up Darling 1.5l behind when second at Thurles on good ground; big player
runners.spotlight: Solid 137-rated hurdler has attained a similar rating after three attempts chasing, most recently on good ground at Thurles when second (1.5l ahead of What's Up Darling) having forced it; major player although could well be taken on for the lead here.

stable_tour.quote: A nice, big horse who just got a bit tired at Tipperary on Friday. He should come forward nicely for that and we'll look for another beginners' chase for him next. 25-11-24
He was a comfortable winner of his only race, a Fairyhouse bumper in January when there was plenty of cut. He hasn't run since but would be one to consider. 08-03-23

runners.name: Whats Up Darling
runners.comment: Just behind Westport Cove at Thurles; should be thereabouts but others more progressive
runners.spotlight: Now 0-5 chasing but good second at Leopardstown and only 1.5l behind Westport Cove at Thurles on good ground in February; brought down in Grade 2 Cheltenham Novices' Handicap on latest; should be thereabouts but others possibly more progressive.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing For Auction Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: What's Up Darling is a speed horse but I thought Dee Capo was unlucky. Jack said he tried to run out down the far side. He gave away a lot of lengths, but we had first and second so we can't complain - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has a few different options, but I'd say the Plate is the most likely target for him at this stage. He ideally wants further than two miles and I hope there is more to come from him in the spring. 19-2-25

6:00.race_name: Bolands Remembers Mary Novice Handicap Chase

runners.name: Magnor Glory
runners.comment: 4-17 over hurdles, 1-4 over fences, goes well fresh, don't discount in first h'cap chase
runners.spotlight: Four-time winning hurdler, including at this venue, is 1-4 over the bigger obstacles; majority of best form is at around 2m-2m1f though did win once over 2m4f over hurdles; lacks a run but has won when fresh; can't be discounted in his first handicap chase.

quotes.race: Dawn Milk Run Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We gave Magnor Glory a bit of a break and we said we'd come here before Galway and I didn't think he was 100% today, but he's a funny kind of horse to train. He's very hard on himself at home. He's been fantastic for us and Galway is the plan now - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Neville Hotels Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Magnor Glory has been a very difficult horse to train. He is a very hot horse and we tried him with the hood. The hard work early on has paid off with him now. He will go for something similar now - trainer Terence O'Brien.

runners.name: Sea Music
runners.comment: 1-3 in chases, off since Galway second in Oct, best form right-handed, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 1-3 in chases, the win coming in a beginners at Kilbeggan last June (20.5f, good); saddle slipped when pulled up in a novice handicap chase at Chepstow in October; off since 8.5l second in a Galway novice chase later that month; yet to excel going left-handed; others preferred.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very good performance. He wants a trip and decent ground - trainer Emmet Mullins.

runners.name: Dutch Schultz
runners.comment: 2-13 in chases, won off 123 at Killarney in August, no impact since, may be on tough mark
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; plenty of experience over fences (2-13); course winner over hurdles, his only start at this venue; won off 123 at Killarney last August but no impact off revised mark since; may need more respite from the handicapper.

runners.name: Lightkeeper
runners.comment: Easy novice win at Down Royal, course form over hurdles, interesting on h'cap chase bow
runners.spotlight: 114-rated hurdler got off the mark at the fifth attempt over fences in a Down Royal novice (19.5f, good) last month by 7.5l; has run well here over hurdles; interesting on handicap chase debut.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle at Galway quite emphatically, but never went a yard at Tramore. He's better than that and hopefully we'll get him back on track soon. 28-10-24

runners.name: Letos
runners.comment: French recruit, second in a h'cap chase at Auteuil in October, all form on heavy, watch
runners.spotlight: French recruit yet to get his head in front over hurdles or fences; shaped well when a 2.5l second when last seen in a 2m6f handicap chase at Auteuil; all form on heavy ground; best watched on stable debut after a break.

runners.name: Nas Na Riogh
runners.owner: Charlie Doocey & Mark Doocey & Cathal Doocey
runners.comment: No impact in first four chases, tough task on latest, this easier but may need it softer
runners.spotlight: Two-time winning hurdler is 0-4 in chases; well-beaten in a beginners and two novices and similar story when pitched in at the deep end in a listed handicap chase at Leopardstown; dropped 3lb and this is easier but may need it softer.

quotes.race: Welcome To Tipperary Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Nas Na Riogh had some good runs in the winter and we were hoping the better ground would help him. That'll probably be it for the year and chasing will be his job - Robbie Power, stable representative

stable_tour.quote: He was a touch disappointing in the middle of last season but we backed off him, freshened him up and he came back really well. He won his maiden hurdle at Tipperary in April and battled well to win again at Killarney the following month. He'll go chasing and we hope he can progress. 18-11-24

runners.name: Clifftop
runners.owner: O B P Carroll & Ralph Kelly & Thomas Cox
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 1-7 in chases, should improve for latest run after break, could go well
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-7 over fences, that win coming on good ground in a 2m6f Tramore beginners last August; fell three out at Kilbeggan on handicap chase debut; should improve for latest run in a Down Royal novice after a break; could go well.

quotes.race: Foxrock Handicap
quotes.quote: Clifftop got a good ride from Chris who knows him well. He might go to Navan on Saturday and go back over hurdles after that. He jumps well - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: P&M Green Energy Cottages Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Clifftop got a lovely ride from Charlie and he might win another one somewhere. He could go to Listowel - Harry Rogers, trainer.

runners.name: Splashing Out
runners.comment: Best form over hurdles and fences in testing conditions, needs softer ground than this
runners.spotlight: 1-14 over hurdles, the win coming on heavy ground; 0-6 over fences with her best effort coming on heavy at Tramore; needs rain.

quotes.race: Panoramic Restaurant @ Limerick Races Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Splashing Out jumped and travelled well. I was able to drop her in and get a bit of cover on her as she was a bit free on me, but when I asked her to pick up, she picked up well  - Peter Smithers, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Theonewedreamof
runners.comment: Won off 5lb lower at Punchestown, handles most ground, not disgraced latest, chance
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; gained second win over fences on heavy ground at Punchestown (2m6f) in February off 107; won her beginners on good to yielding at Tipperary last July; not disgraced in a Navan listed novice handicap chase latest and dropped 2lb; claims.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Theonewedreamof can be in and out but she is not too bad on a going day. She got a lovely tow into the race and the small field helped her - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Baileys Hotel Cashel Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Theonewedreamof jumped a few slow early the last day and when she warmed into it she stayed on well. That stood to her, and she was able to jump a lot better today. Hopefully she'll get a nice mark - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts Across All Channels" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Theonewedreamof is a gutsy little filly. I though she had a place chance. The race was run to suit her. We'll find another handicap somewhere for her - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Roscommon Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: She was off the bridle the whole way and Gary (Carroll) earned his riding fee. Theonewedreamof stuck at it well, she's still very green but she stayed well. Hopefully she can improve away as she's still weak and raw - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Well Del
runners.comment: 1-3 in chases, lost form after Limerick win, unseated over timber latest, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler is 1-3 in chases; the win came in a three runner beginners at Limerick in which the favourite unseated at the first; poor form in four subsequent runs for Liam O'Brien and unseated on debut for Eoin Doyle in a handicap hurdle at Cork; others appeal more.

runners.name: Kiltealy Park
runners.comment: Locally trained, 2-2 here over hurdles, may have been aimed at this, interesting
runners.spotlight: Gained first chase win at Clonmel (17.5f, yielding) in December; subsequently outclassed in a Limerick Grade 2 and pulled up over 2m4f in first handicap chase at Navan (soft); is 2-2 at this venue over hurdles; local yard may have targeted this; interesting.

quotes.race: Clonmel Racecourse Supporters Club Only 90 Euros To Join Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Kiltealy Park won her maiden hurdle, a handicap and I'd say the ground was a bit quick the last day she ran. We'll look to Christmas now and might step her up a little in trip - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.name: Rebel Gold
runners.owner: R Kennedy & Michael Odowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan

prev_owners.owner: Michael O'Dowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael O'Dowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
Michael O'Dowd & T H Stanley & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy
T H Stanley & Michael O'Dowd & Ms Ann P Nolan & R Kennedy

runners.comment: 3-23 over fences, shaped like this trip might suit on latest, ground versatile, big chance
runners.spotlight: 3-23 over fences; hasn't won since February 2023 but has run some excellent races in defeat; never won over this far but shaped like he was in need of further when second at Gowran over 2m latest (soft); handles better ground; leading claims.

quotes.race: Newlands Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Rebel Gold didn't have to make all the running today which was a big help to him. I would have been more confident had the ground been soft, but he was fine on it and we will probably head now for the Grade 2 at Fairyhouse - Pat Foley, trainer

quotes.race: Dan & Joan Moore Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: That was great. Rebel Gold jumps and travels and any jockey that rides him comes back with a smile on their face. They get such a thrill from him. He's a pleasure to train because he's the most straightforward horse you'll come across. We went for the Leopardstown Chase last year and really thought he'd get the trip, as it turned out he didn't really. We might go back for it though, ride him differently and try to creep into it. He deserved to win a big one.  I'm delighted for the horse and delighted for the owners - Pat Foley, trainer.

quotes.race: Daly Farrell Chartered Accountants Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Rebel Gold is a fantastic jumper, is 132 over fences already and we'll see what the handicapper does with him now but there'll be a nice handicap in him. The Shamrock Handicap Chase back here in March will probably be his next race. He's not really ground dependent so we will keep him going over the summer - Pat Foley, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Exhibit A Displays Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The other horse was a bit slow at the last and that helped me. My lad hadn't run since Galway so it was a good performance as he needed the run. He'll be a nice horse for chasing. I'd say that could be his limit over hurdles now. I'd say more than likely his next run will be in a chase. He's a big horse and ran in point-to-points so I'd say that's his game - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

quotes.race: Well Done To All Frontline Staff From Limerick Racecourse Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: It's my first winner for Tom [Foley]. The horse was very free early on but they've done a great job settling him in his work. He loves the ground and should improve as well. He's nice and there might be a novice for him at Galway, he'll stay further -they went a good gallop. It probably wasn't the strongest race in the world but you can only beat what's put in front of you. It was a nice performance - Paddy Kennedy, rider of Rebel Gold

runners.name: Shadow Rider
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De L'Hotellerie
runners.comment: Last year's winner off 4lb lower, cheekpieces go on, may need softer ground
runners.spotlight: Last year's winner off 133 is back to defend his crown off 4lb higher; beaten 29l on latest in a handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse; cheekpieces go on for return to chasing; may want softer ground.

quotes.race: Tommy Carberry Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shadow Rider is a lovely horse, but he's fragile. We train him out of the pool a bit. He's a bit inconsistent, but he did it well today - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Eden Capital Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shadow Rider is a good horse and the form of his last run was well-franked. He won easily enough and we would have been disappointed if he hadn't - Mark Walsh, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won a point-to-point nicely at Knockanard. I'd say we'll skip bumpers and go straight for a maiden hurdle. Colin Bowe liked him and he could make his mark over hurdles. 09-11-20

runners.name: The Dasher Conway
runners.comment: Won off 8lb lower last May, off since heavy hurdles defeat in Nov, may be on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Two-time chase winner; last win in this sphere came at Kilbeggan last May off 123 over 20.5f (good); went close at Galway off 130 last August; off since heavy defeat over hurdles at Navan in November; may need respite from the handicapper.

quotes.race: Tramore Tourism Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Dasher Conway put the race to bed with his jumping, he was very good everywhere. If you jump and travel like that around here he was going to be difficult to get by - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Follow @TipperaryRaces On Twitter Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: It's been a while since The Dasher Conway's last run and he's been improving all the time. He's a fabulous big horse. Hopefully there'll be more days with him and it's great to get this - Gillian O'Callaghan, trainer.

runners.name: Good As Hell
runners.comment: Six time chase winner, struggled in two starts since Kilbeggan win, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 6-23 over fences and is a course winner over hurdles; won off 126 at Kilbeggan in September; raised 6lb and struggled in two starts since; didn't show enough on his return from a break at Limerick; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell was able to dictate and got a good ride from Niall. She needed a good jump at the last and nearly gave it away but she got back on an even keel. She will hopefully make a good broodmare down the line - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Town Plate Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell is a great servant and hopefully can progress. We're only learning about her best trip. She'll have a little break now and hopefully will turn up in Listowel - Philp Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tipperary Racecourse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: She just does enough but Good As Hell is a serious mare to jump, she's always making ground at her fences. She's a nice mare to have and I'm sure there will be more fun to be had with over the summer - Niall Moore, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Tipperary Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Good As Hell might hold her own in this company and she will have one more run as she has been on the go for a while - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Effernock Fizz
runners.comment: Lost form since shock Fairyhouse win last year, likes this venue, can't be fully dismissed
runners.spotlight: Admirable mare will be having her 108th start under rules; 1-21 over fences but has run well at this venue on multiple occasions; lost form since shock win in a 2m listed handicap hurdle at Fairyhouse in March 2024; hard to fancy on recent showings but can't fully dismiss.

quotes.race: Larkin's Bar & Francie Sheahan's Bar Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: It's my first winner - I'm delighted. Darragh (O'Keeffe) gave her a great ride. She's a tough mare who stays very well. I thought the ground might have gone against her when the rain arrived but she got away with it. She's with me about a month and hopefully she'll keep going - Cian Collins, trainer.

quotes.race: Indaver Bellewstown Bowl Handicap
quotes.quote: She's a tough mare. She was second in the Curragh on Saturday and she ran in the same race last year before winning here over hurdles. We have her entered for the Petingo Handicap in Leopardstown on Champions Weekend so fingers crossed she'll get in. Ideally she wants the ground a bit better but she's stronger this year and seems to be dealing with the softer ground on the flat - trainer Katy Brown.

quotes.race: Racing Post Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: Effernock Fizz was suited by the ground conditions. Small field conditions races suit her quite well. She jumps and gallops away. Hopefully we can go to Leopardstown with her on Champion's Weekend for a Premier Flat handicap - Katy Brown, trainer.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: We fancied her coming into this. Adam [Short] sat on her the other day up the Old Vic gallop and said she'd improved from her run. The biggest person that played the part in this was Danny, my partner, who rides her out every day. She's quirky enough and has had her problems but hopefully we're at the bottom of it now and can win a few more. The tactics have changed completely and lucky enough she got an easy lead again tonight. There's a winner's of two at Bellewstown on July 5 and hopefully the ground stays nice for her to make it three in a row - Katy Brown, trainer of Effernock Fizz

quotes.race: Restaurant Package At Tipperary Races Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She's the most frustrating filly I've ever trained, she'd work over anything at home but we couldn't get the best out of her on the track. She has tendencies to hang on the Flat. Since she started jumping she's enjoying it, we were probably riding her the wrong way all along though. When she's in behind and comes under pressure she tends to hang a little bit, she was as straight as a gun barrel today. Hopefully we'll have a good summer with her, definitely over hurdles and not on the Flat, which tends to bring the worst out of her - Katy Brown, trainer of Effernock Fizz

runners.name: Largy Debut
runners.comment: Solid efforts in defeat over fences, highly tried and struggled since layoff, needs rain
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-11 in chases but has run creditably in defeat; best chase effort a 2.25l second in the 2023 Munster National off 132; struggled in the Thyestes and Leinster National since return from long layoff; this much easier but his best form is on soft-heavy.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Largy Debut had been working really well coming here, we thought he was a nice horse coming. Our fellow jumps and travels and we told Keith to be positive. He has been doing everything right since and he is a really nice horse - David Roche, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was very frustrating to see him exit so early in the Troytown. He ran so well in the Munster National and we were really looking forward to seeing how he would get on at Navan. He's settling better now. 20-11-23

runners.name: Dont Go Yet
runners.comment: Two-time chase winner at 2m-2m1f, trip and ground a worry here, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Two-time chase winner off 108 and 118 at Navan (2m1f) and Down Royal (16.5f) respectively; remains 4lb above last win, this trip is a worry and he's unraced on quicker than yielding; others preferred.

runners.name: Lake Chad
runners.comment: Has won three of his last six chases, raised 5lb for win on penultimate, on tough mark now
runners.spotlight: Has won three of his last six chase starts; scored at Thurles (2m, good) by a head off 113 in February; raised 5lb for that and struggled upped to 2m7f at Limerick; drop back in trip will suit but may be in the handicapper's grip now.

quotes.race: Racing Again February 20th Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad winged the third last and I didn't want to disappoint him and I kept him rolling. He knows his job and he is some servant. He just sees out his races and he was always doing enough to win - Niall Moore, rider

quotes.race: McCarthy's Irish Bar Lexington Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad is better around here than anywhere else. He has won here before and has always run a good race here. He ran terrible the last day and I don't know why he ran so poor. The ground was soft in Roscommon that day. It was a big improvement today - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Waterford Chamber Of Commerce Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad will maybe get a little break now and come back here for the August meeting - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Krabat
runners.comment: 1-13 over fences, poor effort latest at Limerick, best form is on heavy, blinkers return
runners.spotlight: 1-13 over fences, the win coming in a beginners all the way back in February 2022 on heavy ground at Clonmel (2m4f); back from a spell over hurdles with a heavy defeat off 116 in a Limerick handicap chase last month; blinkers return and drop in trip is a plus but he's best on testing ground.

runners.name: Cayd Boy
runners.comment: Locally trained, has run well here before but on testing ground, 3lb wrong, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Locally trained; two time winning hurdler is 0-14 in chases; no sign of his best in three runs since return from a break; has course form figures of 122 but all three runs came on testing ground; hard to fancy from 3lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: WKD Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Cayd Boy is an out-and-out 2-miler. He's a pure speed horse and better ground will improve him. He's still quite babyish and he won nicely - Liz Doyle, trainer.

quotes.race: County Wexford Vintners Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've always loved him and hopefully he can go on, he needs to step up and improve. He's a bit babyish still, as is his jumping, but I think he could be nice. Whether he is a proper horse I don't know but it's a lovely start for him and he handles that ground very well. He did what I hoped he'd do today. Everything is good at home, he doesn't get tired and is lovely and sleepy, a great ride. He just woke up after the second last. He's something to look forward to. His jumping will have to shape up a bit to take on more experienced novices but I think he's entitled to step up. He'll jump a fence in time. He jumped a little childishly today but was entitled to - he's never jumped those hurdles as we have the EasyFix ones at home. We're very pleased with him today and we'll find out how good he is in the next six months - Liz Doyle, trainer of Cayd Boy

runners.name: Siberian Star
runners.comment: Britiah raider, in good form over further this year; big drop in trip may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: British raider, one of two runners on the card for the Bowens; 2-15 in chases; has been busy since the turn of the year but has held his form well; takes a big drop in trip after a 0.5l second over 26.5f at Sedgefield; this may not be enough of a stamina test.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought Siberian Star was very good. Philip [Rothwell]  just said to take my time on him and luckily they've gone a good gallop in front. I was a bit worried about the ground but it was grand in fairness to him. He just kept creeping away and finished out well at the line. Philip was hopeful after the last day, once the ground hadn't gone against him he felt he should run a big race - Paddy O'Hanlon, rider.

quotes.race: Equine Products UK Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was very confident coming here today - I couldn't see him beaten to be honest. Three miles on good ground is what he wants - Philip Rothwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well at Doncaster when just beaten by Northern Poet a few weeks ago and his form all year has been solid. He ran well again at Sedgefield last week when he came to win the race but was just collared on the line by Old Page. He deserves another win. 26-03-25

runners.name: Ernie From Nurney
runners.comment: Good run over C&D in August and again on latest at Thurles, same mark here, place chance
runners.spotlight: Ran well to finish a 1.75l third of 14 over C&D in August off 94; another decent effort off 1lb higher latest at Thurles over 2m (good); same mark here and should go well, though his two career wins came on testing ground; place chance.

quotes.race: Owners Insurance Included In AIRO Membership Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ernie From Nurney is a massive big horse and he is just maturing. He is starting to put runs together. We will keep going in those low graded races and maybe pick up a chase - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Malton Groove
runners.comment: 0-9 in chases, best runs have come over this C&D, third here latest, chance; cheeekpieces
runners.spotlight: Eighteen race maiden under rules is 0-9 in chases; best chase efforts have come over this C&D on decent ground; now 3lb lower than when beaten 3.25l here last July; third of 11 here on latest, beaten 10.5l on good to yielding (2.5l behind Da Big Fella); should be thereabouts in first-time cheekpieces.

stable_tour.quote: This chap has a good pedigree, a three-parts brother to Minella Times. He was very backward last year but we think he is growing up all the time and you might see a different horse this season. 24-10-23

runners.name: Get It Right
runners.comment: 0-13 under Rules, unseated and pulled up in first two chases, hard to fancy for now
runners.spotlight: Yet to win after 13 starts but has shown ability over hurdles; chase career has started with two non-completions at Thurles, unseating over 2m and pulling up over 2m5f, both on good ground; hard to fancy on those efforts.

runners.name: Stellar Symphony
runners.comment: Two-time winner over hurdles, belated chase debut at 10yo, trip a query, best watched
runners.spotlight: Two-time winning hurdler makes a belated chase debut at the age of ten; plenty of experience in point-to-points without winning one (0-15, second four times); best form is over further than this; probably best watched.

runners.name: On The Tide
runners.comment: 0-7 over fences, beaten 12l in a Clonmel beginners latest, trip should suit, more needed
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-7 in chases; produced one of his better efforts in a beginners at Clonmel (16.5f, good) last week but was still beaten 12l into fifth; this trip should suit better but needs more.

runners.name: Spanish Maid
runners.comment: Handicap chase debutante, huge odds and well beaten in three beginners chases, watch
runners.spotlight: Raced exclusively in maidens over hurdles without success; huge odds and well beaten in three beginners chases; can only be watched on handicap chase debut.

runners.name: Gustavo Goodway
runners.owner: T Leopold, P Smith, D P Connolly & C Connolly
runners.comment: 0-3 over fences, good run off this mark in October, unlucky here latest, place claims
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles and 0-3 in chases; saddle slipped here last time when under pressure but he was making headway; ran well off this mark in a handicap chase at Gowran (2m2f, good) in October; place claims with a repeat of that.

runners.name: Silent Flight
runners.comment: Heavy ground hurdles winner, beaten 14l in sole chase, 2lb lower but needs it softer
runners.spotlight: 1-10 over hurdles, the win coming on heavy ground at Punchestown in January 2024; beaten 14l off 93 on sole chase start and is just 2lb lower now; needs softer ground (non-runner at Naas on Thursday, reserve).

runners.name: Gali Flight
runners.comment: 0-13 in chases, poor efforts since return from a break including over C&D, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Long standing maiden; 0-13 in chases; not much encouragement to take from first two runs back after a break, including over C&D latest; chase mark slipping but hard to make a case for on recent form.

runners.name: Glentruan
runners.comment: 0-5 in chases, promise at Listowel in Sept, 4lb lower now, blinkers return, can't discount
