runners.spotlight: Two time winner over hurdles is 0-5 in chases; best effort in this sphere a 6l fifth of 16 at Listowel (19.5f, soft to heavy) in September and he's 4lb lower now; poor twice since, though may have needed latest after a break and the blinkers worn at Listowel return; not discounted.

quotes.race: corkracecourse.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Glentruan ran in a good race the last day, is a lovely horse and hopefully he will make a lovely chaser. There's a lovely syndicate involved with him, so hopefully they'll have a bit of fun with him - Paddy Neville, trainer.

runners.name: Rock On Pedro
runners.comment: Flat winner, good run over C&D off 4lb higher last August, decent effort latest, chance
runners.spotlight: Flat winner is a maiden over jumps; 0-9 in chases; decent efforts last two starts at Clonmel and Thurles; has run well both previous starts at this venue and is 4lb lower than when a 6.5l sixth of 14 over C&D last August; no forlorn hope.

runners.name: Arthor
runners.comment: Point winner in January on soft-heavy, 0-19 under Rules, needs rain, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-19 under Rules; won a Ballindenisk point-to-point on heavy ground in January; well beaten on return to the racetrack in a Thurles maiden hunters chase early last month; probably wants softer ground than this; others preferred.

runners.name: Well Loved
runners.comment: Point winner in February, decent C&D effort latest, needs more off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner at Dungarvan in February; decent effort on handicap chase debut over C&D but was still beaten 11.5l; needs more off the same mark.

runners.name: Any Day Now
runners.comment: 1-13 over hurdles, 0-3 in chases, pulled up on last visit to Wexford, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 1-13 over hurdles but remains a maiden over fences after three starts; last five runs have come over timber; pulled up at this venue on penultimate chase start over 25.5f; best form on easy ground; others appeal more.

runners.name: Da Big Fella
runners.comment: 0-17 in chases, good run over C&D latest, place chance again off 1lb higher
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-17 in chases but has run well in defeat, including the last twice; finished an 8l second of 11 over C&D off 73 last month and had a few of these rivals behind; place shout again off 1lb higher.

quotes.race: Dawn Hi + Lo Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Da Big Fella is one we bred ourselves. He showed ability at home but not much on the track, he is crying out for a fence - Eamon Courtney, trainer.

runners.name: Better Than Heaven
runners.comment: Chase debut, 1-6 over hurdles, watch on return from a mammoth layoff; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; chase debutant is 1-6 over hurdles and that win came at Navan in 2021; can only be watched on his return from a mammoth layoff.

runners.name: Aclass
runners.comment: Chase debutant; 0-6 over hurdles; best efforts on very testing ground; needs rain; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; chase debutant; 0-6 over hurdles; best efforts have come on very testing ground; needs rain.

runners.name: Katzoff
runners.comment: 0-4 in chases, pulled up when last seen in October, poor course form over timber; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-15 under Rules and 0-4 in chases; off since being pulled up in a Gowran handicap chase in October; has run poorly over hurdles in three previous visits to this venue and is 2lb out of the handicap.

4:27.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Ciara Pearl
runners.comment: Will find life tougher off this mark but it wouldn't be a shock to see her progress again
runners.spotlight: Won five handicaps last year (including on comeback), four against her own sex, and climbed 23lb up the weights; will find life tougher off this mark but she's fine on any ground and it wouldn't be a shock to see her progress again.

quotes.race: Renegade Brewery Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: You never know with the ground until they've run. Ciara Pearl has won on soft, but not that sort of ground. She had a chance and I didn't think the first two would pull that far clear of the rest of the field - Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ciara Pearl was very green first time out at Bath and speaking to Cieren (Fallon) this morning, who rode her, he said the mile would probably be her minimum trip at the minute. Around that top bend we were getting slower and slower but she's just got one big stride and that's why I wheeled out and let her use her stride down the hill and she stayed on strongly - Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's quite a big, leggy, frame of a filly. We bought her because she's a half-sister to Zulu Girl, who did well for us, and we knew it was a family who get to their best at four. It wouldn't be madness to think of black type for her following her pleasing win at Bath on Sunday. 02-05-24

runners.name: Zayina
runners.comment: Still to run badly and remains relatively unexposed on her return from eight months off
runners.spotlight: Still to run badly and remains relatively unexposed on her return from eight months off; she's only run once over this sort of trip too and is on the shortlist.

runners.name: Mighty Bandit
runners.comment: Undergone a third round of wind surgery; this mark within range on last summer's evidence
runners.spotlight: Has undergone a third round of wind surgery since said to have stopped quickly over hurdles last autumn (jumped left, pulled up before the last); this mark is within range on last summer's evidence if ready to go again.

quotes.race: Remembering Paul "Stan" Stansfield Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Mighty Bandit, he tries very hard. He came with a big price tag and I think he could go for some big handicaps in the future - Eddy Greatrex, jockey.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mighty Bandit looks a nice horse. He did two bits of work and got light, so we've done very little with him since. We didn't really know what to expect but you would have to be impressed with that - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Appier
runners.comment: Serial slow starter who's tended to improve for a run in previous seasons; others stronger
runners.spotlight: Serial slow starter who's tended to improve for a run in previous seasons; resumes on his last successful mark but his last four wins have come on the AW and others make greater appeal.

runners.name: Fireblade
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
runners.comment: Failed to win for the Gosden yard; blinkers come off and the market should give some clues
runners.spotlight: Failed to win for the Gosden yard (raced exclusively in novice company) prior to being sold in January for 38,000gns; the blinkers are removed, back from ten weeks off, and the market should give some clues under James Doyle (first ride for the yard).

runners.name: Expert Witness
runners.comment: Pleasing comeback for her new yard but stamina is a live concern round here
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m2f winner for Sir Mark Todd who's only been this far once, when well beaten; made a pleasing comeback for her new yard on Tapeta four weeks ago but needs to build on it and stamina is a live concern round here.

runners.name: Orchard Keeper
runners.comment: Race didn't fall her way when last seen; open to improvement over this trip; good claims
runners.spotlight: Bumped into one at Newmarket last August and the race didn't fall her way when last seen; remains relatively unexposed in that case and is open to improvement over this trip (from a good middle-distance family).

runners.name: Afloat
runners.comment: Could have done without the dry spell ahead of her first start in five months for new yard
runners.spotlight: Likes Yarmouth and was in good form there for Rae Guest last autumn before changing hands; could have done without the dry spell ahead of her first start in five months; goes in a first-time tongue-tie.

quotes.race: quinnbet.com "Confined" Handicap (For horses With No More Than One Win)
quotes.quote: I think we'll look for some softer ground for Afloat next time as it was good to soft when we declared but now it's good to firm. We had to run as she was 2lb well in - Rae Guest, trainer

runners.name: Sugarloaf Lenny
runners.comment: Three wins last backend but this is tougher than he's used to back from five months off
runners.spotlight: Got his act together last backend, winning three times following a string of defeats at short prices; however, he returns from five months off and this is tougher than he's used to.

quotes.race: Steve Watts 20yrs At Lingfield Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Sugarloaf Lenny got the mile and a half well today, which opens up a few more avenues. He's got an upward profile and the handicapper can't be too harsh, because he's only just winning - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Con Te Partiro
runners.comment: Climbed the ranks on the AW last year, winning five times in lesser company; turf debut
runners.spotlight: Climbed the ranks on the AW last year, winning five times in lesser company; pulled hard upped to 1m6f last time but had looked to have hit his ceiling prior to that and this is tough enough on his belated turf debut.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: Con Te Partiro has been a bit of a big baby and a slow burner but he's learning with racing. We had the run of the race stepping up in trip today, we went quite slow in the back but sprinted up the straight. I was a bit worried as he can be a bit idle but he stuck to the task well. He's a good moving horse, very straightforward, and I don't see why he can't translate what he's shown to the turf - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

3:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Straight A
runners.comment: In good nick, runner-up in 7f h'cap at Wolverhampton 11 days ago; he can go well again
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways at Wolverhampton (8.5f) in January and he has continued in good nick, runner-up in 7f handicap there 11 days ago; he can go well again off an unchanged mark.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Straight A is such a baby. It's nice because he's not had a hard race and he's learnt a lot. Hopefully he'll take a step forward for that. He's been showing a lot at home and he really improved from his debut at Leicester - Hayley Turner, rider.

runners.name: Midnights Dream
runners.comment: Won at Kempton and backed it up with solid fifth at Southwell; he must enter calculations
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Kempton (7f) in January and he backed it up with a solid fifth of 12 in 1m Southwell handicap following month; he must enter calculations.

runners.name: Hes Got Game
runners.comment: Won at Windsor last May but below par both runs since; needs to take big step forward
runners.spotlight: Opened his account in 1m Windsor handicap last May but seen out just twice since, going too freely after nine months off when 11th at Kempton (1m) 30 days ago; he needs to take a big step forward.

quotes.race: Commercial Acceptances Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Sometimes you get lucky. He's Got Game just took a bad step, but he's quite a big horse so managed to prop himself back up. It probably worked out well because I would've gone forward, but perhaps we'd have been run off the bend a bit. Instead, it ended up being quite smooth. He kind of found his own feet and it was about getting myself back into the plate in the end. I ended up behind Tom [Marquand, Global Asset's jockey] and you always know you're in a good spot if you can follow him in a race - Oisin Murphy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Soames Forsyte
runners.comment: Very good third at Southwell three weeks ago; form franked so player off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Scored twice over 7f at Southwell early in 2025 and posted another very good effort when a running-on third of 11 in another 7f handicap there three weeks ago; that form has been franked so he's a player off the same mark back over 1m.

runners.name: Saturnalia
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: On a long losing run be he arrives in good nick; ought to be thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run be he arrives in good nick, second of 11 in 1m Lingfield handicap 11 days ago; he ought to be thereabouts once more.

stable_tour.quote: Having gelded him last summer he never made his racecourse debut until Lingfield in January when second over a mile. The drop back to 7f did the trick as next time out he won at Wolverhampton. He has run well in defeat since, notably when a neck second at Kempton. His last three runs, all on turf, have not been great but he is a solid horse and I am hoping that he can put those efforts behind him back at Newbury on Tuesday. I am looking for a nice run from him this week, but it could be that we have him wrong and he is a sprinter. 29-06-23

runners.name: Norflondonforever
runners.comment: Only sixth in 1m Southwell novice two weeks ago; more needed for new yard now h'capping
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo failed to build on earlier promise for Gary Brown when sixth in 1m Southwell novice two weeks ago; more is needed for his new yard now handicapping.

2:40.race_name: Spreadex Sports Grand National Spread Markets Handicap
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Marlay Park
runners.comment: Resumes on a workable mark but conditions don't look optimal back from five months off
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden first time out as a 3yo but all victories since have come in the second half of the year at his beloved Epsom; resumes on a workable mark but conditions don't look optimal back from five months off.

runners.name: Shelbourne
runners.comment: Won second time out in 2024; chance history repeats itself having hit traffic 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Won second time out last year (early April; heavy) having made his comeback at Wolverhampton; there's a fair chance history repeats itself having hit traffic 11 days ago, albeit he's unproven on this sort of ground or on undulating courses.

stable_tour.quote: He can be his own worst enemy at times and can be quite aggressive in his racing, so I'd just love to see him relax. It's a problem in that he looks like he could win a race over six furlongs but I just know he needs a mile if he'd only settle. We'll wait for the grass and look for a stiff six furlongs or easy seven furlongs, and I'm very confident he'll be able to win a couple of races. In the process, he might mature a little bit and give us that chance to go further with him. 29-03-24

runners.name: Gincident
runners.comment: Patchy last season and was picked up for 20,000gns in January; interesting for new yard
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner for Richard Fahey who proved patchy last season and was picked up for 20,000gns in January; new trainer has rejuvenated many older handicappers picked up from elsewhere and this one is shortlisted under James Doyle (2-4 for the yard).

runners.name: Marsh Benham
runners.comment: 3lb above his highest winning mark; last three wins have come on soft ground in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Has won fresh before and is proven on undulating courses; on the negative side, he resumes 3lb above his highest successful mark and his last three victories have come on softer ground in the autumn, two of them at his preferred Brighton.

runners.name: Dakota Power
runners.comment: Yard has made a bright start to the year but he may need help from the handicapper now
runners.spotlight: Progressed nicely last season but his two wins, latterly off a 6lb lower mark, came on soft ground and he's finished well held in two starts back (AW); yard has made a bright start to the year but he may need help from the handicapper now.

runners.name: Another Baar
runners.comment: Achieved little in five runs over this trip; stamina a concern over this stiff 7f
runners.spotlight: Has done most racing in sprints and has achieved little in five runs over this trip; won first time out as a 3yo, so has that in his favour, but stamina would have to be a concern over this stiff 7f.

runners.name: Queens Road Revue
runners.comment: Lacks consistency; needs a career best off this mark back from over six months off
runners.spotlight: Lacked consistency last season but responded well to the blinkers going on, notching two wins over a stiff 7f (including C&D); her yard's been struggling for winners of late and she'll need a career best off this mark back from over six months off.

runners.name: Amathus
runners.comment: Nothing to suggest he's best caught fresh; regressed last season anyway
runners.spotlight: Most wins have come on easier courses in the summer and there's nothing to suggest he's best caught fresh; regressed last season anyway and is some way down the pecking order.

3:52.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Charlie Mason
runners.comment: In very good nick, runner-up in Lingfield h'cap three days ago; must enter calculations
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run at Wolverhampton (6f) in January and he has continued in very good nick, runner-up in 6f Lingfield handicap three days ago; he must enter calculations.

runners.name: Gemini Star
runners.comment: Signed off for 2024 with a solid third at Redcar; much respected on her return
runners.spotlight: Winless since her debut but she signed off for 2024 with a solid third of 13 in 6f Redcar handicap in October; she's much respected on her return for her in-form yard.

stable_tour.quote: She is a lightly raced filly who has done precious little wrong in her four career starts. First time out she was caught out by inexperience, but she made up for that on her seasonal return at Thirsk in a 5f maiden. She then came second in a handicap at Nottingham where she hit every undulating piece of the course and still ran well to be beaten just three-quarters of a length. She has only run on soft and is better when getting her toe in, but it's not essential. She is a progressive type. 10-05-23

runners.name: Temple Bruer
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford but beat only one at Southwell 20 days ago; he needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways after wind surgery at Chelmsford (6f) in February but he beat only one in 6f Southwell handicap 20 days ago; he needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: Meriel Tufnell Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Temple Bruer was very brave to go through that gap late on. I was waiting for it to come and he did it very easily. They've done a very good job with him at home. He galloped through the line and enjoyed the ground - Taylor Fisher, rider.

runners.name: Beelzebub
runners.comment: Fifth at Nottingham on yard debut in July; had wind op and likely player off reduced mark
runners.spotlight: A fair 7f winner for Alice Haynes but he failed to justify favouritism for his new yard when fifth at Nottingham (6f) in July; has since undergone a breathing operation and remains one to be interested in off a reduced mark.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't see a racecourse until late October, but he quickly learned his trade and on the third attempt, at Chelmsford in December, he came good over 6f. He is a lovely horse owned by an Australia syndicate (Nas Syndicate II & Partners) and I think off his opening mark of 75 he is capable of winning. There is a race at Newcastle early next month that looks ideal and he could go there as he is in good form and I have been very happy with how he has been training. I think he will be a 7f horse, but towards the end of the year the mile should be fine for him. 29-03-23

runners.name: Raft Up
runners.comment: Not disgraced when sixth at Wolverhampton (6f) 11 days ago; he's one for the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Bagged a pair of 6f handicaps at Newcastle this year and not disgraced given he went freely when sixth at Wolverhampton (6f) 11 days ago; he's one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Enderman
runners.comment: On a lengthy losing sequence and ended 2024 with below-par efforts at Leicester/Nottingham
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing sequence and he ended 2024 with below-par efforts at Leicester and Nottingham in the autumn; he needs to hit the ground running on his seasonal return.

stable_tour.quote: He has finished second in eaof his last four races. You feel so sorry for him because nine times out of ten he puts a shift in and always runs his race, but he's been finding one too good. He's fairly straightforward but lacks that fifth gear, so he's always vulnerable. But he'll win again when things go right for him. He's always picking up prize-money, so you can't really knock him or condemn him. 28-06-24

runners.name: Lion Ring
runners.comment: Scored at Chelmsford in October but his more recent efforts have not been so encouraging
runners.spotlight: Scored at Chelmsford (6f) in October but his more recent efforts have not been so encouraging, only fifth at Lingfield (5f) a week ago; more is required back on turf.

5:02.race_name: Leicester Races Saturday 26th April Book Now Handicap
5:02.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Above
runners.breeder: J Kilpatrick & Mme D Ades Hazan
runners.comment: Proven on undulating courses and straightforward; looks set to go well once more upped 2lb
runners.spotlight: Not as good as he was but remains consistent and enhanced his decent record for Billy Loughnane when going in on Tapeta a fortnight ago; he's proven on undulating courses and straightforward, and looks set to go well once more upped 2lb.

runners.name: Jungle Run
runners.comment: Landed a hat-trick last September, latterly off 5lb lower; needs a clear career-best
runners.spotlight: Landed a hat-trick last September, latterly off a 5lb lower mark, before a couple of lesser efforts; has often gone well fresh in the past and did so again on his comeback last month, but will need a clear career-best on turf to take this.

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Jungle Run spends a few days in the ride before he runs and it works for him. He enjoyed the ground out there - Conor Planas, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He has won in each of his three seasons, the most recent being at Chelmsford in May. All of them have been on the all-weather as he seems to enjoy it more than turf. He is a very good lead horse at home and horses like him are worth their weight in gold. One or two lads have learned their trade on him at home and he will continue his job of leading for a few more weeks before we get him out again. His mark of 66 is about right and he should win again off that. 06-07-23

runners.name: Ganesha
runners.comment: Behind Above latest and has work to do to reverse placings on just 2lb better terms
runners.spotlight: Found the ideal opening when winning a small-field Newcastle sprint off 3lb lower a month ago; since back down to earth behind Above at the same course and has work to do to reverse placings on just 2lb better terms.

runners.name: Whats In The Bag
runners.comment: This mark is within range if on a going day in the tongue-tie but there are risks involved
runners.spotlight: Two lengthy absences to his name and has lacked consistency since returning from 16 months off; this mark is within range if the first-time tongue-tie helps and he's on a going day but there are risks involved.

runners.name: Yazaman

prev_owners.owner: A Rhodes, M Short & E Twibell
A Rhodes, M Short & R Swift
J C G Chua And Partner

runners.comment: Stable yet to get rolling for the year and he may just need this back from six months off
runners.spotlight: Stable yet to get rolling for the year and this gelding, who ran up a four-timer in lesser company last summer, resumes looking high enough in the weights; might just need this back from six months off at his age too.

quotes.race: Tattersalls July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Yazaman ran differently to Ascot in that he jumped and travelled really well over the extra furlong, while he was a bit outpaced at Ascot. I think the winner is pretty good and we were beaten by a better horse. To give our horse some credit I don't think he saw the winner coming as he was a long way from him. He's grown up a lot since his debut and he's a grand horse, but he's an out and out two-year-old so we need to get on with him and make use of him. He didn't mind the ground today - Maureen Haggas, wife of William Haggas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'd be a lovely person, absolute class, but he's a character, shall we say. He was a really good two-year-old when he was runner-up in the Richmond Stakes for William Haggas, but maybe he overachieved at two as quite a few of them do. He was one of those where we probably bought him at the right time as his rating was down into the 60s. He was running well without doing an awful lot, but when he got down to a mark of 50 he started winning. We put a visor on and it helped a bit, but it wasn't until he got the blinkers on that things started to happen. Even the first day he won at Nottingham, I still maintain that if he hadn't got a bump near the finish, he'd have finished second; he got a bump and seemed to take off and won really well. He then went to Beverley and had a bit of a troubled passage but got to the front and was well on top at the finish. When he went to Wetherby for his third success, the ground was plenty quick enough for him and the race didn't go as smoothly as we'd have liked, but he still won, whiwas fair play to him. He's got his confidence back and remembered how to win. If he wants to win again, he's still a long way ahead of the handicapper. He's entered at Leicester on Thursday but I'd be amazed if he runs as it looks like it's going to be a dry week. 28-06-24

runners.name: Glendown
runners.comment: His 5 wins have come after a recent outing in the second half of the year; bit to overcome
runners.spotlight: Gets away with a stiff 5f, as when winning at Pontefract last summer, but he does a lot of racing over 6f now and will want a proper test; all five wins have come after a recent outing in the second half of the year anyway, so he has a bit to overcome.

quotes.race: Brannans Have Done The 61 Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Glendown has done it quite nicely, he travelled well and picked up and just did enough to win. He ran a great race at Chester and I don't know what went wrong last time [at Hamilton] - he just ran all right. He's come here and shown he's in good form - Duran Fentiman, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won't be running until the middle of the season. There's nothing wrong with him, he was just a bit late back from his owners. He won three times over six furlongs last season, but he also ran well over five and I don't know which is his best trip. 23-04-24

2:05.race_name: Best Ticket Deals Online At leicester-racecourse.co.uk Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
2:05.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Black Cab
runners.comment: Caught the eye when fourth at Wolver 18 days ago; more to offer, especially when h'capping
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced Showcasing gelding who caught the eye when fourth of seven in 7f novice at Wolverhampton 18 days ago, running on late under a patient ride; he has more to offer, especially when sent handicapping.

runners.name: Dark Tornado
runners.comment: Fairly useful for James Horton; off since June but player for new yard if fully tuned up
runners.spotlight: Posted a fairly useful effort for James Horton when third in 1m York novice last May, but wasn't seen out again after facing a very stiff task in Royal Ascot's Jersey Stakes the following month; since gelded and a player for his new yard if fully tuned up after nine months off.

runners.name: Albeyours
runners.comment: Well-held debut fifth at Redcar eight months ago; significantly more is required
runners.spotlight: 40-1, well-held debut fifth of seven in novice at Redcar (7f, good to firm) eight months ago; significantly more is required from this daughter of Al Kazeem.

runners.name: Exactly Right
runners.comment: Landed 1m novice at Southwell 20 days ago; son of Kingman has more to offer so big shout
runners.spotlight: Very green on his debut, but gelded and took a major step forward to land 1m novice at Southwell 20 days ago; fetched 420,000gns as a yearling and this well-related son of Kingman looks to have more to offer; big shout.

runners.name: Festive Time
runners.comment: Never-dangerous fifth at Southwell on his debut; Oasis Dream colt can take a step forward
runners.spotlight: 10-1 and very green when never-dangerous fifth of nine in 7f maiden at Southwell on his debut 16 days ago; this son of Oasis Dream can take a step forward now.

runners.name: Havana Whisper
runners.comment: Showed some promise at 2yrs; poorly drawn at Kempton final run and remains with potential
runners.spotlight: Havana Grey colt showed some promise when seventh in 7f Newbury maiden on his debut in August, but was poorly drawn when 11th in 7f Kempton novice following month; remains with potential on his seasonal return.

runners.name: Jet Packer
runners.comment: Fair maiden for Richard Hannon but off since August; gelded and not ruled out for new yard
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair form without winning as a 2yo for Richard Hannon, but wasn't seen out after coming in last of nine in 7f Sandown nursery in August; has since changed hands for 30,000gns (also gelded) and not ruled out for his new yard.

runners.name: Regal Guest
runners.comment: Third in novice at Kempton nine days ago; needs to take another step forward
runners.spotlight: Kodiac colt built on his debut when third of 11 in 7f novice at Kempton nine days ago; needs to take another step forward if he's to figure here, however.

runners.name: Rogue Diplomat
runners.comment: Fair form when third at Beverley/Chelmsford last autumn; can do better so considered
runners.spotlight: Calyx colt who showed fair form when third in 8.5f Beverley novice and 1m2f maiden at Chelmsford last autumn; in excellent hands and can do better so needs considering on his return.

1:30.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick 7.3) (Selective watering)

runners.name: Alkuwarrior
runners.comment: The only one with experience, which can count at this stage, but he'll need a deal more
runners.spotlight: Trainer had a 2yo newcomer win at a big price last summer but this half-brother to three winners started 50-1 and ran accordingly in the Brocklesby; is the only one with experience, which can count at this early stage, but he'll need a deal more.

runners.name: Calafiori
runners.comment: Early-foaled £18,000 yearling who holds a few sales race entries; likely looking type
runners.spotlight: Early-foaled £18,000 yearling who's a half-brother to a 1m winner out of a 6f winner in the US; holds a few sales race entries later on and is a likely looking type for a yard always to be respected in early 2yo races.

runners.name: Raging Raj
runners.comment: 24,000gns yearling who doesn't hit two for a few weeks; wouldn't look an obvious early 2yo
runners.spotlight: Trainer has a much better record with 2yos on the AW than turf and is 0-19 with them here down the years; this 24,000gns yearling, who doesn't turn two for a few weeks, wouldn't look an obvious early juvenile on pedigree.

runners.name: Somebody
runners.comment: February foal who went for £20,000 as a yearling; holds a few sales race entries later on
runners.spotlight: February foal who went for £20,000 as a yearling and holds a few sales race entries later in the season; dam, who went close on her 2yo debut before regressing, has produced one ordinary maiden thus far; the market will guide.

runners.name: Super Soldier
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winners for the yard, including Wonderwork, who went in on 2yo debut
runners.spotlight: 60,000gns foal, 78,000gns yearling who only reached his second birthday on Wednesday; holds no notable entries but is a half-brother to two winners for the yard, including Wonderwork, who went in on his 2yo debut.

runners.name: Valor Spirit
runners.comment: February-foaled 65,000gns yearling; dam a useful early 2yo for David O'Meara; interesting
runners.spotlight: February-foaled 65,000gns yearling who holds a couple of sales race entries; dam was a useful early 2yo for David O'Meara and he's an interesting newcomer for a trainer who boasts a good record with juveniles here.

4:05.race_name: Randox Supporting Prostate Cancer UK Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
4:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Ash Tree Meadow
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Back from a break with a return to form needed but he could prove well suited to this test
runners.spotlight: Below par last July/October on last two runs (bled from the nose on second occasion) and returns from six-month break with something to prove; however, he impressed when making all in Grade 3 at Killarney (2m4f, yielding) last May and could prove well suited to this test if he's back on song.

quotes.race: BoyleSports An Riocht Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ash Tree Meadow did it very well, travelled well and jumped brilliant. Two miles was too sharp for him the last day but he went well on that ground today and his jumping was exceptional - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It wasn't really the plan to run Ash Tree Meadow but when the race looked like it would cut up we decided we'd declare him and then make our mind up what to do. We let him run and it has worked out great. He's a very good horse. Sam [Ewing] said he hated that ground and he'll be better on better ground. There is a race in Fairyhouse, a Grade 2, and a race in Aintree for him so we'll see what happens. He'll be entered in the Irish National and we'll see what Eamon [Waters, of Alymer Stud] wants to do. It's just whether he'd get that trip would be my only concern - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I don't think Ash Tree Meadow wants winter heavy ground. We didn't put him in the John Durkan. We will probably give him a break now as he has been in all summer and we will train him back for some of the Grand Nationals next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: This race has been the plan since last year for Ash Tree Meadow - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Graigs Lane Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: I think Ash Tree Meadow is a nice horse. He's a big chaser really and he's a horse for the future. Davy [Russell] said that while it looked like he didn't jump that well he was travelling so well that he didn't let him wing hurdles because he would have made up too much ground. He's a grand horse. He likes that nice ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he bled at Gowran Park last time. We're going to give him a very easy time of things for a while now and maybe train him for the Nakayama Grand Jump next April. I would like to get a prep into him before that, though. 28-10-24

runners.name: Gentleman De Mee
runners.breeder: A M Pommerai, Mme A Pommerai Et Al
runners.comment: Last season's Champion Chase runner-up but he hasn't been at his best this term
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in last year's Champion Chase and well treated on that form; ran okay when back up to 2m4f for fourth of five in Grade 2 at Navan last month, but hasn't been at his best this term; needs to raise his game.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee has run a cracker. I'm delighted for Henry, delighted for Rachael, and our fellow has run a cracker, so we're delighted - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic for Gentleman De Mee and great for Danny. I thought Danny was very brave on him and he was asking him everywhere the whole way down the back. The horse was loving it and responding to him. I thought it was a terrific performance. I was very happy with his last bit of work the other morning, I thought it was as good a gallop as I've ever seen him do. Things didn't go right for him at Christmas, possibly a little bit of drier ground here played to his strengths rather than Blue Lord's - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Gentleman De Mee ran well and hit the line. We went a good, even gallop and I got a good spin. He stayed on again from the back of the last so it was a good run - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were fresh coming here and we were hoping our freshness might be the right card to play and it looked like that. Mark was very good on Gentleman De Mee, he got him out and got him jumping. He was giving him a breather when he made a mistake at the fourth-last but Mark felt he was always in charge. He's improved in the last six or eight weeks, probably for a change of tactics and getting confidence winning races, rather than being held up and getting beaten earlier in the season. He's maturing and growing into himself, he's a big horse. I'm hoping there's more to come, we'll see if Mr McManus wants to go to Punchestown. He's entitled to be a contender in the Champion Chase. He's improved hugely - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee is settling better, jumping better and settling into his game. He likes to get on with the job but Mark just thought he settled a fair bit better today, after the first two fences he said he was grand - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee did that very well and we will probably keep him at that trip. I imagine he is one we will keep at home for the nicer prizes - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Business Club Members Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee had a setback early in the season so I hadn't done as much with him as I would have liked, his sheer ability got him through there. He would look more like a Ballymore horse to me, I think he will improve as he goes up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing the other day at Navan but, when you look through all his form, he never does anything in the autumn and is more of a spring horse. Hopefully he will come alive again in the second half of the season. 25-11-24

His first runs this season hardly set the world alight but he did a piece of work the week before the Dublin Racing Festival that was probably the best I'd ever seen him do. So we went for the Dublin Chase hoping he could translate that to the track as he was clearly in good form. We had Blue Lord in the race, who had attracted all the attention, and as a result Gentleman De Mee was like the forgotten horse. As it was Danny [Mullins] was very brave on him as he asked him everywhere down the back straight, and the horse answered every time. It was a very good performance and he heads for the Champion Chase. Obviously Energumene is the one to beat from our team but this fellow is thoroughly entitled to his place. 08-03-23

runners.name: Blue Lord
runners.breeder: Mrs Joelle Morruzzi & Mrs Raymonde Demai
runners.comment: 10yo; not the force of old but took step back in right direction last time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Three Grade 1 wins in 2022; this 10yo isn't the same force nowadays but he took a step back in right direction when 13l third of six in the Grade 1 Ascot Chase (2m5f, good) latest; on a dangerous mark and not ruled out.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Blue Lord had a very hard race at Christmas and Paul thought that might have had an effect but I think maybe it was just the change of ground - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I was looking at two-and-a-half miles for Blue Lord this year but it looks like he could be a Champion Chase horse after that performance - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Blue Lord didn't want to appear in front too soon because at Leopardstown he looked all over the place and indeed he did that again today. Once he gets to the front he just thinks the race is over and he loses concentration. Paul timed it perfectly - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blue Lord ran well. He had every chance but looked like another horse who might want to go up in trip. He jumped well but Paul said he had to use his jumping throughout the race to keep up with the pace they were setting. Softer ground would probably have helped him at the trip, but we are happy with him and have no excuses - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrick Ward & Co Solicitors Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Blue Lord - he did what was required. It was a tough race, there was no hiding place there as there was plenty of pace on up front. He jumped well throughout, he came under a little bit of pressure turning for home but once he got running going to the last it was just a matter of jumping the last I thought. He jumped well and I couldn't fault what he did. Paul (Townend) said when he got to the front he just did what he did in Naas, he just idled. Between the wind and the crowd here today you could see him looking around himself - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Blue Lord looks an Arkle horse. He galloped all the way to the line there. He's run twice over fences now so I'm not sure if he needs to run again before Cheltenham but the Irish Arkle is an option. We also have Ferny Hollow for that and, if we can. We'd like to split them up - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He was very straightforward and he loves a fence. Blue Lord has matured a lot both physically and mentally. He did very well during the summer and he's looking for the next fence to take it on - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Hub At Ballymore Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a nice performance. We were halfway down to the last before the penny really dropped with him and he started galloping for me. From there, once I got a good jump at the last I was happy that I was going to win. I thought the second [Julies Stowaway] was a fair marker pole after having a run as well. He jumped brilliant. We went a nice gallop for the ground, we picked up and picked up again - the second one wasn't stopping and it was a good performance coming from behind to go by. I think he'll get two and a half miles fine, looking at the size of him I think he'll be fine - Paul Townend, rider of Blue Lord

stable_tour.quote: He was just a bit under the weather, so didn't take up his engagement in the John Durkan. We'll probably aim him at the Hilly Way at Cork now and he could run along with Energumene in that. Daryl [Jacob] got a great tune out of him when he won the Grade 1 at Leopardstown two years ago and it would be great to get him back to that sort of form having missed most of last season. 25-11-24

His build-up to Cheltenham had gone very well until last time when he was beaten by Gentleman De Mee. He was very impressive in a Grade 1 at Leopardstown over Christmas and I thought he would take a lot of beating in the Dublin Chase but he was firmly put in his place. That was disappointing but, now Allaho misses the Ryanair Chase, we'll give him serious consideration for that. 08-03-23

runners.name: Ga Law
runners.comment: Return to form needed but he's 3lb lower than when 2nd in Paddy Power Gold Cup in November
runners.spotlight: His form has taken a downturn on his last few starts, albeit in a rare hurdles outing when pulled up at the Cheltenham Festival; now 3lb lower than when second of 15 in the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in November and he's capable of a bold show if returning to form.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a smashing run and I can't fault the horse. Off a mark of 155, that was probably a career best to be honest. Ga Law slipped turning in which didn't really help him but you can't fault his effort. He lost his momentum and had to get going again but it hasn't cost him the race. We'll see what the handicapper does and I'm sure we'll go three miles at some point - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cheltenham Countdown Podcast Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ga Law had a fall on this day in the Sky Bet Chase last year and it's taken him time to get over it. We always thought we'd get him back but that fall was pretty nasty. He ran really well in the Coral Gold Cup, but didn't stay and I think the drop back in trip and the New course here has helped him. We'll think about the old Racing Post Chase at Kempton and then maybe the Plate or Ultima at the festival - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: When Ga Law got injured during his novice season, I said to the team not to worry because we'll win the 2022 Paddy Power Gold Cup. It's one thing to say it and another to get him back from injury. We knew off a mark of 142 we had to have a go at this. He's not the finished article. He showed a bit of inexperience and there's things to brush up on. Who knows how good he can be? There's no set plan but he will step up in trip - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: "Rising Stars" Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think the one thing this horse does is jump and GA LAW is electric at it, especially as he's a 4yo with so little experience. We were contemplating coming here or going to Cheltenham next week. I suppose when the rain comes and if it becomes a little softer, we wouldn't be afraid of dropping back in trip. He's got a bit of pace, but he strides on and jumps well. We were thinking about the Henry VIII as a possibility, but we'll enjoy today and plan afterwards.

quotes.race: Subscribe To Racing TV On YouTube Handicap Chase (Challenger Middle Distance Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I am absolutely delighted with Ga Law, coming into this with so little experience. He is very athletic, and he will go on soft ground. He may go for the Rising Stars at Wincanton next - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His last winning mark was 150 and he's now down to 152, so it's the right time to go back into a handicap. He has run well over three miles before when he fell at the last in the Sky Bet Chase at Doncaster, so I think he does stay. 18-2-25

What a day he gave us when he won the Paddy Power before falling at the last in the Sky Bet Chase when it looked like he had every chance. He schooled over hurdles recently and went really well, and the three-mile Grade 2 hurdle at Wetherby on November 4 is the plan. That's his prep run before Newbury's Coral Gold Cup, but there have been plenty of chasers who have gone back and excelled as staying hurdlers, so we'll see how he gets on. In the back of our minds there is the option to stay over hurdles. 28-09-23

runners.name: James Du Berlais
runners.comment: Not easy to win with but he's just 1lb higher than when second in this last year
runners.spotlight: Not easy to win with (just 1-16 for Willie Mullins) and his form this season has been mixed, but he's just 1lb higher than when second in this last year (soft) and there were encouraging signs when fifth at Leopardstown (2m5f, yielding) last month; could be thereabouts.

quotes.race: McInerney Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: James Du Berlais has just had a couple of issues but he was good and fresh out there today. It was a good performance and he jumped brilliantly, he'll be fine - David Casey, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's in good order and was just touched off in the Topham in the spring, having looked like he might win it for a long way. I'd imagine we'll try to get him back there this season, and hopefully pick up a nice handicap or two along the way. 25-11-24

He made a good start over fences with an impressive win at Fairyhouse on New Year's Day before finishing down the field when upped to Grade 1 level at Leopardstown. He could run in the Brown Advisory or the Turners. 08-03-23

runners.name: French Dynamite
runners.comment: Ran well for fair way before fading in Cheltenham Cross Country but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Won Grade 3 at Punchestown (2m7f, good to yielding) last October and ran well for a fair way before weakening in the Cross Country Handicap at Cheltenham (3m5f, good to soft) last month; drops back in trip today but this 10yo has an inconsistent profile nowadays and others are more compelling.

quotes.race: BetVictor Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The horses seem to be back in form. I was hoping the fact that French Dynamite was fit would help. I asked Mark to be very handy and Conflated going at the first was a big help, but that's racing. He has been on the go a while, so he'll get a little break and we'll see what the lads want to do. The fact that he gets three miles opens up a lot of other options. It looks like he'll stay over this distance. I don't think better ground is as important to him now as he's getting older and a little bit slower. He certainly won't go on bottomless ground but I think he'll go on soft - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: French Dynamite is a nice horse to look forward to for the season, where we go I don't know. He didn't disgrace himself. He missed out the last a bit and lost his momentum, Darragh said with the sun he just caught the top of it. I'm not making excuses, we were second and that's it. He'll probably end up running over three miles towards the end of the season, he has enough toe for that and I think he'll have got that trip - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: He'llberemembered Hurdle
quotes.quote: French Dynamite is hard enough to place because he might just be a bit short of a graded horse, so it might be a handicap. He will go back over fences and I think he will go up in trip by the end of the season - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: Pierce Molony Memorial Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It's good to see French Dynamite back. That ground suits him well. He stayed on well there but I think he could be effective over 2m on a stiff track - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Loyalty Club Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: French Dynamite is progressing nicely but he still has a bit to learn. I would like to get another run into him before going into Graded company, he's still backward - Mouse Morris, trainer.

quotes.race: Seamus Meade Hurdle
quotes.quote: French Dynamite didn't jump them all well, Robbie said he saw shadows at a couple of those. It was his first time on that ground but he handled it well. He will probably got for the Grade 2 2m4f novice hurdle at Punchestown - Mouse Morris, trainer

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: French Dynamite is a big baby still. The cheekpieces were on just to get him concentrating. He will be a nice chaser - Mouse Morris, trainer

quotes.race: Christmas Party Race Day Saturday 21st December Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: You couldn't be happier with him for his first start. He's a big, raw baby - my type of horse. Hopefully he'll go on from this - Mouse Morris, trainer of French Dynamite

runners.name: Ginnys Destiny
runners.comment: Runner-up in two 2m4f Grade 1s last spring but somewhat underwhelming this season
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who was runner-up in two 2m4f Grade 1 novice chases last spring, at Cheltenham then here; attractively handicapped on that form and could be suited by these fences, but this season has been somewhat underwhelming and he needs a boost from the first-time tongue-tie and cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Turners Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic run. Ginny's Destiny has run his heart out. If he had landed upsides Grey Dawning after the second-last, who knows what would have happened. He is a good horse and I think he will get three miles in time. If he is OK, we could look at going to Aintree with him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Timeform Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was expecting that on Ginny's Destiny's homework as he has improved massively from run to run. I've not had too many improve that much over a short period since Master Minded funnily enough. His work has been unbelievable, and I think he is a really smart horse. He will come back here for the Turners. Stage Star had that weight in the race last year and if they are good enough off that mark it doesn't matter what weight they carry. He is a massive horse and that (weight) was never going to be a worry - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Cheltenham & South-West Racing Club Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ginny's Destiony puts them to the sword, and he keeps galloping. He had improved a lot at home, and he worked brilliantly the other morning. Claudia [Reid], who rides him said to me he is not far behind Pic D'Orhy the way he is improving so she might be right. I might look at the £75,000 race at Warwick on January 13 [Hampton Novices' Chase] as I think three miles around Warwick would be perfect for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Whether Ginny's Destiny was lucky or unlucky you wouldn't know as he galloped all the way to the line and he was still galloping. He jumps and gallops, but he needed the run last time and he is a horse that will always need a run. You wouldn't believe how fat he was when he came and he needed that run the other day. We have done loads of work with him and he was fit today. We will find something similar I would imagine, but we might run him in a better race we will see. He will get three miles in time as he gallops all day. I'd say he will run in some good handicaps. He could just keep progressing. If he can jump and gallop like that in soft ground he will win plenty of races - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We'll keep the option of the Ryanair but I feel as though he's crying out for three miles. He's a bit like Stage Star in the sense he's struggled a bit carrying top weight in handicaps over two and a half miles, which can be a bit sharp for him. He finished down the field at Cheltenham last month and I don't think he's been quite right this season after a couple of hard races at the end of last season, but he's just starting to show signs of being back to his old self. He could be an interesting contender. 8-2-25

He looks a very nice novice and confirmed my high opinion of him when bursting some big bubbles at Warwick this month, including Lookaway, winner of  a Grade 2 Bumper at Aintree. We'll raise our sights with him now, and races like the Challow and Tolworth come into the picture, although I'd be favouring the Grade 2 Leamington Novices' Hurdle back at Warwick in January. 30-11-22

runners.name: Minella Drama
runners.comment: Out of form elsewhere the last twice but has a good record here over regular obstacles
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 10yo who has been out of form at Huntingdon and Musselburgh the last twice; however, he has a good record here over regular obstacles and is 1lb lower than when winning the Old Roan here (2m4f, good) last October; not ruled out each-way back at Aintree.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'd say Minella Drama has been our flagship horse for a few years now and he deserved it. He's been placed in this race and a Melling Chase, so it's good he got his day in the sun - Brian Hughes, rider.

quotes.race: Jewson Fast Set Finish Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama ran a screamer and it's not sour grapes but the way he's gone through the race and jumped, you'd have to think he would have won if the fences were in. It's a shame because it's a great race with a lot of good horses, but it's not the best watch in the world with a bunch of good chasers off the bridle more than four furlongs up the straight. It happens every year, so they're going to have to do something. Whether they have it early or later, I don't know - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Marsh Chase (Registered As The Melling Chase) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It has to be the right conditions for Minella Drama to go against the others (if he is to win a Grade One). He goes on deep ground and goes on soft ground. You have to remember he was second in a Grade One as a novice hurdler, he's a smart horse. He is not the easiest to train. Adrian Lane lives with him and rides him every day and Brian makes it look a lot more simple than it actually is to be honest as he is a bit of a wild man. There will be a day when circumstances are right and we can capitalise on it.

quotes.race: Patrick Coyne Memorial Altcar Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama is a genuine Grade 1 performer. It's been a slow process with him because he is wild in everything he does. You keep him away from other horses, his tail goes round and he does this, that and the other, but he's very, very talented. It was always the plan to come here but we felt we needed to run him a few times over two miles first to get the freshness out of him. He's learning his job well and I'd imagine we'll be thinking of Aintree. Brian (Hughes) wants me to go to Ayr, which comes first this year, but it's all up in the air - Donald McCain, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Sidney Banks Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Drama has always been a nice horse and his form has been solid. Every run has stacked up well, the horses he has beaten and who beat him first time have all come out and won and have good ratings now. He's progressing with every run and he's going to be a nice chaser next season. It was suiting us to run him over two miles because the right races were there but he does stay this trip and I dare say he might get three miles in time. But we'll take it one step at a time - Brian Hughes, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's always deserved a big one, so to go back and win the Old Roan was great. He was an unlucky loser in it last year with his big weight and the fences out. He turns up every time and, as a result, always carries big weights, and it was the first time we weren't putting lumps of lead on him. He's not a big horse and I think that made a big difference. He's come out of Aintree very well and I entered him in the Betfair Chase as you just don't know what's going to turn up with the ground and so on. He won a Grade 2 novice chase at Haydock over two and a half miles and there would be no travelling involved, which makes a big difference to him. There's also Ascot, which has never worked out for him, and the Peterborough Chase, where you get the two-milers stepping up. He's versatile with the ground and we're in a nice spot. It's a lot easier to take a chance now we've got one in the bag. 12-11-24

A very talented horse who has won six of his 15 races and looks as good as ever. He was a decent third to Hitman on his penultimate run before running out an easy winner from Cooper's Cross, who gave the form a huge boost when subsequently winning the Sky Bet. I had wanted to see how he would cope over hurdles in the Champion Hurdle Trial at Haydock but that was frozen off, so with no similar options coming up he will stick to chasing. He is not a big flashy chaser, but he has an engine and I hope to run him in the Ascot Chase over 2m5f later this month if the ground is slow, as that race and track would be right up his street. 09-02-23

runners.name: Soul Icon
runners.comment: Won good-quality, seven-runner handicap at Kempton in December and is just 2lb higher here
runners.spotlight: Won a good-quality, seven-runner handicap at Kempton (2m, good to soft) in December and is just 2lb higher here; ran well when second of three at Exeter (2m1f, good) last time and he stays this far; each-way possible.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Desert Orchid Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Limited Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's funny how it works out. We went quick with two keen horses in front and I just thought we'd take a lead and follow away. Soul Icon is not a big horse, but he's very clever and has got a big jump when you need him. The weight has just helped him out. I think he's been very unlucky. Three or four times over fences he's looked like he's going to win and something has nailed him in the last 25 yards. I think the way the race played out today, going so quick early and not being in front too long, helped him out - Harry Cobden, jockey.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wasn't expecting that at all to be honest. The plan was Soul Icon was going to run today and then we'll reassess and go chasing. He's been schooling really well over fences at home, but that plan is now all up in the air. He's definitely going to come on for the run, which is why the win surprised us. The ground is so vital to him, he wouldn't go on too soft at all, so we just need it to stay dry for a while now - Keiran Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Showcasing Sustainability Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Series Qual')
quotes.quote: I'm not sure what we're going to do now, Soul Icon will probably have a break now because he's had a long summer. He jumped really well today, he kept on improving and it's been unbelievable. I thought two miles is perfect for him and he's got better. At home he's a really good work horse. We've got some seven-furlong and milers on the Flat but nothing can stay with him on the gallop. He used to be mad keen, he was a terrible jumper too and it was horrendous but something just clicked with him - Keiran Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Eldorado Allen
runners.comment: 11yo who is on a long losing spell but he ran well for a long way in last year's National
runners.spotlight: 11yo who is without a win since February 2022 and has been well beaten the last twice, so a return to form is needed; however, his reduced mark appeals on form as recent as late last year and he looked well suited to these fences in last season's Grand National, when prominent/leading until after four out (weakened and tailed off); usual tongue-tie returns after being absent last time; interesting contender if he can stage a revival.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Eldorado Allen. It's like a winner as he's run an absolute blinder. He's turned into a proper stayer. It was a great performance by the winner but we're proud as punch with our horse. He's got a King George entry and we'll see how he comes out of it, so we might take our chance in that - Joe Tizzard, trainer

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a nice first run by Eldorado Allen. I thought he'd travel better than he did. He was flat out turning in and then he's galloped right through the line so he's definitely getting the trip. With a run under our belt we can ride him a bit more aggressively. He'll get an entry at Haydock for the Betfair Chase. We've got three weeks and I'm sure he'll improve. It could turn out to be a good run trying to give a bit of the weight to the winner - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Denman Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen sat last in the Arkle and finished strong and we were convinced he was a three-miler, but whether he's three-mile-two is something else. It was a brilliant ride and we'll talk about supplementing for the Gold Cup with the owners. I'd say there are a few who can win the Gold Cup, but we'll see, and he's in the Ryanair - Colin Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Haldon Gold Cup (A Limited Handicap Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen didn't travel all that well early on and Brendan said he was virtually flat out. It turned into a proper slog. We thought going to Aintree over two mile four last season would have been ideal, but he just ran a bit flat. He was second in an Arkle and off 151 you had to fancy him. He beat the right horse in my opinion. I think the right two fought it out so it was a solid performance. We will probably be looking at going a bit further now. Quite possibly the Peterborough Chase could be a race we look at as he has put himself in that sort of bracket. He could be a Ryanair horse as we get further down the line - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horse's Mouth Podcast Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The November) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Some of his hurdle form was outstanding. Eldorado Allen is a big, strong horse and I think he's the best two-miler we've had. His jumping was pretty slick today - Colin Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: 188Bet Mobile Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eldorado Allen is very impressive in everything he does and he's right up there in our novice hurdle division. He's not flash but does it like a good horse. No doubt we'll step him up now. Perhaps one more run and then aim at something like the Tolworth now he's proven himself around here-  Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We had thought about the Grand Sefton but we're looking at the veterans' races and he could go to Warwick. He could run in the two and a half mile races or over three miles and should be all right in those races. 07-11-24

He just lacks a gear now and probably got stuck in the mud at Plumpton the other day. He doesn't owe us anything and can run in veterans' races now, but he ran a blinder when fourth in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury in December. He should get his head in front in a veterans' race. 18-01-24

runners.name: Latenightpass
runners.comment: Likes these fences; ran well in Cheltenham Cross Country last time; firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Has run well in the C&D Foxhunters' three times, winning it in 2022 (good to soft), and he was bang there jumping the final fence in last season's Grand National only to weaken; this 12yo was a creditable second in last month's Cross Country Handicap at Cheltenham and is firmly in calculations.

quotes.race: Glenfarclas Crystal Cup Cross Country Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Confidence is vital in this race, they have to know what they're doing and switch off to get the trip. That's how you win it. Latenightpass does just that, he relaxes and almost dragged Gina to the front but she knows him so well and sat on him to the last. He scooted away then so fair play to him. I'd say it's [the Grand National] is blindingly obvious. Silver Birch ran in this race before winning the National and he deserves his chance. It's a bit unfashionable but it shows there's more than one route to it - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Randox Foxhunters' Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: I had the most fantastic ride off Latenightpass - he jumped brilliantly. He took to the fences really well last year and you're always a bit dubious as to whether they are going to like it again or not, and he definitely liked it! He's such a nimble, agile jumper, by no means scopey, just agile and nimble - Gina Andrews, rider.

quotes.race: Willoughby De Broke Open Hunters' Chase
quotes.quote: That makes the early mornings worthwhile and Latenightpass was good, wasn't he? He won at Cheltenham in 2019 and is a really unexposed horse. He's been a lot of fun and I wouldn't mind a few more like him. We said if we ran well today and finished fourth or fifth we might go to Cheltenham for the festival and off the back of that I'd say we'd go straight there - Tom Ellis, trainer.

runners.name: Adamantly Chosen
runners.comment: One of five for Willie Mullins; he's struggled to get competitive this season
runners.spotlight: One of five for Willie Mullins; very talented at his best and worth a second look given who he's trained by, but he's struggled to get competitive this season and others have more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Stamm 30 Chase
quotes.quote: It was a good performance. I think Adamantly Chosen enjoyed himself, going a gear slower than he had been in those good handicaps, and he was able to get into a nice rhythm. I rode him a bit for speed, but he showed he stays today too. His best form is on better ground and he was a little bit off it when we got to a soft spot on the far side, but I was able to give him a chance and he came alive when we got to the third-last and the nicer ground. Into the spring and on nicer ground, he could be better again - Sean O'Keefe, jockey.

quotes.race: Buck House Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed with Adamantly Chosen's jumping, albeit he made that bad mistake early on. He's improving and Danny (Mullins, rider) thought he wouldn't have any problem going out in trip either. We'll have to take a look at the Drinmore Novice Chase - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: thurles.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Adamantly Chosen was green in front but he learned a lot today. He appreciates drier ground too and he is more likely to stay at home than travel. He could go out in trip too - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran some big races last year and chased home the likes of Gerri Colombe and Mighty Potter in Grade 1s. We'll try to find a nice 2m4f race for him. I think that's his best trip. 13-11-23

He won his first two over fences, including a Grade 3 at Punchestown. His last three runs have all been in Grade 1s and he's finished second in the last two behind Gerri Colombe and Mighty Potter. He has entries in the Ultima and the Turners. 08-03-23

runners.name: Glengouly
runners.comment: Runner-up in two major Irish handicaps last winter but not in the same form this term
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two major Irish handicaps last winter (2m3f/3m1f) and ran well for a fair way in the Grand National last April; represents top Irish trainer Willie Mullins (one of five for yard) and is not written off, but he didn't shine on his two starts this winter and needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: Richard Brennan Fencing Services Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Glengouly jumps well at home and I think he can jump better than he did today but he got a good start and kept it up. When the mare came at him he picked up again which was nice to see - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly got a lovely ride from Jack. He got him settled going down the back and produced him nicely. I thought this trip might be a bit short for him. I love the way he jumped and he'll be prepared for the final of this series at Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Ladies Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly was a bit idle in front, he was looking all around him. I wouldn't be afraid of going out in trip with him, he will go 2m6f or 3m next time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Marble Sands
runners.breeder: G Codre & Mrs A & K Kepa
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson
runners.comment: Solid form in the main during this second season over fences & he's an each-way contender
runners.spotlight: Below best at Musselburgh in February on latest chase start but has shown solid form otherwise during this second season over fences and he ran well on the Flat last time; each-way contender if at the top of his game.

quotes.race: Colin Parker Memorial Intermediate Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aintree was the plan [last week's Old Roan] but this was the second option. The ground probably wasn't ideal as it was on the slower side of good and Marble Sands likes a sounder surface, but he's done it nicely. He had his two runs on the Flat to get him ready for it. This was the target and he won't be running on too soft ground and we'll have a look at what's about. The owners are very patient and if there's nothing for him the next few weeks they're happy to give him a break - David Killahena, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: M1 Agency Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We will go back and have a look but Marble Sands has done plenty this season to deserve a go at the Ballymore probably so fingers crossed. We will go back and speak to Graeme, David and Jackie )owners) and see what they want to do - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Fantastic Lady
runners.comment: Pulled up at Cheltenham Festival but the return to these fences could reignite some spark
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham last month in first-time cheekpieces (retained); however, she was second in this race in 2023 (soft) and a fair sixth 12 months ago (soft), and she's on a competitive mark if the return to these fences reignites some spark; won on good ground last April.

quotes.race: Randox Supports Race Against Dementia Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a great run, tremendous. Fantastic Lady was going well going to the last but the other horse just pulled out a bit more. She wouldn't really want that ground but she's got through it. I expect she'll come back here, she jumped for fun all the way - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Bud Booth Mares' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've had a couple of goes in this race for the same owners but with a different mare (Casablanca Mix) so it's fantastic to finally be able to put it to bed! I thought Fantastic Lady was very gutsy. She got knocked over at the first fence on her last start in the Topham Chase and took a bit of time to work up today, but she's very professional and will only improve. She'll handle most ground so she looks a nice one for this sphere and beyond - Nico De Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet EBF Mares' "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (EBF Mares' NH Novices' Hurdle Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Fantastic Lady travelled and jumped brilliantly. She was unlucky to tip up last time. She was the one to beat and a very straightforward ride. She has plenty of scope and should keep progressing - Aidan Coleman, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We have some mares' races lined up for her and she's going great. We mentioned the Grand National is something we're keeping our eye on because she'll get into the race after winning the Grade 2 Oaksey Chase at Sandown in April. I hope that'll be the plan and she can have another fruitful campaign. 22-10-24

runners.name: Amirite
runners.comment: Not at his best on his last few starts but on a handy mark and could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on his last few starts but he ran well off this mark in last April's bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown (3m4f, good), when fading into fifth, and today's trip may prove ideal; represents Henry de Bromhead and Rachael Blackmore and it will be no surprise if he bounces back with a big run.

quotes.race: KilbegganRaces.com Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I expected Amrite to win last time but I'm not convinced he loves real heavy ground. We waited for better ground after giving him a break. He looked really well today. The plan was to leave him in the field but we may look to a novice hurdle.

stable_tour.quote: He ran really well when second in the Midlands National at Kilbeggan in July but has been disappointing since and a lot of that is probably my fault. He'll get a break now and come back for the spring. There's a good pot somewhere for him and we just need all the stars to align. 18-11-24

He made a winning debut over fences at Fairyhouse this season from stablemate Secret She Keeps before making the frame in two Graded races. He has entries in the Brown Advisory Novices' Chase and the Kim Muir Handicap Chase and will go for one of those. 01-03-23

runners.name: Gemirande
runners.breeder: I Pacault, A Pacault & M Pacault
runners.comment: 2 wins towards end of last year but 3 lesser runs have followed; has to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Won good handicaps at Ascot (2m5f, good) and Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) towards the end of last year; a case can be made on that form but three lesser runs have followed and he needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: Nyetimber December Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gemirande is quite ignorant in his way and you don't want to take him on. The more you pull at him the faster he goes, and his jumping was electric. The way he ran around Ascot the last day was quite impressive. He's been running in a lot of races around here over two and a half and he's been unlucky. I'm just chuffed for him to get his head in front. He loves racing and he's really enthusiastic - Charlie Deutsch, rider, speaking to ITV Racing.

quotes.race: William Hill Cheltenham Preview At Wetherby Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I enjoyed that! Gemirande is normally a good jumper - he got in tight to one fence but otherwise he was foot perfect. He's lovely to ride, very straightforward. He matured over the summer and he's improving - Shane Quinlan, jockey.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At Vickers.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Gemirande finished his race off well and this was a good spot by Venetia as he was suited by the track. You have to leave him alone to some extent - you can't tell him what to do - but he got into a good rhythm - Charlie Deutsch, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He ran only three times last season after an overreach that took a while to come right. He's in a better place now and hopefully he will have a full season. We'll look at handicap chases over two and a half miles, and hopefully he can get back to winning ways. 23-10-24

runners.name: Bad
runners.comment: Things have clicked in these blinkers; clear with course specialist at Kempton latest
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo who was somewhat frustrating after moving to Britain but these blinkers seem to have helped and he's won at Kempton (2m4f, good to soft/good) the last twice; came well clear with a course specialist last time and a 6lb rise may not stop this thriving sort if he takes to these fences.
