quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bad didn't miss a beat today, he's always been very economical with his jumping. He was very unfortunate to fall at Ascot when he was going very well, but today was deeper race than the last day. We went a good gallop from the start and it probably worked out better for him, because I had a lead for longer. Once I got upsides Tristan [Durrell on Flegamatik] coming down to the last, I didn't know how much my lad wanted it, but he had a good jump and I just held on. It was do or die at the last. If I missed it and Tristain winged it, he was going to win, and vice versa. That's what won it for us in the end but he has loads of ability. He's one of the yard favourites and a hell of a character at home, so for him to get his head in front twice now, it's brilliant. If he gets out of bed on the right side then he's got loads and loads in hand - the days he doesn't want to do it then he won't - Ben Jones, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We haven't been hard on him, so knew he'd need the run at Ascot on Saturday, when he finished third. We wanted a feel for where we are with him and we got that. He's a promising horse who will improve, and I'd love to work towards the Betfair Hurdle. He'd need to go up in the handicap a bit, but that's easily possible. 10-11-23

runners.name: Grandeur Dame
runners.comment: 9yo who has been better than ever this season; failed to stay 3m1f in the Ultima
runners.spotlight: 9yo who has been better than ever this season, winning at Chepstow (2m3f, good) on reappearance and bouncing back from a lesser run with short-head second at Cheltenham (nearly 2m5f, soft) in January; weakened in 3m1f Ultima at Cheltenham last month and not ruled out now back down in trip.

quotes.race: John Ayres Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame jumped brilliantly all the way round and he has a very good record fresh. Tom [Bellamy] got him into a great rhythm - it reminded me of Eclair Surf in the Classic Chase - Tim Syder, joint-owner.

quotes.race: 'Chairman' Colin Baldwin Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame is better when he's fresh and when he wins he looks very impressive. I hope they can keep him fresh, there may be another race to be had with him - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Chris Ascroft Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame was good at Chepstow and I think the heavy ground just did him at Lingfield. He never got into a rhythm there and you can draw a line under that. Watching that today he will be better going left-handed but it was good to see him get his head in front. I thought at the last he was probably held but he is a horse that gets that trip really well and one that probably wants a wee bit further - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a notoriously poor work horse but is working well by his standards this autumn. I was thrilled with his reappearance win at Chepstow, where he settled and jumped well. He went up 4lb to a mark of 136 and he loves to be fresh so he'll probably be trained for the December Gold Cup at Cheltenham; he was a good fourth in it last year. His trip is two and a half miles. 25-10-24

He'd been working much better than usual before his reappearance win at Chepstow, where he settled and jumped well. Being fresh is the key to him so we'll train him for the December Gold Cup at Cheltenham - he was a good fourth in it last year. His trip is 2m4f. 07-11-24

runners.name: Mars Harper
runners.comment: Modest strike-rate and on long losing run, but ran well at Cheltenham Festival last month
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 9yo who has won just two of his 26 chase starts and is winless since September 2023; however, he's run with credit in some major handicaps this season, most recently fourth in the Plate at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft), and he might not be far away.

quotes.race: Guinness Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: This was probably the race I should have gone for in the first place but Mars Harper came out of Tuesday's race well - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Armatas Fire & Security Ltd Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mars Harper did it nicely. He had a good look when he got to the front but he won well. He got a nice run through. He has plenty of ability and I was only keeping him up to it. I still had plenty of horse from the back of the last and was always holding the second - Luke Dempsey, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Has won five times and the saddle slipped at Limerick the other day. Might need to come down the handicap a little but, but hopefully there is another one or two in him. Somewhere between two and a half miles and three miles is his best trip and he handles all sorts of ground. 28-10-24

runners.name: The King Of Prs
runners.comment: Stamina to prove and below par in the Grand Annual, but progressive in Ireland previously
runners.spotlight: Stamina to prove and he needs to bounce back from below-par run in last month's Grand Annual; however, he was progressive over 2m1f in Ireland earlier this season and he's bred to be suited by this sort of distance; further improvement is possible from this 7yo who is not discounted.

quotes.race: SBK Dan & Joan Moore Memorial Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: It's brilliant to win it, and brilliant to have the second and third as well. The King Of Prs was a very cheap purchase as a store, and he has kept improving. He has plenty of size and scope and there is no reason that he won't keep improving. Keith was a little bit annoyed with himself that he came wide on him in Leopardstown at Christmas, and he wasn't beaten far. He came out of it well, he's tough and hardy. All three of them could go for the Grand Annual at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The King Of Prs will race on during the Winter and he will jump a fence - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed well last season, winning twice over fences. He's ready to start off and we'll keep him to two miles and soft ground. 12-11-24
He progressed well last season, winning twice over fences. He's ready to start off and we'll keep him to two miles and soft ground. 13-11-24

runners.name: The Goffer
runners.comment: Encouraging fourth in the Cross Country at Cheltenham and he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Hasn't fulfilled the promise he showed in early 2023 and, now back down in trip, he could do with travelling better than when coming from well behind for fourth in the Cross Country Handicap at Cheltenham (3m5f, good to soft); however, that was an encouraging return to form off his reduced mark and perhaps the return to a more conventional circuit will help; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Goffer keeps on galloping as he showed there and with that in mind the obvious place to go with him will be the Irish National at Fairyhouse over the Easter holiday as long as he comes out of this race in good heart - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bulmers Leopardstown Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: We thought The Goffer had a chance on the drying ground. He probably wants a bit further but he jumped great and galloped the whole way to the line. We're very happy. Davy was great on him. I told him to go out and take every chance, don't leave the paint. In those big handicaps that's what you have to do. We'll look at all those long distance races and he could be an Irish National horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Markaye Contracts Ltd Michael Purcell Memorial Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: The Goffer found plenty and if something was alongside him it might have brought him on a bit more but he did it well here off a nice gallop. He's a big horse and he will improve - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: The Goffer had been working well. He's an improving horse and he jumped great - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's lost his way and we need to find it again. He never jumped or travelled in the Munster National for some reason. 28-10-24

runners.name: Dreal Deal

prev_owners.owner: Mark Devlin & Philip Smith & Nigel O'Hare & Claire Wylie

runners.comment: Two wins last spring but this 10yo is probably vulnerable in this hot handicap
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 novice hurdle winner in 2021 and he scored twice over fences last spring (2m4f/2m, yielding/soft); he may have needed the run over hurdles at Naas last month, when pulled up on first outing since last August, but there's a firm suspicion this 10yo will prove vulnerable in this hot handicap.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: His preparation wasn't ideal and that's maybe why Dreal Deal drifted. He will probably go for the Supreme but will be entered in the Ballymore as well. That was the dream but he had to go and do that today - Ronan McNally, trainer.

quotes.race: WhatOddsPaddy Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He has had a busy time of it and will probably have a break now until after Christmas. Things will be getting more difficult for him, but a strongly run 2m should suit him nicely and we will target one in the new year - Ronan McNally, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BETDAQ App Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dreal Deal got a very cool ride from Maxine, she got him settled and jumping beautifully. He's in at Cork on Sunday, depending on what the handicapper does. If he goes there he will come back in the Spring because he is more of a good ground horse - Ronan McNally, trainer

runners.name: Shantreusse
runners.comment: Made very bad mistake when 7th in this last year; could be involved if handling conditions
runners.spotlight: Best form has come on soft/heavy but he showed promise on good to yielding early in career; deserves credit for 20l seventh in this last year as he made a very bad mistake five out; same mark today; returned to form with good second at Navan last month and could be involved if handling conditions.

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Shantreusse is a real stayer, loves that ground and jumps great. He's a chaser in the making. We said if we ran well here he would run in the Albert Bartlett, we are keen to go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

quotes.race: Happy New Year From All At Cork Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shantreusse put in a lovely performance. He loved the 3m today and he jumped really well - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was running a big race in the Topham last season until he made a mistake and we'd love to go for that race again. We thought we were going back to Aintree for the Grand Sefton but the ground was too good, so we'll now go for a two-and-a-half-mile handicap chase next month at Punchestown or Navan. 18-11-24

We have a lovely team of younger horses coming through and this fellow is among them. He won his maiden hurdle at Cork last month by 17 lengths, which brought him on a good deal, so much so that we stepped him up to Grade 3 company last week in the Surehaul Mercedez-Benz Novices' Hurdle at Clonmel and he did the job nicely, coming home by five lengths. It was heavy ground, a real stamina test, and the further they went the stronger he looked. It is a race I like to use as a stepping stone to Cheltenham having run both Monalee and Minella Indo in it in recent seasons. He clearly stays all day and jumps so well. He is in the Albert Bartlett, and I know the owners are very keen to run him in the race. He is an exciting prospect and is fully entitled to his place in the Cheltenham team. 23-02-22

runners.name: Jetoile
runners.comment: Well treated on form as recent as last May but this 10yo has struggled in the main since
runners.spotlight: Won the Old Roan here (2m4f, good to soft) in October 2023 and good fourth at Punchestown (2m4f, good to yielding) last May; well treated on that form and this 10yo showed spark when second of five at Newcastle in February, but he's struggled in the main this term and was pulled up at Kempton latest.

quotes.race: Jewson Fast Set Finish Old Roan Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This has been the target since the day we turned out Jetoile after winning at Chepstow. All he does is jump and travel. The fences being out has hopefully done us a favour with the handicapper. He has to either go for the Peterborough Chase or the December Gold Cup. I'd say at this moment in time we will probably go for the Peterborough, but we will enjoy today - Ryan Potter, trainer.

runners.name: Lounge Lizard
runners.comment: Won at Huntingdon latest; needs career best today but he's shown promise over these fences
runners.spotlight: Having dropped 2lb below his last winning mark he returned to form to win a six-runner handicap at Huntingdon last month (2m4f, good to soft; won the same race last year); back up 4lb and needs a career best today, but he showed promise over these fences in the 2023 Becher and is not discounted.

quotes.race: Prestige Developments John Bigg "Oxo" Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lounge Lizard was unfortunate because it absolutely bucketed it last time and he doesn't like that wet ground. I'm not sure if he didn't get a bit bored in the closing stages today. He jumped very nicely today and the plan is Aintree. We got as far as declaring him last year, but unfortunately he went lame 24 hours before because he banged himself. He ran in the Becher last term and ran well, jumped well and enjoyed it, but it was very soft ground and he never got home. We set out our stall to run in the race last year and again this year - Henry Daly, trainer.

quotes.race: John Bigg ''Oxo'' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We'll aim at Lounge Lizard at the Topham. He ran a corker at Cheltenham in January and I don't think Huntingdon suits him all that well. Aintree will suit him better and he loved jumping around there before - Henry Daly, trainer.

runners.name: Lisnamult Lad
runners.comment: Now just 1lb higher than when making all at Cheltenham in October; could make a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Made all at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in October; not at the same level since but didn't run badly at Leopardstown in February over an inadequate 2m1f and he's now just 1lb higher than for his last win; often runs well after a break (returns from 62 days off) and he could make a bold bid.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lisnamult Lad is not a big horse but he's tough. I was delighted with his mark in Ireland, we were 124 but 10lb higher here. I rang the English handicapper and gave it out to him but it worked out well - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

quotes.race: Lake Isle Of Innisfree Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lisnamult Lad is an odd sort of horse that seems to get lit up in his races. I got a nice breather into him and he hit the line hard. We will have to teach him to settle better and maybe a big track is what he wants - Ben Harvey, rider

stable_tour.quote: We knew about him in the spring; Adrian Murray had told me he was good and I'd seen him work. He won well for Adrian in a point-to-point last month and we bought him afterwards. He'll go for a bumper before maybe going hurdling straight after. 21-11-22

runners.name: Western Zephyr
runners.comment: In good heart in the autumn but well beaten the last twice and unproven at the trip
runners.spotlight: Won on reappearance at Carlisle (2m, good to soft) in October and creditable second in Grade 2 novice at Cheltenham (2m, good) in November; however, well beaten the last twice and he's unproven at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a cracker at Cheltenham this month; he was just beaten by a very good horse. He's shown in-and-out form in the past, and last season was a write-off due to yard sickness, but hopefully he can progress. He wants to go right-handed still, he struggled round the bends at Cheltenham, so there are a few novice chases around to suit. Ascot near Christmas could be an option, with novice handicaps over two miles and two miles three furlongs. 25-11-24

Another lovely youngster who joined us after an impressive 25-length win in his point at Barbury 12 months ago. He won his bumper at Huntingdon first time out before finishing down the field at Aintree in April. I expected him to win first time out over hurdles, this season and he duly obliged at Ludlow from Brentford Hope. I ran him back over the same course and distance in Christmas week and I was disappointed with his third of 15, thinking he would go much closer. He is one we have kept a lid on as he does so much in the first half of the race and we need to try to curb that somehow. We may go again in the next couple of weeks in a similar novice. Until he learns to settle we will have to stick to 2m, but he is a relentless galloper and will get further. I would be disappointed if there were not plenty more to come. 11-01-23

runners.name: Escaria Ten
runners.comment: Promising run in Cheltenham Cross Country; could have a part to play now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: 11yo who ran well for a very long way before weakening in the Cross Country Handicap at Cheltenham (3m5f, good to soft); he was out of the handicap there so is running off 5lb lower this afternoon, and he took nicely to these fences in the 2022 Grand National (didn't stay); could have a part to play now back down in trip in a first-time visor (replacing cheekpieces).

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: He put in a great round of jumping, he's a nice horse and hopefully he can keep progressing from that. He ran well at Fairyhouse last time over two miles and five furlongs and the step up to three miles really suited him - Jack Kennedy, rider of Escaria Ten

quotes.race: MansionBet Faller Insurance Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Escaria Ten is a nice big horse, he's a big chaser. Whatever he does this year will be a bonus. He's still raw and Adrian said if he had winged the last he would have won easily - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's not been getting home over longer trips so we're going to try something different and bring him back to two miles five for the Plate. That's a race which could really suit him. He's got a touch of class. 19-02-23

runners.name: Excello
runners.comment: Ran well over 3m at Sandown last time and could benefit from the drop back in trip; chance
runners.spotlight: 6yo who reverted to fences with a 1l fourth of six at Sandown (3m, good) last month; having been outstayed he could benefit from this drop back in trip and his top trainer has won this five times; cheekpieces go on; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He was running in some big handicap chases last season yet he's still only five, having been in France before coming to us last season. Our original plan was to go novice hurdling, but we got tempted back over fences as he still had a useful mark and he won at Ascot before struggling in a couple of races at Cheltenham. We'll go novice hurdling now to see if he can have a lucrative season in that sphere. 22-10-24

3:30.race_name: My Pension Expert Melling Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: El Fabiolo
runners.comment: Could build on last month's Navan run but needs to prove he retains his superstar ability
runners.spotlight: Won his first six chase starts, including the 2023 Arkle when beating Jonbon; however, jumping issues surfaced at the end of last season and he was beaten by Jonbon at Sandown last April; fell on reappearance in February and runner-up at 4-11 when upped to 2m4f in Grade 2 at Navan last month; could build on that run today but needs to prove he retains his superstar ability.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo was very free and he will improve for that. He wants nicer ground and we'll look at Aintree for him. He's not going to Cheltenham - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo has run a cracker to get back up for second. He was a bit slow in the air and lost some ground but has run well - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo got very low over a few of them, I know he was a little bit chancy before, but I was very concerned, and then he jumped the last one good, but of course then he went on to the next one and just stood back too far at it and didn't get high enough. Disappointing. There was no point in Paul [Townend] going on after that and hopefully we can look at Aintree or Punchestown with him, but we'll see how he is in the next few days - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo did his job well because Dinoblue had worked very well during the week, and I thought if he made any mistake then she would definitely give him a race. He was very clean today and very good. Paul just sat very quiet on him, and he appreciated that and did his job. I'm delighted and Mark was very happy with the mare too - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hilly Way Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo got the job done, but he wasn't flashy. I think he'll improve hugely. He ran too free early on but once he turned down the back Paul led him on and he relaxed a bit more. He got a breather then and he needed that because Jack Kennedy was behind him and ready to test him.It's very close to Christmas and we might just go to Ascot like we've done previously for the Clarence House - Trainer Willie Mullins speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo looks a two-miler all over, but we'll see. I'd have no problem going two and a half as he's nice and relaxed. He's improving all the time and it's always nice having those two-mile chasers and it's good to have something coming behind Energumene. Over the first couple of fences he was a bit rusty for whatever reason, but hopefully as he races more, Paul might get more confidence into him, but he's doing nothing too wrong at the moment. You feel Paul is always pulling him back and trying to keep a lid on, which he was until the second-last and then he decided to let him go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo travelled as well as we were hoping he would the whole way and Paul (Townend) said he hit a flat spot down the back somewhere, but then when he picked him up he came alive under him and he was very happy until pecking at the last. I'm not looking to up him in trip yet. If a horse can operate over two miles they are easier to train, easier to keep sound, and just easy altogether. I'm hoping he can stay at that trip and hopefully he will be a Champion Chase horse down the road - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Irish Arkle Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: At the start of the year we were thinking maybe we should go out to two-and-a-half but what El Fabiolo did at Christmas and again today it's definitely the Arkle - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was only the third run of his life and El Fabiolo got a little bit of interference after the third-last. We don't know whether it cost him the race or not but Paul certainly had to use up petrol to get back into it. We were very happy with his run, he was beaten by a good horse. We're looking forward to his novice chasing career. He got two little nicks, one on each front leg. He might get to Punchestown, we'll see - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: David Flynn Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: El Fabiolo is a nice recruit for Simon Munir and Isaac Souede. He shows me plenty at home and Paul said he was going easy at all stages. He does everything easy at home and showed me the same here. He's up there with all of those [Penhill, Saint Roi and Laurina, who all win maiden hurdles at this track] - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I imagine he's going for the Champion Chase or the Ryanair. My feeling is the Ryanair and that's where I'll be aiming if Simon [Munir] and Isaac [Souede] agree. His jumping has been disappointing. I think when he meets a higher grade of horse and goes a quicker speed he's just not able to change his mind and pop a fence. He might go for the Red Mills Chase. 5-2-25

On his second run for us he was only beaten a neck by Jonbon over hurdles in his own backyard, whereas we had to travel. This season he's had two runs over fences and impressed each time, particularly when winning the Irish Arkle last month. That was a very deep race and I knew it would be tough but for him to jump the way he did and come away like that he's a serious horse. I suppose looking at the rematch with Jonbon in the Arkle it depends who has improved the most over the winter months and our horse seems to have come on a huge amount. He has to have a serious chance. 08-03-23

runners.name: Jonbon
runners.comment: Made bad mistake when 2nd in Champion Chase; he'll be hard to beat if leaving that behind
runners.spotlight: His Cheltenham Festival hoodoo continued last month when he made a bad mistake in the Champion Chase and finished an 18l second (odds-on favourite); however, he looked more brilliant than ever this winter, with easy Grade 1 wins in the Tingle Creek (1m7f, soft) and Clarence House (2m1f, good), and he won this 12 months ago (soft); he'll be very hard to beat if he's at his best.

quotes.race: BetMGM Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were stood up against the tape and the tape pinged back and went under Jonbon's nose. It just startled him for a moment then you are on the back foot and they have gone hard. I would say there was a stride there [at five out] but I think he might have lost his sight slightly and he decided to chip in and didn't think it was there. Then you are just trying to do what you can. He is some horse to manage to finish where he did - Nico De Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: BetMGM Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon is not the most straightforward horse, but he's just a joy. What a performance. Nico [De Boinville, jockey] said he was very fresh and nearly too much on it. He was out and really up for it. He just wanted to do it and loves the game - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon was up for a battle today. He's a very classy terrier because he just loves the scrap. He is the two-miler that I think can represent our country. We've got to fight against the enemy, who are going to come over in force - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon really enjoyed himself. I expect Nico will tell me he had a good blow between the last two and we now have three weeks until the Tingle Creek. That would be the perfect prep I would say. Like a lot of horses, as they get older they get further and he won over two and a half at Aintree last year which was no problem. But as JP [McManus, owner] said at the end of last season, we are a two-miler and we'll stay at two miles - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great to see Jonbon come back and put on a display on like that. He's a brave horse as he had a hard race at Aintree and I'm proud of him. We had a three-week blip around Cheltenham but the horses are finishing on a good note. Jonbon is a flagship horse and there's a lot to look forward to. He means a lot to JP [McManus] and a lot to me - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Melling Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon got into a lovely rhythm, that was perfection. I've never seen him jump better. He travelled well. I think the two and a half miles is probably ideal. I'm trying to get Nico (de Boinville) to say that he will stay three, but he is reluctant to say that at the moment, but we can think about those things throughout the summer. Should we have been thinking about the Ryanair this season, I don't know? When we did that with Shishkin and jumped him up to two and a half miles, we soon realised he wanted three miles. I'm not saying that about Jonbon at the moment - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Clarence House Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon didn't see a nice stride at the last and if he'd have winged that he might not have let the other horse back. He's lost the battle but not the war.  He's quite a busy person, he lives on his wits a little and the extra wait from Ascot wasn't exactly what he wanted. He's a clock that you can wind up, now we can unwind him and go again. We were really looking forward to El Fabiolo last weekend and I don't think that's changed anything dramatically. We've got to let him off for a little bit and start the preparation for March - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's only two options for Jonbon really - the Clarence House Chase at Ascot and the Game Spirit Chase at Newbury. He's growing up all of the time. I've mentioned before that we had a gallop at Windsor with him earlier this year and he was quite geed up by that and in his preparation. But at Cheltenham and since then he has been more settled and grown up. It was always going to be tough in this ground. We said to hang on to him for as long as we could as it is the sort of ground you can get caught out in. It was essentially to keep our power a little bit drier today. He's an attacker and you can really let him rip at fences but that would've been dangerous in these conditions. He's jumping very well this year - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Shloer Chase (Registered As The Cheltenham Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went a good gallop and it wasn't a tactical race. It was a sensible, good, honest gallop in that ground. It was going to find Jonbon out first time if he wasn't ready, but he was (ready). You have to be very pleased. He was just pricking his ears on the run-in. He has had a nice time and he has enjoyed himself. He should come on for it. He looked like a two-miler there, and he has got to stay there for now because of the Tingle Creek. There is the conundrum as to how far he will get as I'm convinced he will get further but you don't need to - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Celebration Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon is exceptional. He's such a good horse. You can do whatever you want on him - he's so good, I've been saying that for two years - Aidan Coleman, rider.  My final deciding reason for running was we'd find out if he could take these two-milers on who he'd be meeting next year. If he can cope with them, around here, now, then we can start thinking of Tingle Creeks next year - and that's what he's answered - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: EFT Systems Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon was good today wasn't he? I think he loves that slightly better ground after it's dried out a bit today. I think he was a better horse here than he was at Cheltenham, and that's in part because of the ground. That's the way he jumps when he's right. He jumped from fence to fence today and he didn't at Cheltenham. Aidan said on good ground he feels like a two-miler, although I've always thought he'd go as far as you like. We don't have to make any decisions today though - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Sporting Life Arkle Challenge Trophy Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I've always thought he'd be better on better ground. Jonbon gallops like that, but he's done nothing wrong. He's come to have a crack at it and we were tracking Dysart Dynamo, whom I'm glad to see is okay - that's important, but El Fabiolo was doing the same to us. We'll definitely go further - I think he'd go as far as you'd like on good ground. We'll think about Aintree and you could certainly go two and a half miles as it's an easy two and a half there. All being well, they'll stay in Ireland and we'll go to Aintree. You wouldn't know how far he'd get in time though - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Kingmaker Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm going to look on the bright side. Jonbon has had such easy races, I think it took him by surprise when the other horse attacked him like that and he just shook his head. But he's done nothing wrong, he's not had a race since Aintree last year and I'm going to look on the bright side of it. It was his prep, it looked like it shook him a little bit and I'll get all the feedback off Aidan and AP - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Henry VIII Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There's a certain amount of relief, I think everyone was expecting and hoping to see that and like at Warwick Jonbon was as good as you could wish to see, he's very clever with a very high cruising speed.  He was enjoying himself and can go both ways, when you're under no pressure you can afford to be careful and if you want to be showy and have a yahoo, he can do. He's a genuine two miler at the moment but I'd love to find out how far he can stay. Don't worry, we're not going anywhere else at the moment - we'll stay at two miles for now because he's so quick. He's doing everything right so far - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Highflyer Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was always going to be his game but Jonbon was a very high-class novice hurdler last season. There was only one horse better than him and he's safely tucked up at Seven Barrows hopefully ready for Saturday (Constitution Hill), so this was always going to be his game. It's what we hoped for but it's just a huge relief now it's over. He jumps and he gallops and it's a great racecourse and beautiful ground, so it was a good test for him. The fences have to be jumped here so it was a perfect start for him. This isn't a racecourse to take lightly for a novice over fences, but he was pretty flawless there. I liked how he was a bit long at the ditch and then he sort of danced in and he was perfect all the way. Most of our hoses are needing the run and coming on for it and I don't see why he won't be the same. He was fit enough to do what he had to do today minding that the timing wasn't ideal, as we couldn't find many races that could lead us into the Henry VIII at Sandown. We've got two and a half weeks now and it just gives us a bit of time before Sandown. You couldn't go there first time out so this has served its purpose - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon has had a good campaign. He's a lovely, big, young horse and his future probably lies over fences. You have to admire him for the way he battled there, that was tough. He had to brave and he was, very much so. Constitution Hill was the only horse to lower his colours but you can't take that out on him, he's unbeaten otherwise. He's finished up getting his Grade 1 here. I'm pretty certain he'll go over fences next season and he'll get further, I'm sure he would. We had him in the two-and-a-half mile races at Cheltenham and here. He'll get that trip easily - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a special performance by the winner, but Jonbon ran incredibly well. He's a free sweater but that's it - he's always the same. He's a pleasure to ride - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a sharp two miles round here. The ground is tacky, and it was very hard work. Jonbon was flat out turning in but picked up well. I was very happy with the performance. He's such a pleasure to ride. I winged the third last and landed in the back of the other horse. He's so straightforward and we can stop talking about him being precocious because he's not. He's a lovely ride and he's beat a good field - Aidan Coleman, jockey.

quotes.race: Howden Kennel Gate Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Aidan said you can do anything with Jonbon and he's extraordinarily professional for a horse that had so little experience. He was a cool dude the whole way around and he had them off the bridle a long way out off no gallop as his cruising speed is so high. We'll enjoy today, and I'd say it'd be one run before Cheltenham - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Ladbrokes 5-A-Side On Football "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jonbon's a brother to Douvan so he's got plenty of boot. He was on his toes and I call him a fidget, but he doesn't do anything wrong. We'll take it step by step and see where we want to go. He wasn't over-keen, but his jumping took him there. He was only in second gear and Aidan said he had to go on - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're very lucky to be sent horses like this. You feel the pressure that comes with it. We were waiting and hoping for what we thought would, and luckily did, happen. There are plenty of these horses who don't turn out to what they're thought to be and it's just lovely to see him do what he did today. Jonbon relaxed, raced beautifully and quickened up well. Thanks to JP for letting us have him. He'll go back to JP's Martinsntown stud for the summer and we've all got a summer where we can dream of what might happen next season - I think he is a bit special. He's a gorgeous horse who has the looks and pedigree. I spoke to Derek O'Connor, who rode him in his point this morning and he came with big recommendations. It's only the first step of what I hope will be a long and successful career - he's something to look forward to. He's a bit of a fidget at home and wouldn't stand still for long, but he looks magnificent on it and is not a horse who worries about it. He can anticipate things a bit, but I was pleased with how he relaxed in the race and got on with the job - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done his racing, it's all been very good and he's in great form for the Champion Chase ? everybody's very happy, so now we wait for the invasion, from Ireland or France or wherever. We could be hassled from all angles, but that's what the festival's about and I love it, as long as the Russians aren't coming! As ever, though, there's no point worrying what's going to turn up against us. We'll try to get him there at his best and that's that. He hasn't always impressed everybody and there are still some who have a theory he doesn't act around Cheltenham, but I can't see what he's done wrong ? he's won two Shloer Chases, so he can't do much more on that score ? and he's in great nick with three weeks to go, terrific shape. 16-2-25

runners.name: Matata
runners.comment: Progressive in handicaps this season; could outrun his odds if seeing out the trip
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; progressive in handicaps this season (including on good ground) and won by 10l off a lofty mark at Windsor (2m, soft) in January; 2l third in Grade 2 Game Spirit at Newbury (2m, soft) in February and vulnerable on that form, while he's untested at this trip under rules; however, he won a 3m point in 2022 and may be capable of better than he showed at Newbury; could enjoy the run of the race and fare better than his big odds suggest.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata will go for the Champion Chase. He ran his heart out at Windsor and this probably came a little too soon. We've got just over four weeks till the next one and it's onwards and upwards - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Great Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata is very keen but he jumps well. I think there were a lot of excuses for the ones behind, I'm not saying that for the handicapper, but he doesn't suddenly become twenty pounds better than he's been before. We'll discuss options [regarding the Champion Chase] with the owners but the other idea is that he could go for the two and a half mile race [Melling Chase] at Aintree - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Three Counties Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matat is a very talented horse on his day and he's calming down with age. I think two and a half miles on good ground could be key. He has to go left-handed so that limits our options but we'll let the dust settle - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata is a long way from the finished article and he's just a baby. He needs to learn to do things properly and has to go left-handed. Daryl Jacob, jockey

runners.name: Protektorat
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson G Mason J Hales & L Hales
runners.comment: 3rd in this last year; good as ever at Windsor in January; soundly beaten in Ryanair since
runners.spotlight: Has won a Grade 1 and a Grade 2 at this course and was a good third to Jonbon in this race 12 months ago (soft); this 10yo looked as good as ever when bolting up at Windsor (2m6f, soft) in January but hasn't hit the same heights on his other three runs this season, most recently 20l fourth in the Ryanair at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft); soft ground might be preferable.

quotes.race: Ryanair Chase (Registered As The Festival Trophy) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We are happy with Protektorat. It was probably a better renewal this year. Fair play to the winner as he looked very impressive. Envoi Allen got the better of us this year whereas we got the better of him last year. The others were just a little bit better than us this year. I didn't make the ground an excuse, and I certainly won't, but probably nowadays he hasn't got as much toe so slower ground probably suits him better - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Fleur De Lys Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Protektorat is so brave. He's the maddest horse I've ever ridden, he's crazy. He'll come out tomorrow and want to go five times around the gallops but that's what makes him so good, his will to keep galloping. He's relentless - Harry Skelton, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Ryanair Chase (Registered As The Festival Trophy) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Protektorat was great - absolutely fantastic. When you see Envoi Allen loom up like that with all that experience around here, you just think, 'Oh no', but what a gritty, unbelievable horse. Some horses just love to run, and he's like Forrest Gump. He just runs. He's not quite Gold Cup standard. The reason I didn't run him over this trip until now is that we've been trying to win a Gold Cup. It's the one race the boys have not won and want to win, but it was obvious at the start of this season we needed to come down this route. That's a biggie. That was brilliant. It's magic - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Favourite From The Sun Now Daily Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was much more like it. It's hard carrying huge lumps of weight but Protektorat is obviously a class horse and stayed on all the way. He could have done with a faster-run race but today wasn't only about winning. The good result was a smooth, positive run. I don't really know what happened in the Betfair Chase but that's racing. It was a rough race for him and there's no point worrying about it. We're now hopeful building up to his next outing and I think he'll go very well at Lingfield next month in the Fleur de Lys Chase - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't Protektorat today - he put in a scrappy jump at the first and gave some plenty of air at a few others. There's no excuses. I was very happy with his build-up - he'd done everything the same as last year - but this time it's a different result. We'll have to dust ourselves down and go again. The King George is something we'll discuss with connections, while I have entered him at Leopardstown over Christmas. I do feel he has a slight preference for going left-handed but we'll see how he comes out of this and make a plan  -Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cotswold Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're deflated on the day but I don't think this means anything. It will mean a lot to Protektorat's price and to the people who talk about him in all the previews leading up to Cheltenham, but in my heart it doesn't mean anything and we're still on for the Gold Cup. I had to get him really ready for Haydock but if you come here as well as Haydock you ain't going to come out of it in time to go and peak for a Gold Cup. His Haydock run will be overlooked because he's finished fourth today and been underwhelming but I know why it's happened. I trusted him and I thought I'd done enough but the evidence suggests that wasn't the case. I was delighted that he stayed on after landing on the back of the last, he could have been out of the picture. He's sound and happy afterwards and they're all beating each other in this division. The only one constant is Willie's horse (Galopin Des Champs) who runs next week, so I still have our hat in the ring - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Lancashire Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I always felt at his age Protektorat was very entitled to improve. He's had three goes before at the trip and the progression has been there as he's got older, stronger and bigger. I'm not going to say he'll step out of this and improve again because I had him very ready for today. It'll take him a bit of time to get over this and we're obviously aiming for the Gold Cup again. I don't think he'll go to the King George and I imagine we'll either go to Lingfield for the Fleur De Lys Chase or the Cotswold - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Cheltenham Gold Cup Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I hope there's a pound or two improvement in Protektorat and in the Gold Cup little things matter; Wednesday's rain turning up today would have been a big help to him, but that's how sports goes. I've got no grumbles - he's run an outstanding race and we'll be back next year. He belongs in this grade and if the horse says we can, we might go to Aintree as he won't go right-handed - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet Many Clouds Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Protektorat has got an unbelievable amount of talent. We've always known it, but he has been keen in the past and we were just trying to use it right. That was my only concern today. He's a big, strong horse and I'm not very big. We went a sensible gallop but he's got a high-cruising speed and all he does is keep going. He was doing a half-speed and I couldn't go any slower and in the end I just let him go to the front - Bridget Andrews, jockey.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a great run off topweight and it's so hard to win a big handicap off a big weight. I was very pleased with Protektorat, he stays very well and goes up to three miles now. We'll look at the Many Clouds Chase or the Lexus Chase - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Manifesto Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He was very good today. Dan has probably never thought about a horse as much as he has Protektorat this year. He's a horse we all knew had a hell of lot of ability but he hasn't been the easiest - Harry Skelton, rider. I didn't actually expect that to happen, I said to the owners that I thought today was a short-term plan to get a long-term result next year. I didn't expect him to win. It's a long way back from what happened at Kelso - he was beat after the second, jumping right-handed and he didn't want to be there. If you do the same thing, you get the same result. You've got to mix things up, hood off, tongue-strap on. We've re-done his palate, dropped him in a bit - you've got to experiment with younger horses - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Supports Racing Welfare Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was happy with everything. Where we go yet I'm yet to decide, Protektorat has proven himself around Cheltenham now over fences, which is a big test for any horse. We've got that now and we don't want to overrace him as a five-year-old. We've taken our time so far so it'd be foolish to rip the protective layer off - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We've had to give Protektorat a bit of time and it hasn't happened overnight for him. He came to France with a big reputation and is quite headstrong. He's probably not as quick as he thinks he is so Harry has had to educate him every time he's ridden him and drop him in. We've been unlucky losers twice this year but everything we've done for the horse is for the future. Hopefully he can keep progressing - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The Fleur de Lys Chase and the Ryanair were always the two big ones for him this season and he looked great when winning at Windsor. He's come out of that race really well and I'm looking forward to going again with him. There's a good chance this becomes a very deep race with everyone looking to avoid Galopin Des Champs in the Gold Cup, but Protektorat has always turned up when he's run at the Cheltenham Festival and was brilliant when winning last year's Ryanair. I've no doubt he'll run the same sort of race again.  10-2-25

1:45.race_name: Huyton Asphalt Franny Blennerhassett Memorial Mildmay Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
1:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Caldwell Potter
runners.comment: Excellent front-running performance at the Cheltenham Festival; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 novice hurdle winner over 2m in Ireland and sold for 740,000euros at the Caldwell dispersal sale; record of 2-4 over fences for new connections features an excellent front-running performance in the novice handicap at the Cheltenham Festival (2m4f, good to soft) three weeks ago, galloping on strongly and leaving the impression he'll be as effective upped further in distance; respected with further progress plausible.

quotes.race: Jack Richards Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (Registered As The Golden Miller) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We switched Caldwell Potter into John [Hales]'s colours - I don't think the other boys even knew we were doing that - and Pat's delighted, obviously. It's taken a long while to get him right - he's done some good work at home, he's had problems with his feet, and that's all sort of disappeared of late. We always had a positive plan; he jumps brilliantly. Everyone was telling me what to do and what not to do, trip-wise, and I felt he wanted a trip. I think he'd gallop forever, and it's just good to get him back. Harry is good in front. He's such a brilliant jumper and such a genuine horse, and he's better than a handicapper, and he'd got to a nice low mark. He's hasn't run at all badly this season - the Cheltenham run here before turned out to be good, it's just that he had such a big price tag, he's had to put up with that, and you get plenty of stick. It doesn't matter, when they come through that front gate they're all worth the same, you've just got to work away and get them right, and today he was right. They just need time and a bit of patience and you need to learn about them - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harry [Cobden] got off and said Caldwell Potter is a very nice horse but not a champion and I'd echo that. There's no excuses, he came there to win two out and he didn't. You're not expecting to win a Champion Chase with him at the moment. Immediately on Twitter people say 'What a heap of s***', but people have no idea. He's a very nice horse. He's not easy to train, we had issues in the spring which is why I couldn't run him and I still have issues with him all the time with his feet, so that's not easy. You wouldn't want to run him on quick ground. I still can't work out what trip he wants and Harry said he didn't know. He's run a solid race, he jumped great, he's not run badly and there was a lot in his favour. A big, galloping track might suit him better, but you can't keep making excuses. I wouldn't be afraid to stick him in the Grand Annual. We've just got to box clever with him and win plenty of races - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We just wanted to see Caldwell Potter jump well and apart from that mistake at the last, he jumped really well. Harry [Cobden, jockey] said don't be disappointed and that it would be fine. It's not all about today, it's about the future. We just need to get more experience into him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Myles Turns 30 Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Caldwell Potter was very fresh but I think it's nice to get a run into him and take the edge off him a little bit. I was half trying on the way round just to get him to pop as many as possible as he was tearing down to all the fences. He jumped well, he was very professional and I think he'll be better left-handed as he prefers going off his left lead and he jumps left a little bit but he looks as though he's done that his whole life. I'm glad we came here rather than go to Newbury on Friday and he's had a nice first run. He handled the ground well and I think he'll be a soft-ground specialist in the future - Harry Cobden, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Caldwell Potter is very, very tough and we'll step him up in trip in time. He looks very nice. We knew he'd improved and we knew that the rain would suit him. Jack (Kennedy, jockey) was always confident on him. I wouldn't be shocked if we'd step him up in trip. He might not have the class of Mighty Potter, but he's very tough and a chaser in the making - Gordon Elliott, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Headfort Arms Hotel Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Caldwell Potter. Jack said he's a lovely horse and he gallops. He was a weak horse but he's got a lot stronger. We'll try and keep it small with him if we can. He's a chaser in the making, he's a brother to Mighty Potter - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Mirror (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Caldwell Potter is a nice horse. We fancied him for the Land Rover Bumper but he just fell apart. He looked a lot stronger walking around today. I'd say we'll go jumping hurdles with him now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's on a mark of 147 and I'd say he'll go for the limited handicap chase, which looks the perfect race for him. If he didn't have the [?740,000] price tag people wouldn't be having the debate about him, because he's run okay this season. We'll have a lot of fun with him and he'll win plenty of races. The only way he'd run in the Arkle is if the ground became very heavy, but I'm not convinced he's a two-miler. 8-2-25

runners.name: Dancing City
runners.breeder: J Moutel, L Moutel & V Moutel
runners.comment: Grade 1 novice winner over hurdles on this card last year; retains potential over fences
runners.spotlight: Has finished behind Stellar Story at the last two Cheltenham Festivals but was hindered by being pestered up front in latest; otherwise a smart stayer who retains the potential to land a top prize over fences, having been a three-time Grade 1 winner as a novice hurdler, including on this card 12 months ago; remains of major interest.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dancing City was travelling well until he made a mistake at the third-last - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Finlay Ford At Naas Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Dancing City gallops and jumps, he is lazy as sin, but that's what you want from these staying chasers, horses that do exactly what you want them to do. He probably got beaten once or twice early on in his career because of that. That was a very good performance on very tasting ground. He will go straight to the Brown Advisory now - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: All in all a great start, Dancing City was clever when he had to be. I had to give him a reminder before the last but just to make him concentrate - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Channor Real Estate Group Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It just shows how tough Dancing City is that he's been to every racing festival, it takes a lot of doing. It all bodes well for the future going over fences. He did quite well coming back from Aintree. We haven't done that before - Cheltenham, Aintree and Punchestown. It looks achievable so we might do more of it in the future. He didn't show how good he was until we went out in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavani Sartorial Menswear Sefton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Crossing the bottom, Dancing City went off the bridle for a few strides and Paul even thought the game was up and then he seemed to get his second wind. Paul just nursed him and got him over the last as they were out on their feet on the testing ground. It was a good performance. It took him a long time to show me he was the horse that we thought we'd bought, and there were a few times when we thought about shipping him on. He's come right and is going to be an exciting novice chaser - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a small field but you could make a very strong case for everything in it. Dancing City was probably disappointing the first day Paul rode him in Navan. I got to win a maiden on him the next day and found a lot of improvement and he's found it again today. Turning in here I didn't want to be setting sail too early but once I committed him he didn't stop the whole way to the line and it was a proper Grade 1 performance - Danny Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dancing City missed the last and still ran out a good winner, I would say that was a good performance. We were hoping he would improve and it was nice to see him go and do it - Danny Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: The Brown Advisory is the plan. He's a four-wheel-drive horse and I hope the ground is soft for him at Cheltenham. He just gallops and jumps and is a nice type for the race. 5-2-25

runners.name: Handstands
runners.comment: Game performance in Grade 1 Scilly Isles at Sandown; progressive and top on the figures
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; campaigned mostly at about 2m4f but is 2-2 over 3m (including a point win); game performance in the Grade 1 Scilly Isles at Sandown most recently, adding to his Grade 2 wins and prevailing narrowly in a duel with subsequent Arkle winner Jango Baie; chase record is 3-4 and overall strike-rate is 7-9; holds very strong claims, being progressive and top on the figures.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Scilly Isles Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Handstands is a proper horse. It was a proper battle but I felt Ben [Jones, jockey] was always going to hold on. The Radford family are amazing to train for and we've got a plan for Handstands that we're going to stick to. We're going to Aintree and he's going to be better over further; he's a proper stayer who has speed as well - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: DragonBet Towton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was very impressed by Handstands. He's never one who does a lot in front, so he wouldn't want to be on his own all the way up the home straight again like he was. The race fell apart, but it was a good performance. He's galloped all the way to the line, but it took time for him to get into a rhythm. He's dropped back in trip and they went a good gallop, so it just caught him out a bit, but after that he was foot perfect. It'll put him spot on for Sandown - Ben Jones, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Esher Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Handstands has got natural speed but we'd hoped he'd stay three miles as well, so coming here on rain-softened ground was going to tell us that. I'm delighted with today. I think he's learned a lot and we've learned a lot, too. This lad looks like he stayed very well today, and The Jukebox Man has brilliant speed ? we're not Willie Mullins, we're not going to run them against each other in a hurry. We'll see how Handstands comes out of the race and we'll take it as we find it. He's a staying chaser for the future - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: M1 Agency Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Handstands is so raw. He still looks a shell but there's no bottom to him. He just lobbed around there and didn't pick up the bridle for the first two miles but when Harry wanted him he just went. I don't think he's short of speed but we'll have a look at the Baring Bingham after that - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Best Odds Guaranteed Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The plan was to run Handstands and gain more experience, and Ben (Jones, jockey) said when the others crowded him down the back straight he found plenty. He couldn't have done it any easier and we may look at the Listed Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle at Huntingdon on February 8 after that - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At PlanetSportBet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Handstands is a really nice, straightforward horse. He doesn't do anything overly flash, but just does it very nicely at the same time. We hope this can be a nice starting point. We'll find another novice race under a penalty somewhere else next to see if we can think about better things - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He and The Jukebox Man are probably the standout novice chasers among a very good bunch. It was a tall ask going for the Rising Stars without a run and it became a lot taller when Soul Icon went off at a million miles an hour in front. There was no hiding place, but our lad jumped brilliantly and was working his way into the race when he made a novicey error and came down three out. He's absolutely fine and we'll probably lower our sights for one run, with Aintree on December 7 a possibility. His jumping at home has been unbelievable and I think he's tailor-made for the Scilly Isles. 21-11-24

runners.name: Jordans
runners.comment: Faces a difficult task at this level and has stamina to prove over the new trip
runners.spotlight: Ex-French 6yo whose useful form for current yard includes a Grade 3 success over 2m2f in October and good effort over 2m4f at the Cheltenham Festival last month; faces a stiffer task at this level and has stamina to prove upped further in trip.

quotes.race: Guinness 00 Faugheen Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: That was a great run. We didn't go quick and it developed into a bit of a sprint, but Jordans came home well. I thought I had a chance at the second-last but he was just beaten by a very good horse - Richie Deegan, jockey.

quotes.race: BetVictor Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I thought Jordans would go away and win at the second-last, but he just pricked his ears a bit in front. I was in front a bit soon. He popped the last and it just gave the other horse a chance to come back to us, but I never felt like I was going to be headed. He jumped well and will improve again - Richard Deegan, jockey.

runners.name: Quai De Bourbon
runners.comment: Unseated rider in the Brown Advisory but this 6yo remains a promising sort
runners.spotlight: Has useful 2m4f form that includes a good effort in last season's Martin Pipe and chase success at Gowran Park in January; didn't get the chance to prove he stays 3m in the Brown Advisory at Cheltenham (good to soft) most recently, having made a bad mistake and unseated rider four out; has time on his side (only a 6yo) and remains a promising sort.

quotes.race: Munster Hurdle
quotes.quote: Quai De Bourbon is a good jumper but the hurdles are a bit small for him. It turned into a bit of a staying race on the testing ground. He is going to be a stayer - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: ALTO EQUINE Building Solutions Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Quai De Bourbon lacked a bit of concentration, when I gave him a slap and left him on to the last it was the best hurdle he jumped. He's a staying type - Paul Townend, rider

stable_tour.quote: This chap looks really nice. He won three out of four for us last season and the only time he was beaten was in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham. He was a real surprise package. I'm looking forward to getting him out over fences and he'll hopefully develop into a nice staying novice chaser. 25-11-24

runners.name: Stellar Story
runners.comment: Good second in the Brown Advisory; threatening to land a Grade 1 prize over fences
runners.spotlight: Recorded a last-gasp success in last season's Albert Bartlett and showed a similarly smart level of form in last two chase starts, good second in steadily run Brown Advisory returned to the Cheltenham Festival (3m, good to soft) latest; threatening to land a top-level prize in this sphere and chance would improve if there's a stronger pace than last time.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stellar Story's jumping is really starting to come together. That was a great performance by him. Hopefully there are better days ahead with him - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I was thrilled with Stellar Story. If we could get him just to jump a bit better there is a big day in him. He wasn't as guessy at his fences today, and he could go for the Brown Advisory too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Florida Pearl Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Stellar Story didn't want to be in front and the two of them chopped and change. He didn't have the benefit of a run and took a couple of chances. He will probably head for Leopardstown at Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't think Stellar Story was a 33-1 chance to be honest, but we only made the call at ten to ten on Wednesday to run him. He was going to go to Aintree but another horse had a niggle and I couldn't run him. They went no gallop and Sam was in the right position. He's a quality horse. He's gorgeous and a chaser for next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stellar Story is a nice horse. Jack said he'd come on from it too as he had a bit of a blow. I was a bit worried in the back straight when the other horse was going with us but he said he'd come on plenty from it and we're delighted. He was bought to be a big staying chaser - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Nursery Of Champions (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Stellar Story learned a lot from his run last day. All he does is stay. He roamed around a lot last day but was good and straight today and he is a nice horse for the future - Harry Swan, rider

stable_tour.quote: He really devoured the hill when he won the Albert Bartlett and he'll go back for the Brown Advisory. He's too high in the handicap for the National Hunt Chase. His jumping was much better at Navan than it was at Leopardstown and he seems to be getting the hang of it now. He's got a squeak.  19-2-25

runners.name: The Changing Man
runners.comment: Consistent this term; second in a Cheltenham Festival handicap over 3m1f last time
runners.spotlight: Only 1-11 over fences, the success in a Grade 2 Reynoldstown at Ascot that essentially fell apart; however, he's proved very consistent in good handicaps otherwise this term, second at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, good to soft) most recently; again likely to give his running.

quotes.race: Ultima Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Changing Man has probably run a season's best. He is a gorgeous horse and he has beaten everything else apart from the winner, but he is in top-class handicaps all the time and when he went back into novice company he bolted up. He has been so consistent. I think we will enter him in the Scottish Grand National and the bet365 Gold Cup. I will enter him in the Grand National next season, but he will head for the Coral Gold Cup in the first half of the season - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Ebony Horse Club Reynoldstown Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Changing Man absolutely deserved a big one. I don't know what he beat in the end but he couldn't have done it more impressively. It's a novice chase and you've got to jump around, so I'm delighted he's having his day. He'll have an entry in both [Ultima and Brown Advisory] and we'll see but if the Brown Advisory cut up, we might take our chance - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll run in the Badger Beers, he's got a lovely racing weight for it. It took all of last season to get the hang of jumping fences and he's a well-handicapped one who should have a nice pot in him. He'd been progressive over hurdles off a low mark and, although he didn't win last season, it might be a blessing in disguise as he's still a novice. I'm not sure if he'd get in, but he's in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury. 07-11-24

He is in really good nick and was bloody unlucky he made his mistake when he was going well at Sandown in December. We're not afraid of having a go at bigger races and he's a proper horse who jumps well - he was just unlucky at Sandown. Progressive last season, he was well beaten at Warwick on Saturday, but Brendan [Powell] felt he wasn't on song. I don't think it was his running and we've aimed high, but might take advantage of his mark now. 18-01-24

runners.name: Dont Rightly Know
runners.comment: Low-mileage 10yo who is still unbeaten over fences; rising force for Polly Gundry
runners.spotlight: Front-running 10yo who has to defy the stats as only two veterans have landed this prize since its inception in 1981; however, has low mileage for her age and remains unbeaten over fences; bagged Listed honours, against her own sex, at Newbury/Exeter the last twice and is a rising force for Polly Gundry; gets the 7lb sex allowance and shouldn't be passed over lightly.

quotes.race: South West Rail Solutions Ltd Mares' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Don't Rightly Know absolutely loves the job and we haven't found the bottom of her over fences. She made a balls-up of the second-last and I think she was as angry as anyone. She pulled herself together and pulled it out of the bag. We're certainly thinking of keeping her in mares' races and as close to three miles as we can. We might think about Ireland if there's something there because I'm not sure there is much in England. The owner isn't very keen on a handicap and we were never thinking of going to Cheltenham - Polly Gundry, trainer.

quotes.race: Charlie Nugent Memorial Mares' Chase (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Don't Rightly Know can really cope with soft ground and it's huge to win a race like this - it's by far our biggest success. She doesn't have much mileage and has the most extraordinary temperament - she's very arrogant and wants to do it all her own way. It's so wonderful having a horse who so wants to do it. We'll have to see if she can do it on different ground but we'll enjoy this, have a lot of celebrations and then make a plan - Polly Gundry, trainer.

quotes.race: Southwest Rail Solutions Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We knew Don't Rightly Know would improve for chasing and she has. It's good to have a winner, I've downed tools on summer racing and abandoned ship on a few things. It's my aim to train about eight or nine nice horses for good people and run on safe ground - Polly Gundry, trainer.

quotes.race: You Flutter, We Fly Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Don't Rightly Know is a proper strapping chaser type and she can now go and run on softer ground than this -  she doesn't want to be far from good to soft by any means. She seems to be in one piece and we'd be looking forward to going for another mares' novice hurdle of this sort of ilk - Polly Gundry, trainer.

4:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Argento Boy
runners.comment: Useful on his going days but already has a very mixed record after only four hurdle starts
runners.spotlight: Has a very mixed record over hurdles after only four starts and was tailed off in last month's Albert Bartlett at Cheltenham; won Punchestown maiden (2m7f, heavy) by wide margin two starts ago and also ran to useful level when clear second to subsequent Albert Bartlett runner-up The Big Westerner in November but he's hard to predict; has raced only on ground slower than good.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Best Odds Guaranteed On Racing" Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Argento Boy felt much better today through the race. The further they went the better he felt. Ideally, he is a 3m chaser - David Casey, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He travelled well for a long way at Punchestown on Sunday and the lack of a run probably just caught him out. I was delighted with how he ran, though, and that will set him up nicely for the rest of the season. We'll try to find another maiden hurdle for him somewhere next. 25-11-24

runners.name: Battle Born Lad
runners.owner: J Saxby, M Simmons & G Yalbur
runners.comment: Made all in Haydock Grade 2 when upped to 3m in February; could take some catching
runners.spotlight: Fended off subsequent Grade 1 runner-up Wendigo to make all on hurdling debut at Hexham (2m, soft; front pair clear) in October and again dominated from the front when upped to 3m for Haydock Grade 2 in February (good to soft); may not be entirely straightforward but could take some catching.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Prestige Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His form has worked out very well and Battle Born Lad deserved a chance at this, but he had to come and do it. It was a big step up in distance, but everything went to plan. He's not an easy ride as he's free-going, he hangs and always looks for a way out. He was still full of it, I turned in and couldn't believe how well I was going. I'd say Cheltenham would be too soon, but there's always Aintree - Jamie Hamilton, jockey.

runners.name: Califet En Vol
runners.comment: 2m3f Listed winner in February and open to improvement over this new trip; major player
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to subsequent dual Grade 1 winner The New Lion at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) in November, on second hurdle run, and went one better in Huntingdon Listed race (2m3f, good to soft) in February; that form is among the best on offer here and he's open to improvement over the new trip.

quotes.race: Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew if Califet En Vol was in the argument two out that he would come home strongly and he's basically outstayed them. We'd rather this race be two miles and five than just short of two and a half but he overcame it and was strong through the finish. I don't think Cheltenham is the right way to go with him this year as he's still just a baby and there is a three-mile novice at Aintree and beyond that a race at Ayr, although we would have to mind him if we went there as he likes to get his toe in. We won this race with Shishkin a few years ago and hopefully this horse can be in the same sentence as him down the line - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Second in a point-to-point, he then made an extremely encouraging debut in a bumper at Ayr in April, a race we've used in the past. He's done very well over the summer and has a very bright future over hurdles. 22-10-24

runners.name: Crest Of Fortune
runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: 2-5 over hurdles after last month's Ayr novice win; up from 2m4f today; improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Too good for Jupiter Des Mottes in Ayr novice (2m4f, soft) last month and now 2-5 over hurdles; should be fine on today's faster ground but the combination of new trip and first-time tongue-tie needs to unlock significant improvement; blinkers (worn for last two races) discarded.

quotes.race: JPR Phoenix Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're hoping Crest Of Fortune will make into a Graded novice horse. He's gone and done it straight away, so we'll try and look after him now and see what the best sort of programme is for him. He's only four, so we don't want to over-face him, but he's a nice horse and his jumping was good enough for us to run him in a nice novice now. He was quite fresh, but he's straightforward at home and is very relaxed in his work. He'll have learned plenty about being in a bigger field and he's a gorgeous looking horse. Although he did a bit wrong in terms of how keen he was, he came through it like a nice horse and put the race to bed quite soon - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He really took the eye at Ffos Las on Sunday. He was fresh and keen and didn't really help himself, which he isn't normally like at home, but he jumped fluently and put in a really strong performance. He looks a smart horse and we're hoping he'll be a Graded novice hurdler. I'd like to think he'll end up in the top races - he's got a good pedigree and he's spot on in every way at home. We'll try and make the most of this season and something like an introductory hurdle would be ideal next. 14-11-24

He's unraced but has a smart pedigree - the dam got black type and bred a nice horse with Gordon Elliott, Pour Les Filles, who was fifth in the Aintree bumper in April. We'll train him for the sales bumper at Newbury in March, which we won for the same owners last season. It might be handy to get a run into him before that, purely from a ballot perspective, but he's a nice youngster. 12-10-23

runners.name: Jacobs Ladder
runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles after winning heavy-ground Grade 3 in February; upped from 2m4f today
