runners.spotlight: Asserted on run-in to win Grade 3 at Naas (2m4f, heavy) six weeks ago and is now 2-3 over hurdles; encounters much faster ground here but is one of a few in the line-up with scope for improvement over 3m; respected.

quotes.race: Michael Purcell Memorial Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jacob's Ladder has done it quite nicely in the end. Sam [Ewing] thought he was struggling with a circuit to go but in fairness to him he showed loads of guts. Sam held onto him for as long as he could up the home straight as it's really tough going out there. It's lovely for him to back up the win the last day and hopefully he can go on and build on it. He's a nice, big horse and he'll be a chaser for the future - Lisa O'Neill, stable's representative.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Jacob's Ladder is a nice horse and I'm glad to see him win as we have a lot of nice horses at home. He'll go jumping now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He was only just caught in a bumper at the Punchestown festival and was probably beaten by a good horse that day. We'll probably start him back in a bumper soon. 28-10-24

runners.name: Jet Blue

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Brillantissime, Couetil Elevage Et Al

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Bristol Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet Blue is a nice horse and I knew the step up to three miles would suit. He galloped really strongly all the way to the line. He has always been a little bit sticky at his jumps. We went a nice gallop and I just thought I'd take my time on the first lap and put him into it on the next lap. Once I got him in the van, he was a lot happier - James Reveley, rider.

runners.name: Julius Des Pictons
runners.comment: Creditable third in 2m Listed race in February but needs improvement over new trip here
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with two wins (2m4f/2m) and was a creditable third when upped to Listed level at Exeter (2m, good to soft) in February but today's much longer trip needs to enable considerable improvement.

quotes.race: Play Coral 'Racing-Super-Series' For Free Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Julius Des Pictons is a really lovely horse and we think a lot of him. It was Gav's [Sheehan] idea to come back to two miles and it's been vindicated as he's won that quite easily. He got to the front very well, pricked his ears a little bit but I think he's a really smart horse. We'll work our way and there's the Listed race at Exeter or we could look at the Sidney Banks over two and a half. He could be one for Aintree or Cheltenham so it's very exciting - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

runners.name: Jupiter Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Quite comfortably held by Crest Of Fortune when second in Ayr novice last month
runners.spotlight: Represents yard with good record in this race but, having won by only a neck on hurdle debut at Newcastle in January, he was quite comfortably held by Crest Of Fortune when second at Ayr (also 2m4f on soft) last month.

runners.name: King Of Answers
runners.comment: Won Newcastle maiden in good style two starts ago but well held since; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Improved to win Newcastle maiden (2m4f, good to soft) in good style in February but last month's well-held fourth at Uttoxeter was disappointing (raced too freely); moves up in trip today; riding arrangements suggest Jupiter Des Mottes is the stable's main hope.

runners.name: Laganhill
runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Disappointed in Grade 2 last time but was 2-2 beforehand; first run beyond 2m2f today
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground novice hurdles at Haydock (1m7f) and Bangor (2m) on first two starts; disappointed in 2m2f Grade 2 at Kelso (good to soft) last month but remains unexposed and this hike up to 3m is an interesting move.

runners.name: Minella Rescue
runners.comment: Ran well in 3m handicap last month but form is well short of the standard required
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner; yet to run a bad race over hurdles but his close third of five at Haydock (3m, good) last month came in a 0-120 handicap and his form is well short of the standard required here.

quotes.race: Grace & Dotty Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Rescue looks exceptional. He was recommended to me by some good scouts and Terence was also very complimentary. I think he's everything they've said he'd be. I've got my eye on the bumper at Aintree but we'll take it day by day so we'll see. We've schooled him and he jumps well but I don't want to run over hurdles until we've exhausted the bumper route. It's very exciting - Gary Hanmer, trainer.

runners.name: Mister Meggit
runners.comment: Created very good impression when winning easily on hurdle debut here in November
runners.spotlight: Very unexposed 7yo who collected two bumpers on soft and heavy ground last season and created a very good impression when winning easily here (2m4f, good) on hurdling debut in November; not seen since but his form has been well advertised by the placed horses in the meantime and connections are evidently keen to move him up in trip again; tongue-tie fitted.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Daily Money Back Meetings EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mister Meggit is an amazing horse in that he doesn't show you anything at home but thank God he lights up when he comes racing ? the last one we really had like that was Synchronised [the 2012 Cheltenham Gold Cup winner] who also showed you nothing at home. The way he is over hurdles we'll stick with that for the moment ? he might not need to go chasing! We'll get over today and see, today was the plan and now we could look at something like the Challow Hurdle - Jonjo O'nNeill, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did well in bumpers last season but clipped heels and was lucky to stand up in the Grade 2 at Aintree in April. It's hard to know what trip he wants because he won with speed on his first start at Carlisle and then looked like a proper stayer at Doncaster. He's not flash at home and I think he'll probably start off over two and a half miles over hurdles and could run at Aintree on Saturday. If he can translate his form from bumpers to hurdles, you'd have to be excited by him. 06-11-24

runners.name: Moon Rocket
runners.comment: Second in two 3m Grade 2 hurdles this year; can pose a threat if aided by new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Launched hurdling career with two wins (2m5f/3m) and finished second in 3m Grade 2s on next two outings, more recently behind Battle Born Lad at Haydock (good to soft) in February; untested on ground quicker than good to soft but has each-way claims at least if boosted by new cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Jordan Volumix Concrete Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Moon Rocket is a really nice horse - good and solid.  You don't look at him and think he'll be an amazing chaser, but that will be his game.  At Doncaster he hung left late and he did that again here, but when I went for the better ground he picked up well - Tom Bellamy, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He caught our eye at the sales in April after winning a point-to-point in Ireland and we'll go straight novice hurdling with him, hopefully very soon. 19-11-24

runners.name: Western Knight
runners.comment: Held in Grade 2 races on last two hurdling starts but drying ground might aid his cause
runners.spotlight: Made bright start to hurdling career, winning twice on good ground (2m4f/2m5f); no match for winner when upped to 3m for Cheltenham Grade 2 in December and held when losing his jockey between last two flights in Doncaster Grade 2 in January, but drying ground might aid his cause.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Registered As The Bristol Novices' Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Western Knight has run well and it's an improvement from Ascot. We're chuffed to bits and he'll be a fine chaser next season. He's had three runs this side of Christmas so we just give him an easy couple of weeks. There's the River Don as well but we plan to come back here in March that's for certain - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

quotes.race: Restorations UK Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Western Knight is an improver. He jumped much slicker than he did at Uttoxeter with experience under his belt and he's clearly got an engine. He's a big horse and softer ground shouldn't inconvenience him. He's two from two over hurdles now and you'd have to have a look at something like the Challow over Christmas. He deserves to - Joe Tizzard, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in a bumper last season and he's a big, strong boy who'll go novice hurdling now. His schooling has gone well and he'll be ready to run before too long. I like him and he's grown quite a bit through the summer. 10-11-23

runners.name: Familiar Dreams
runners.comment: Smart in bumpers last year and a recent Grade 3 hurdle winner (albeit in a mares' race)
runners.spotlight: Big improver in bumpers for previous yard in first half of 2024, the latest of four wins gained in mares' Grade 3 at Punchestown (good to yielding); 2-3 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott this year and although this is much deeper than the Grade 3 mares' race she won at Limerick (2m6f, yielding) three weeks ago she still features prominently in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: She's a talented mare and I think she will come on loads for her run at Punchestown. She wasn't even near fully fit for that.   19-2-25

runners.name: Holloway Queen
runners.comment: Quite impressive winner of soft-ground Listed mares' race in December; below form since
runners.spotlight: Drew 15l clear to win Listed mares' race at Haydock (2m3f, heavy) in December, on second hurdling start, but disappointing favourite in Sandown Grade 2 for mares (2m4f, soft) in February and it's hard to tell whether today's different trip-and-ground combination will suit.

quotes.race: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed) (Reg' As The Abram Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Holloway Queen is a lovely mare, she just seems to quicken up and she loves that heavy ground. She's very genuine as well and it's onwards and upwards - Nico De Boinville, jockey.

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We went a nice, even gallop on that ground - it's hard work. I wasn't quite sure what Holloway Queen was going to find at the end but she answered every call and kept picking up all the way to the line. That was a really good start and we'll go from here - Nico De Boinville, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: We had her for only a short while in the spring after she finished second in her point-to-point and never did anything serious with her, so she's a bit of an unknown quantity. Hopefully she gives her well-supported team a lot of fun. 22-10-24

2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Blues Singer
runners.comment: Bumper winner; open to improvement on second hurdle start but he'd be a shock winner today
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who was thrown in at the deep end on hurdle debut in the Grade 2 Dovecote at Kempton (2m, good to soft) in February, when 24l fourth to Tripoli Flyer; likely to improve but he'd be a shock winner today.

quotes.race: Unibet "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blues Singer is a nice horse, a homebred whom we've had a few months. I love this race because it's just four-year-olds and they don't have to take on older horses. I think we'll put him away and if he did run again this season it wouldn't be at Aintree. That's not because he's not good enough, but because he's only four - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we rate very highly. He's always pleased us and was very impressive in winning a bumper at Kempton last March on his only start. He'll probably start back in a bumper and if he won again we might stay down that route, otherwise he'll switch to hurdles. 25-10-24

We think a lot of him. He's done everything we've asked of him and he was very impressive when winning a bumper at Kempton last March on his debut. He'll probably start back in a bumper, and if he wins again we might stay down that route, otherwise he'll switch to hurdles. 07-11-24

runners.name: Jet To Vegas
runners.comment: Grade 2 win at Kelso latest; needs another step forward but has done nothing but improve
runners.spotlight: Point winner (good to yielding) who was runner-up on first three rules starts before easily winning an Ayr novice (2m, soft); followed up in Grade 2 at Kelso (2m2f, good to soft) last month; jumped to the right last time, which would be a negative at another left-handed track today, and needs another step forward, but he's done nothing but improve and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet To Vegas is lovely. I knew the trip was right for him. He normally has to go right handed but it was worthwhile taking a chance here. As he got tired he jumped straight, when he was fresh he jumped right handed. He'll go to Aintree - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a point-to-point winner who ran a mighty race in a Carlisle bumper and I'd definitely include him in people's lists. He's going to be lovely over hurdles. 30-10-24

runners.name: Joltin N Jiving
runners.comment: Impressed at Carlisle but this is much hotter; others have more substance to their claims
runners.spotlight: Point winner (good to yielding) who was second on hurdle debut at Bangor (2m, good to soft) then comfortably went one better at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft); it remains to be seen where his limitations lie but he takes on vastly tougher opposition here; others have more substance to their claims.

runners.name: Karbau
runners.comment: Easy win at Punchestown; tailed off in the Supreme but not written off for Willie Mullins
runners.spotlight: French bumper winner (good to soft) who easily made all at Punchestown (2m, heavy) in January on second hurdle start; tailed off at 40-1 in the Supreme Novices' (2m, good to soft) and Paul Townend rides Willie Mullins' other runner Salvator Mundi, but he's not written off for his master trainer.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Karbau put up a very nice performance there. He came on a lot for his first run and his jumping was really good. He is entered in the Supreme and the Turners - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Romeo Coolio
runners.comment: Third in the Supreme Novices' and holds leading form claims for top Irish yard
runners.spotlight: Commanding win in Grade 1 Future Champions at Leopardstown (2m, yielding) in December and beaten just over 7l when third in the Supreme Novices' at Cheltenham (2m, good to soft) last month; has won on good to yielding; holds leading form claims and is in good hands to continue to progress.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Obviously it didn't go to plan the last day and we all went home a bit disappointed, so I'm delighted for the boys who own Romeo Coolio. Looking at that, I'd say a fast gallop is what he needs. He looked good there today. We said after the last day we were going to go on and keep it simple. I'd imagine he'll probably go for the Supreme next - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tayto Group Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Romeo Coolio is a good horse and a real two-mile horse. The Royal Bond might be where he goes next - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We know how to ride him now. I won't lie, I was gutted when he was beaten in the Royal Bond but we rode him for speed that day and I think he's better when you're more positive on him and he can use his jumping properly. He's by Kayf Tara so I was keen to freshen him up after Christmas. That's why we didn't go to the Dublin Racing Festival. He looks great, he's working great and I think he's got a great each-way chance. Obviously, Kopek Des Bordes is going to be hard to beat. 19-2-25

runners.name: Royal Infantry
runners.comment: Disappointing last time but wind op since; had previously looked one to follow; e-w chance
runners.spotlight: Listed bumper winner who made it 2-2 over hurdles (2m/1m7f, good/soft) when easily landing a warm introductory race at Haydock in December; disappointing in Grade 2 there next time and this is even tougher, but he returns having had wind surgery and could have an each-way shout if back on song.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royal Infantry was hanging a bit left and didn't travel so well down the back, it's just one of those days. Nothing looks horrendous, he's just underperformed but it is a bad day to underperform - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: TrustATrader Approved And Reviewed Tradespeople 'Introductory' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very impressive performance and we think a lot of Royal Infantry. I didn't think he'd get beat today - we have a lot of confidence in him and he has a lot of class. He'll be better on better ground but can handle an easier surface - Craig Buckingham, joint-owner.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Beacons Bumper (A Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race) (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Royal Infantry has won races at flat tracks and will get his chance around Cheltenham at some point because he's a high-class horse, but I don't think we need to subject to the festival and the bumper there in a few weeks. We'll look at Aintree. Let It Rain will go to Cheltenham and gets an allowance. I wouldn't say she'd go straight past him, but I think it's telling his runs have been on flat tracks so we'll stick to that. He's good. He's a bit unassuming. With the likes of My Drogo, there was a lot of flash and exuberance and you were always keeping a lid on them, but he doesn't shout about himself. He'll stay, but is not slow and we'll start over hurdles next season over two miles - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won well on his first start over hurdles, over two miles, and as a Listed bumper winner last season we'd like to think he'll be able to climb up the grades. He'll improve as the campaign goes on and go up in trip at some stage. 12-11-24

runners.name: Rubber Ball
runners.comment: Arrives on the back of two wins but lots of improvement is needed now up in grade
runners.spotlight: Point winner who easily won a maiden hurdle at Uttoxeter (2m, good to soft) in January on his fourth rules start and followed up in Newbury novice (2m, soft) in February, when 1l ahead of Tutti Quanti who was subsequently a 28l sixth in the Supreme Novices'; a faster gallop in this higher grade could play to his strengths but lots of improvement is needed.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Prices Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was probably asking too much of Rubber Ball today - it was only two weeks since Uttoxeter and he ran on the 2nd of January as well - but I wanted to come here. It's a big, galloping track and I thought it was made for him. I'd see no harm in stepping him up in trip if the ground was quick. This is the softest he's run on before, so perhaps stamina has won it for him - Neil King, trainer.

runners.name: Salvator Mundi

prev_owners.owner: Genetique Obstacle, Haras Du Saubouas & Mme Marine Pineda

runners.comment: Fifth in the Supreme Novices'; has work to do but he may well be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Easily won maiden hurdle at Tipperary (2m, good to yielding) last May and did well to win Grade 2 Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle at Punchestown (2m1f, soft) in January having lacked fluency; about 11l behind third-placed Romeo Coolio when fifth in the Supreme Novices' (2m, good to soft) last month and this headstrong sort now goes without his usual hood, but there can be optimism he's capable of better than he showed at Cheltenham; possible player.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Club Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Salvator Mundi was fresh and it was messy so I would say it was going to be hard to be impressive. We know he can jump but he didn't jump well today because I couldn't let him. He had to dig in then off the bend on tacky ground in the straight. He had to find plenty. It's hard to be impressive on that ground but at least he won. He'll have to build on it but I think he will. He has gears and on that ground it's hard to use them to the best effect. I'd say a stronger run race on looser ground, wetter ground even, would help him - Paul Townend, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for the Supreme Novice. He has a very tender mouth, as we saw at Punchestown. I think he has a lot of tactical speed, but he didn't jump so well last time because they were going so slow. After looking like he had blown up, once he got his second wind he just came through and won convincingly. I loved it. It takes a good horse to do that in good company. It's going to be interesting to see which one Paul rides, but I think this one will need to do a lot at home. 5-2-25

runners.name: Tripoli Flyer
runners.comment: Impressive in the Dovecote; jumping is a worry but he could have a major say nevertheless
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Grade 2 bumper at this meeting 12 months ago (2m1f, good to soft) and he completed a hurdling hat-trick in the Grade 2 Dovecote at Kempton (2m, good to soft) in February; unraced on good ground; his jumping is a worry in this higher grade but he comfortably accounted for some useful types last time and can have a major say if minimising the mistakes.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dovecote Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tripoli Flyer has got a huge engine. Johnny said you can put him where you want in a race, he's got an explosive bit of speed about him. He thought he could have waited a bit longer maybe but he got the job done and we were here to win this. I think he's genuinely better going right-handed and he does jump a bit right, but if it's nice ground I think he's earned his chance to go to the Supreme. He's won plenty now and definitely deserves a go - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.  We'll have a coffee on Monday morning and see where we go. I feel like Aintree owes us one after Tripoli Flyer got beat there last year although I have to be careful what I say as we were beaten by the stable's other runner! - Ismail El Magdoub, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He's going for the Dovecote first and we'll see how that goes. I was impressed with him at Musselburgh ? once Johnny [Burke] opened him up he really came alive, and I loved the way he jumped when they were going fast. Hopefully he can go well at Kempton and then go on to Cheltenham. Better ground will suit. 18-2-25

runners.name: Diva Luna
runners.comment: Grade 2 bumper win here last April; third at Cheltenham Festival; might be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Won the Grade 2 mares' bumper here 12 months ago (2m1f, soft) and has improved with each of her four runs over hurdles, last time finishing third in the Grade 2 mares' novice at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft); unraced on good ground; could have more to offer now back here; might be thereabouts.

quotes.race: Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Dawn Run Mares' Novices' Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I'd always thought Diva Luna was in much better form at home, but actually to come here and expect her to produce her best, or close to her best, was a big ask. But she's run a blinder; missed the last, but we still would have been third, and stayed on again after the last. I couldn't be happier, and we might see her out again at some point before the end of the season - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Richmond Villages And Bupa Care Homes Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was better but nowhere near her best. I wanted to settle Diva Luna in behind, take a lead but she's locked on to the first and that was that. I think she's going to be better over two miles, she's deadly with her speed. She'll end up getting three in time but I think, at the moment, she wants to get on with life so we'll probably drop her back to two and go from there. It's just good to get her back in the winner's enclosure. She's very, very talented and I still think she's one of the best we've got. I need to see more than that to win a Mares' Novices' Hurdle but I think she'll find it - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs Nickel Coin Mares' Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's been an extraordinary day, it's been the rough with the smooth. Diva Luna is very good. We kept it simple. We knew at Market Rasen she had gears, and she's got to the front and dictated. She's gorgeous - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Alan Swinbank Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Listed Race) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Diva Luna has done most of her work with Sixmilebridge, but he would have more toe than her. She's always been a lovely prospect after she came off the box and has always been very professional. We got that in spades today and we'll have a look at the mares' bumper at Aintree after that - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Coming into this season she was almost our most exciting horse having not really been extended to win Listed and Grade 2 mares' bumpers. It hasn't really worked this season, however. We had a nasty bug early in the season and then she got touched off at Lingfield. She won as I hoped she would at Cheltenham and the form is working out okay, although it wasn't the deepest race in the world. She got bogged down in terrible ground at Sandown, so it's not been plain-sailing. She seems in very good form now and I think it's the first time she's starting to look like the horse she was last season. She could very easily be overlooked in the market as she's beaten a lot of the British horses in bumpers. She's not a brilliant jumper or professional in every way, but if I can get her right for the day she'll be a lively outsider. 17-2-25

2:20.race_name: William Hill Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Beacon Edge
runners.comment: Ran respectably in the Coral Cup but this 11yo looks set for another supporting role
runners.spotlight: Retains a useful level of ability despite his advancing years and ran respectably in the Coral Cup most recently; however, this 11yo is likely set for another supporting role in another hot handicap.

quotes.race: bet365 Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The West Yorkshire Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge is a lovely genuine horse, he runs his race every time and I couldn't have been more happy with the way he did it there.  Small-runner fields can get quite tactical, we picked it up turning into the straight and I didn't want to be too far away because I knew my lad stays. He's done it well - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: He'llberemembered Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge looked in trouble a long way out but he stuck at it and took off on the run to the last. There is going to be improvement fitness-wise so hopefully he can keep going the right way - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: BARONERACING.COM Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Like every one else, I thought we were struggling at halfway and we were looking like we weren't at the races. I don't think Denis could go any quicker but from three out I thought we were getting back into it. You'd have to think three miles is his trip and the three-mile race at Leopardstown over Christmas is the obvious next race for him. Beacon Edge has a bit of blood on his nose - I've never seem him bleed before but sometimes they can get that from up high (in his nostril) or sometimes it can happen when they hit a fence. It didn't stop him today anyway - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Ireland Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge had a colic at Christmas and spent nearly a week in Kildare (veterinary clinic). He was just wasn't himself in Naas last time, but he's a fair horse. I wondered about him getting the trip but he stays. He's a very nice horse. Michael (O'Leary) had it in his head that he'd go to the Aintree Hurdle but he's in the Stayers. We have Diol Ker as well and we'll see what turns up in it. He was meant to go over fences this year but when we thought about what was coming out over fences we said we might be as well staying where we are. We got it right the way it looks at the minute anyway. That was a nice prize today and a nice race to win - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Marlin Hotel Dublin, Supporting The National Breast Cancer Institute Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge can go now for the Hatton's Grace, that's the obvious race for him. I felt that when he went up in trip it would help, they didn't go much of a gallop there but he was cantering throughout - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Health Hurdle
quotes.quote: He couldn't have done it any easier. We'll have to talk with Eddie and Michael (O'Leary) about whether he goes over fences or stays over hurdles. I suppose we didn't learn a lot there other than the fact he is well and that he jumped brilliant. Sean said he didn't really handle the track that well and when he was in front he was a bit lairy. If he stays over hurdles he will go for those conditions hurdle races. I think two and a half (miles) might suit him better and I've felt that all along. He can be dragged into a race rather than sort of push it a bit over two miles - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Bangor-on-Dee Annual Members Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge disappointed me a little bit. I thought he would have travelled a little bit better and I thought he was a bit lairy when he was left on his own. I do think he's a very nice horse though - Noel Meade, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He might not be the horse he once was, but he's still running to a pretty high level and he ran well again at Cheltenham on Saturday. He's very consistent. 28-10-24

runners.name: Impose Toi
runners.comment: Progressive; ran well in first-time cheekpieces in the Coral Cup most recently; solid
runners.spotlight: Progressive; ran well in first-time cheekpieces in the Coral Cup at Cheltenham (2m5f, good to soft) most recently, taking his handicap form figures to 12312; solid claims in the retained headgear.

quotes.race: Coral Cup Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The lack of a recent run wasn't an issue. Impose Toi is a funny character as he does absolutely nothing at home at all. Suddenly out there three quarters of the way through the race he carted Nico [de Boinville] into the race and if anything he got there too soon. It didn't matter that happened as the other horse was always going to win. I would have thought that is his trip. We didn't think he would get this at first, but he wouldn't want to go over three miles - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral 'Daily Rewards Shaker' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We ran Impose Toi in the Lanzarote last season and didn't think he stayed but I actually think he wants to go up to three miles now. He keeps popping up and will stay over hurdles. I did school him over fences and he wasn't the best - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Valda Energy Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a tidy race to aim at and start the season but Impose Toi will need to play with the grown-ups now. He's got the experience and everything was in his favour. He's a very likable character and a straightforward horse. He'll jump a fence and will be a nice horse for the future. He's progressing - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second behind Luccia in a valuable Ascot handicap hurdle last season and it gave us the impression he might need a bit further, so we went up in trip in the Lanzarote at Kempton and he finished a solid third. He's now looking tremendously well and I think we all feel he's destined for chasing this campaign. 22-10-24

runners.name: Steel Ally
runners.comment: Raised only 2lb for a good effort in Fontwell Grade 2 and remains unexposed beyond 2m
runners.spotlight: Useful handicap form in the autumn and ran well in Grade 2 contest at Fontwell (2m3f) most recently; raised only 2lb for that latest effort and remains unexposed beyond 2m; in the mix.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Podcasts Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Steel Ally is a nice horse. He was on a career-high mark stepping up in trip and I was swearing with the rain falling, but he dug in and did it well. We'll see the best of him on nicer ground. - Dylan Johnston, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's come out of his race on Saturday well and I'm delighted he put in a gutsy performance in what was a pretty competitive handicap. I'm thrilled as he seems to keep progressing, he jumps well and does everything we ask of him. He's very genuine. We'll see what the handicapper thinks of it and we'll make some plans from there. I think he'll make a fantastic two-mile chaser, probably next season. 25-11-24

He was unlucky when second on his first start at Ffos Las and would have been a nice winner had he not fluffed the last. We went back to Ffos Las last time and the ground was pretty hideous. He didn't see his race out and Harry Cobden looked after him. He might have been feeling the effects of his first run. He jumps well and will make a nice novice chaser. 05-01-24

runners.name: Brentford Hope
runners.comment: Drops back in class but has stamina to prove over this new trip
runners.spotlight: Useful on Flat at up to 1m4f and over hurdles at about 2m; drops back in class (attempted Grade 2 level the last twice) but has stamina to prove over this new trip.

quotes.race: My Pension Expert Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Final Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance. It was a very good ride because we planned to make the running but they went very hard. Holly was nearly running him down but Brentford Hope looked in control of the race the whole way - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Guinness St Patrick's Day Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Brentford Hope has been good for me. He's the first horse I've trained to win four races, which is cool. He got an easy lead and I thought he was always going to win. He had a nice untroubled run around and it was lovely. We won't go back to the Swinton Hurdle as the ground was too quick last year, but he has a few options. There's definitely still mileage in him this season ? he's not earned a holiday yet! - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Brentford Hope got his ground. He didn't get the ground at Windsor last time where it was more good and, jumping into a Listed race on his first run of the year, he was going flat out the whole way. Today was only soft and the heavier the ground, the better. We'll go wherever he'll get his ground. In a really good race, he'd have to have really bad ground, but he was stuffed in a Listed race at Windsor so don't get carried away. He's won on soft ground on the bridle, but he's a bridle horse and there weren't six more lengths hidden under Jamie's hands there. He does everything on the bridle and when it's really soft ground, it suits those horses. We'll duck and dive throughout the year and look for our ground and there'll be an entry in the Queen Elizabeth II Stakes on Champions Day as some years the ground is that bad he could be placed in it - Richard Hughes, trainer.

quotes.race: Coates & Seely Brut Reserve Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: In the last month the pace Brentford Hope started showing me was unbelievable. I knew he'd stay but with the pace he was showing me lately I thought he must be a good horse - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He kept progressing through the handicap ranks last season and I'm optimistic he can improve a little bit more. We'd like to start in the Elite Hurdle at Wincanton and if he's competitive we can stick to Graded races; if he's well beaten, then we can look at dropping back into handicaps. 01-11-24

His pre-Christmas target is the Gerry Feilden for second-season novices at Newbury on Winter Carnival weekend. Everything went to plan for him until the Swinton Hurdle at Haydock, where he didn't really let himself go. Paul O'Brien felt he was never really in the race after his two novice hurdle wins. We were trying to get him ready for the Balmoral Handicap at Ascot on Champions Day but he wasn't quite ready in time. He could have a spin over hurdles before Newbury but that's our main objective. I'd love to sneak him into the bottom of the Betfair Hurdle or something like that one day. He probably needs to improve 10lb or 12lb for that but he'll win races this season. 18-10-23

runners.name: Hansard
runners.comment: Inconsistent this season; something to prove upped in distance
runners.spotlight: Has shown all his hurdles form at about 2m; registered a useful success at Newbury last term but inconsistent this season; something to prove upped in distance.

quotes.race: Bet In Race With Coral Intermediate Handicap Hurdle (Reg' As The Gerry Feilden) (Premier H'cap)(GBB)
quotes.quote: Hansard ran a very good race at Aintree last season, but is bigger and stronger now. I was slightly disappointed with him at Wincanton last time but he might have been beaten by a better horse, he was spot on today and looked sharper in the paddock, while his work had improved at home. He's a nice horse. There was pace in the race, which is what he wants as he's a strong traveller. He's in a valuable handicap hurdle at Ascot just before Christmas and he does all the right things so you'd think he could be a Graded horse, but he needs to improve again - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Looking Forward To HWPAs Tomorrow Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked a seriously hot race. When Hansard first went to Gary Moore's, the reports back were solid all the way through and I think we've got a very smart horse on our hands. Jamie Moore has done all the work schooling on him and has loved him from day one. He did so much wrong today and there's so much more to come from him. We might go to Kempton with him over Christmas [for a 2m novice Hurdle] and he's a very impressive four-year-old - David Crosse, owner's representative.

stable_tour.quote: He was meant to run in the County Hurdle last season but was a bit sore on the morning of the race. He needs soft/heavy ground and didn't get the opportunity to run again after that but he's a nice horse who has done well over the summer. We'll train him for the big handicap hurdles this winter and races like the Betfair Hurdle spring to mind. 29-10-24

He's been an absolute superstar. He won his first two over hurdles and ended up finishing fourth in the Grade 1 at Aintree in 2023. Last season he came back and was second in the Elite Hurdle. After that he won the Gerry Feilden and was fifth at Ascot in December. Unfortunately, he had a couple of niggles in the spring and has been off since. You don't quite get a full season out of him nowadays and he'll be trained a bit differently. He'll start in the Elite Hurdle again in November. He'll improve for that run and it should leave him spot on for a nice 2m handicap in December. The likes of the Betfair Hurdle, County Hurdle and then Aintree will also be on his agenda. Jumping fences might be an option as well. There's a bit more to come from him. 24-10-24

runners.name: Western Walk
runners.comment: 2m6f/3m winner who is likely to find this sharp 2m4f inadequate
runners.spotlight: Irish raider who has gained his wins over 2m6f/3m and looks likely to find this sharp 2m4f inadequate; could have done with plenty of rain to make it a stiffer test.

runners.name: Favour And Fortune

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Landed the Scottish Champion Hurdle last April and this may be the time to catch him
runners.spotlight: 2m hurdler who produced his peak performance last April, winning the Scottish Champion Hurdle off just 1lb lower, and this may be the time to catch him; possibilities if he stays the new trip.

quotes.race: Coral Scottish Champion Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: For the last four months I've been saying I want Favour And Fortune on good ground. He's been running very well on heavy but he's a beautiful-actioned horse. His jumping was so much better today. He ran very well at Cheltenham and he nearly fell at the first and was only beaten ten lengths in a good Supreme. I've always loved him and he's certainly the best of my novices. It's been a difficult season for him and this was the last chance we had to run him. I'd like to stay over hurdles with him, he's not had a lot of racing - Alan King, trainer

quotes.race: William Hill Formby Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Formerly Registered As The Tolworth Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: It looked a proper race and Favour And Fortune jumped super and travelled into it. He handles this ground but I'd love to see him on good ground with the action he's got on him. We've got to think about the Supreme and we'll speak to the team to see what we want to do. If we went to Cheltenham, we might go straight there - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now 'Introductory' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a bit of a messy race with no-one wanting to go on and Favour and Fortune was a touch keen and a bit novicey. It probably did him the world of good today as he had to go through softer ground and grind it out on his own up the straight. He's got a lot options now. Two miles is his trip for the time being and he's got the scope to make a nice chaser - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Favour And Fortune was a very good horse ? it's great when they go and do it like that first time. He came home lame from Cheltenham, he pulled some muscles between his front legs, so you really want to put a line through that. He'd had a good summer and we've been happy with his work this autumn. He missed the second-last a little bit but he'll learn from that. He's quite a light horse and he wouldn't want a lot of racing, so we'll give him a bit of time and find another small novice where he can carry a penalty - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Favour And Fortune was very impressive with a penalty. He put a lot of distance between him and the other horses and it didn't look a bad bumper on paper so he's obviously smart. I don't know whether he goes to Cheltenham or Aintree but whichever it is he's probably up to that level. I got the split turning in and he was very honest and straightforward, galloping right through the line. He's really powerful and has a good future. He's learning as he goes but having a big engine helps! - Tom Cannon, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he's had a bit of a setback. He got cast in his stable and injured his hock. He was going to be trained for the Greatwood Hurdle - all summer I thought he was an ideal horse for it - but he may not now be out until the second half of the season. He's still an exciting horse and we just have to take our time and get him right; he's too good to be rushed. He's a horse we've always rated and was terrific in the Scottish Champion Hurdle so I hope we can look forward to 2025 with him. 25-10-24

My hopes of aiming him at the Greatwood, which would have been the perfect race for him, were ended when he got cast in his stable and injured his hock. But there are plenty of good races to aim for in the second half of the season. He's still an exciting horse and we just have to take our time and get him right, he's too good to be rushed. He's a horse we've always rated and he was terrific in the Scottish Champion Hurdle so I hope we can look forward to 2025 with him. 07-11-24

runners.name: Be Aware
runners.breeder: S C E A Pa Ouvry & E A R L Ecurie Des
runners.comment: Outstayed over a stiff 2m5f when 3-1 favourite for the Coral Cup; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent since debut win and gives the impression there's a race of this nature in him; outstayed over a stiff 2m5f when 3-1 favourite for the Coral Cup at Cheltenham most recently; remains of strong interest.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Be Aware was a nice horse and we know the family well as we've got his older brother Lac De Constance. He was capable of winning so it's not a surprise, but it was just whether he was up to it mentally. Lac De Constance has had a setback and is out for the season, so it's nice this lad has come out and can take over ? he's probably one of the nicer novice hurdlers we've got - Tom Messenger, assistant to Dan Skelton.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in the Greatwood and third in the Ladbrokes and ran really well in both. It looks like a step up in trip is absolutely what he wants and I'm looking forward to running him. He was wild when working at Huntingdon last week and was just in too good health, but I've got a month now to put a lid on him. He's got so much ability and we've set our stall out to run in the Coral Cup. Hopefully, he's a big player.   10-2-25

runners.name: Kopeck De Mee
runners.comment: Progressive in France; well beaten on debut for Willie Mullins but should do better
runners.spotlight: Progressive in France; well beaten in Cheltenham Festival handicap (2m4f) on debut for Willie Mullins but started 5-2 favourite and could well leave that effort behind; still an intriguing prospect.

runners.name: Gin Coco
runners.comment: Along with several other runners he goes into unknown territory over 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful at about 2m and gained sole handicap success off this mark; however, along with several other runners he goes into unknown territory over 2m4f.

stable_tour.quote: He won nicely on his reappearance at Newton Abbot and is in the Greatwood Hurdle at Cheltenham on Sunday and the Grade 2 novice hurdle on the same card. He's only a novice until the end of the month so our inclination is to make the most of that. We'll then try to aim him at the valuable two-mile handicap hurdles. 11-11-22

He didn't run his race in the County Hurdle - we thought it was the ground but he picked up a fractured pelvis. He's recovered now and, having finished a good second in the Greatwood Hurdle last year, we might look at that. Also he goes well fresh. The plan is to try to win a good two-mile handicap and then decide whether to go chasing. 04-10-23

runners.name: Off The Jury
runners.comment: Still a maiden under rules but went close in notable 2m4f race at Sandown most recently
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden under rules and proved errant on penultimate start; however, he went close in a major novice handicap at Sandown (2m4f, good to soft) latest, suggesting there's a good prize in him.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier For The Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Final)
quotes.quote: I had both hands on my left rein trying to keep Off The Jury in; he was hanging the whole way down the back and he hung in the home straight. He tried to do it at the second-last but you've got to try to get a bit of forward momentum, you can't just keep hauling him in. He's so frustrating, he's got talent though - David Maxwell, jockey and owner.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wouldn't have ridden Off The Jury any differently given another go and the winner has done it well. On all the form he should have won but he didn't - that's racing - David Maxwell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's the first horse I've had for David Maxwell and I'm just getting to know him. He was an expensive purchase at the Punchestown sale last spring and is a big, scopey point winner who has chaser written all over him but he'll have a season hurdling. 25-10-23

He showed quite a bit of promise in bumpers. He tended to overrace a bit and we put a hood on him but it almost had too much of an effect and switched him off completely. He's relaxed in his work at the moment and could start over hurdles this week. He jumps well. 07-11-24

runners.name: Minella Missile
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner last term; hard to fancy on this season's form
runners.spotlight: On the sidelines for 14 months after his Grade 2 novice win at Cheltenham (2m5f) and hasn't looked the same horse since returning to action; best watched.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Hyde Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Missile is very laid back. I love a horse you can drop in and then they quicken, not many can get there in two strides but he can. Talk is talk and the men in March, they don't talk they just turn up. We're under no illusions and he's won his race. He's a half-brother to Monbeg Genius who I think is a very good horse and his future will be over fences somewhere down the line. For a staying novice hurdler he quickens - Evan Williams, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I couldn't get him right after he won the Grade 2 contest at Cheltenham last year, so I just gave him time. I could have run him, but I was never 100 per cent happy, so we chose to be patient. I'm delighted with him now and he's ready to run. He's still not got much experience and it's difficult to find the right starting point, but he doesn't want it too deep and he'll have a few entries in the coming weeks. 25-11-24

He was a nice novice before Christmas last season, winning at Chepstow and a Grade 2 at Cheltenham, where he beat Captain Teague, but I couldn't get him right after that. He struggled and I was lucky that I was under no pressure to run him in the spring. We basically just gave him the chance to come back to himself. He's now ready to run and I did have him entered at Hereford recently but decided to wait. There's a handicap hurdle on New Year's Day at Cheltenham or I might wait for Kempton on January 11 for the Lanzarote, but we'll see. We'll slot him in somewhere. He's ready to go but doesn't want the ground too deep. 24-12-24

runners.name: Serious Operator
runners.comment: Absent since coming up well short (off 1lb higher) in this race 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Five-time hurdles winner but has been absent since coming up well short (off 1lb higher) in this race 12 months ago; opposed unless the market suggests otherwise.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Serious Operator is improving, his jumping was perfect. We were a bit worried about the ground. His hurdling is outstanding and he'll go chasing next season - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: When Serious Operator gets his ground and gets everything sorted he's a heck of a horse. He couldn't get out of the heavy ground last time. Today he travelled and I probably got there too soon. I hope he's turned the corner now - Patrick Wadge, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably have one more run over hurdles, maybe at Cheltenham on Friday, and then it will be chasing for him after that. We've wanted to go chasing but there wasn't an obvious target at the start of the season and he's not slow. It was a good performance at Ayr in April, so we'll give him one more chance over hurdles to see if he can improve again. 15-11-23

He came to us from Daniel Murphy in Ireland having won two point-to-points. He won first time out for us under rules at Kelso and, after an unhappy run at Cheltenham in October, returned this month with a win over 2m4½f at Newcastle. He's not over-big but has a nice engine and stays exceedingly well. He's better on good to soft. After his Cheltenham run Tom [Scudamore] suggested he had breathing issues and he was subsequently operated on. He won after the operation but genuinely seems better than ever and we could head back to Cheltenham this weekend. He's a strong galloper and jumps well and long term I can't wait to see him novice chasing. 25-01-23

runners.name: Wreckless Eric
runners.comment: Unlucky second in the Imperial Cup; likely player provided he stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: Improving steadily at about 2m, unlucky second in the Imperial Cup at Sandown (good to soft; might have won but for bungling the final flight) most recently; likely player provided he stays the new trip.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Bloodstock Sales With ITM Junior 'National Hunt' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a bit of a messy race. Wreckless Eric jumped seriously well at Newbury apart from the second-last, but he's a very good jumper. They didn't really go much of a gallop and he made his own running. He made mistakes along the way and was very green up the home straight - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He looked like he was going to win at Wincanton but just overjumped and buckled on landing at the second-last. It was a shame because he'd shown a good turn of foot coming into the straight. He came back 100 per cent and will probably run in the two-mile novice handicap hurdle on the Friday of the November meeting at Cheltenham 06-11-24

runners.name: Ike Sport
runners.comment: Has lost his consistency; addition of hood needs to make a difference
runners.spotlight: Consistent form last term featured three wins; less reliable this season and is held by some of these rivals on Coral Cup running; addition of hood needs to make a difference.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good form after winning a big handicap chase for us last time out. Like Any News, we won't be running him on the winter ground but the plan will be to have him back out again before the end of the season. He's done very little wrong for us and I think he can step up again. 27-11-23

He's solid and very consistent. He'll go chasing after May 1. There's nothing major jumping out for him at any of the festivals. He had a rating of 116 before he last ran. He's done very little wrong and it was a £70,000 race he won last time out. He's a six-year-old who jumps, stays and has a big heart, so now is the natural time to go chasing. He cost only £16,000. We could end up targeting him towards the Summer Plate or something similar. 06-03-24

runners.name: Wade Out
runners.comment: Ready success last time took his overall record to 5-7; open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Readily defied a big penalty in Wetherby novice contest (2m3f) last time, taking hurdles record to 3-5 and overall strike-rate to 5-7; interesting on handicap debut, with further progress plausible.

quotes.race: Racing TV 100% Profits Returned To Racing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You can put a line through Wade Out's last run and he's picked up where he left off. There was probably something wrong with him last time, I don't know what. He ran too bad to say he's not good enough for that grade - James Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Wade Out is a good horse. I've run him over 2m three times and he's crying out for a trip. We are just trying to sharpen him up for the spring for when he does go up in trip and you'll see a different horse. It's nice to get a third run into him and plot where we're going to go, originally we were thinking of trials day for the 2m4f Grade 2 at Cheltenham in late January - Olly Murphy, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Wade Out is a likeable horse who doesn't wow you at home, but he saves his best for the track. He's very laid-back but has a great attitude and hopefully this is the start of a nice hurdles campaign for him. We could certainly look at Cheltenham's November meeting as he's very professional now ? nothing is going to faze him. I'm chuffed with how things are going - Olly Murphy, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: After winning his point-to-point, he bolted up in a bumper on his sole start last season and looks like he's going to be an exciting novice hurdler, having been very professional on his hurdles debut at the weekend. 24-10-24

runners.name: Listentoyourheart
runners.owner: S T Racing - The Founders Syndicate
runners.comment: Consistent mare who is 3-5 over hurdles; has Grade 2 form; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Consistent mare; ran creditably in Grade 2 events at this meeting last year (bumper) and Kelso latest start (2m2f); record of 3-5 over hurdles includes a Listed win; solid chance upped further in trip.

quotes.race: Play Coral 'Racing-Super-Series' For Free Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Listentoyourheart was good there, she snipped through that gap. She's tough, she's hardy and has a little bit of experience under her belt. We got on with it and got some racing into her early in the season. Today was always going to be harder, but we were preparing her for it. When they turned the taps on, she took about five strides to pick up when the others picked up immediately in front of her. Some would back out of that hole, but she's not like that - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: CSP Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Two and a half miles will be no issue and Listentoyourheart actually ran well on softer ground at Aintree, but I'm not in a massive hurry to pitch her in. While the ground is like this we don't have to - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's already won a Listed novice hurdle at Newbury this season and she'll be taking on the same sort of horses again. She'll be giving them a bit more weight, but she's pretty professional and tough, and I think she'll take a good bit of beating. 22-12-24

runners.name: Helnwein
runners.comment: Unsuccessful over fences this term; notable win at Sandown (2m) on last hurdles start
runners.spotlight: Has failed to make the expected progress over fences since good reappearance effort; beat Be Aware and Steel Ally at Sandown (2m) last April on last attempt over hurdles, so looks hard to dismiss; new trip.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. Helnwein will come on a bundle as well, mine are needing a run and there's a lot of improvement to come. He's a lovely horse and has done everything so easily at home, he never comes off the bridle and those are the ones that tend to get quite tired. I'm not getting carried away and I've no plans at the moment but he could possibly run in an introductory hurdle if I find one - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's an exciting horse. He won a good novice handicap hurdle at Sandown on the last day of last season and we're sending him chasing. He's had a good summer and has been schooling well. With his current mark, he'll probably start in a novice handicap and we'll see where he goes. We'll keep him to two miles for the moment. 25-10-24

He's an exciting prospect for fences. He won a good novice handicap hurdle at Sandown on the last day of last season and he's always looked the sort who would take to chasing. He's had a good summer and has been schooling well. He'll head to either Aintree or Sandown this weekend. We'll keep him to 2m for the moment. 07-11-24

runners.name: Tune In A Box
runners.comment: Below par last time but largely consistent otherwise; wears first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Versatile sort who has winning form at 2m3f-3m; below par when last seen but largely productive and consistent in handicaps otherwise; wears first-time cheekpieces; could go well.

quotes.race: Blood-Stock.com Full Circle Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was watching Montregard throughout the race but I kept casting my eye back to Tune In A Box and I saw him travelling everywhere. I thought Montregard would be the horse to beat and would close him down, but he didn't and the winner is a horse who keeps surprising us - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Tintintin
runners.breeder: E A R L Arnaud Vasselin
runners.comment: Has made the frame in a few major handicaps at about 2m; each-way possibilities
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in a few major handicaps at about 2m this term; ties in with Wreckless Eric on Imperial Cup form; each-way possibilities, provided he's as effective back up in distance.

runners.name: Blenkinsop
runners.comment: Signs of retaining ability last time but faces a stiffer task in this field
runners.spotlight: Completed a four-timer in 2022; showed clear signs of retaining ability at Uttoxeter last month on second run back from long layoff; faces a stiffer assignment in this field.

quotes.race: Coral Bet Bundles Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Blenkinsop is improving and Henry fancied him. I rode him like I had a lot of faith in him, going wide and a few lengths back. We didn't go quick early and he ground it out. He won at Exeter last time when it would have only been good to soft and I'd say he's best on soft, but it's going heavy now. Henry's horses are flying and he's a very astute placer of them, so he gets the maximum out of what he's got. There could be more to come from him - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

runners.name: Wellington Arch
runners.comment: Latest effort took his hurdles record to 21212; may do better still; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Novice hurdler who ran well at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft; handicap debut) most recently, taking record in this sphere to 21212; proving consistent and may do better still; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked like Wellington Arch should go and do that, but he's done it nicely. I'm very happy for Mike and Mary (Gaskell). They've had to be patient with him this autumn, but I think they'll see the rewards in the spring hopefully - Jonjo O'Neill Jnr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Richard Newland Racing Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was pleased to see the rain last night so I let Wellington Arch take his chance. He's a big raw horse, we'll see how it goes and take it from there but I'd say he'll go for another bumper somewhere - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won first time out at Worcester and then finished behind Regent's Stroll and Tradecraft under a penalty at Ascot, which is very good form. He then ran a little bit under par in a decent race at Sandown, while Aintree might have been a bit beyond him at that stage of his career. We always liked him last year and that hasn't changed. He's ready to start over hurdles. 06-11-24

5:15.race_name: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Handicap Hurdle (Conditional Jockeys'/Amateur Riders' Race) (GBB Race)
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places on Mildmay course (GoingStick: Mildmay Hurdle 5.1, Mildmay Chase 5.4, Grand National course 5.5) (Watering)

runners.name: Lump Sum
runners.comment: Disappointed last time and regular partner Dylan Johnston rides stablemate Celtic Dino
runners.spotlight: This season's seconds have come in the Grade 1 Fighting Fifth and the always-strong Newbury handicap in February; has earned this tough mark, off which he failed to fire in the Imperial Cup; regular partner Dylan Johnston rides stablemate Celtic Dino.

quotes.race: William Hill Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely thrilled and Lump Sum is such a cool horse. To go and run such a race under top weight was not easy so I'm really happy. We gave the winner 21lb which puts his performance into perspective - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsor Of The Welsh Champion Hurdle (A Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He just has a bit of class, doesn't he? I must admit I don't know Lump Sum very well but I think maybe the next day I ride him it'll be slightly different, but it's worked today and we've got the job done - Dylan Johnston, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Coral Dovecote Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lump Sum is a smashing horse. We left him out of the novice hurdles at Cheltenham, although he's in some handicaps and could still be well handicapped, but we'll see about going there and it's a decision for Mr Walters and me to have a chat about in the next few weeks. There's Aintree after that, but there's no pressure from Mr Walters on any of the young horses - Sam Thomas, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I had him in the Greatwood but he missed it due to an unsatisfactory scope. We confirmed him for the Fighting Fifth this weekend, so he'll have a good bit of work beforehand to make sure we're 100 per cent happy with him. We're definitely considering it, I know it's a big step up on what he's done already but it will be nice to know where we stand and we can always drop back into handicaps if he's not good enough. He's a super little horse to have and he'll make a smashing chaser in time. 25-11-24

He's a little star. He's not overly big but is by a brilliant stallion in Authorized. He jumps nicely and is a strong traveller. He's done everything we've asked of him this season and seems to handle the soft ground really well. He has a handicap mark now so we'll try to find a suitable opportunity to secure his hat-trick in the next couple of weeks. He's a horse we might be able to aim at the Welsh Champion Hurdle next season if he's on the right sort of mark. 05-01-24

runners.name: Fiercely Proud
runners.comment: Career-best form in his Ascot win and there were valid excuses last time at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Career-best form when winning at Ascot just before Christmas (1m7f, good to soft; front two clear) and was found to be suffering from an irregular heartbeat when pulled up off this 9lb higher mark in Newbury's big February handicap; cheekpieces are added and, if back on his game, he should be competitive.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fiercely Proud battled but you wouldn't want to go much further. It's a big feather in his cap and we'll look at Newbury and the County Hurdle, but he might be better right-handed. We thought he was well handicapped at the beginning of the season, but we got it all wrong. He got loose at Cheltenham and we rode him too handy here, but we had to drop him out in the Greatwood and he had so much to do in that race. We had to change tactics here and it worked. They went so hard but it's good to see. Two-mile handicap hurdles should be fast run ? it's what we're here for. This year they've been poor, they've been run at such a dawdle. This is what we need for these sorts of horses because he was able to settle off a good gallop - Ben Pauling, trainer.

quotes.race: Jetset Tours And Flights Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Fiercely Proud is always a horse who can get above himself. He settled and then the horse behind him clipped heels and that was it, he was off again. He did a lot wrong, so he did well to buckle down and win after the last. I was quite taken by that performance, it was very good under a penalty. He won't be overraced. We'll look at something in the spring but it won't necessarily be at Cheltenham. That win qualifies him for the £100,000 handicap at Sandown at the end of the season, and maybe something like the Dovecote could be a target. He's good on right-handed, flat tracks, he's got loads of gears, but whether we run him between now and then is another matter - Ben Pauling, trainer,

quotes.race: JCB "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (A Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race) (Listed Race) (GBB)
quotes.quote: The form of Fiercely Proud's win at Market Rasen is nothing but Don [Cantillon] always said he's a nice horse. We liked him at home and he came from last to first in the style of a good horse. This race was the aim and I'd imagine we'll keep him in bumpers and look towards one of the better ones - Ben Pauling, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had an irregular heartbeat after the Betfair Hurdle but it was back in rhythm by the next morning and we had all the tests done and the vets are happy it was a one-off. He won the Ladbroke at Ascot and is a progressive handicapper and will possibly have an entry in the County, or we could wait for Aintree. 17-2-25

runners.name: Alnilam
runners.owner: Mrs A Williams And A Badri

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A Williams and Mr A Badri

runners.comment: 2nd in the Morebattle and 2lb lower here if taking into account Beau Morgan's allowance
runners.spotlight: First run after wind surgery when making all at Southwell (2m, soft) and he had no trouble in travelling strongly off a solid pace when runner-up in Kelso's Morebattle (good to soft); 2lb lower here if taking into account Beau Morgan's allowance and he enters the reckoning.

runners.name: Celtic Dino
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant Et Al
runners.comment: He's a good jumper who could have a big role to play off this mark in his first handicap
runners.spotlight: Strong suspicion that he's a good-ground horse, so he didn't run at all badly in the Grade 1 Formby here on Boxing Day (soft); had no excuses when a well-held third in the Grade 2 Dovecote (good to soft) but he's a good jumper who could have a big role to play off this mark in his first handicap.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Season Opener At Wincanton Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Celtic Dino got a bit hot before racing and has still got lots to learn, but it's nice to see them a bit green in the race as you know they're going to come on for it. Dylan [Johnston, jockey] was great and gave him a fantastic ride. The Betfair [Hurdle at Newbury in February] would be the obvious, and he'd need a run every month to qualify, but that would be the sort of thing we'd be looking at ideally. He's a top of the ground horse and pointed his toe, jumped great and I was pleased to see him just have a good look - Sam Thomas, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's very exciting. He's a big baby really, he's still learning all the time and settling at home. He's taken everything in his stride recently and I'm very happy with him. They don't get too much experience in these small-runner races but he's winning, although he's still green as grass. Hopefully, he can keep taking steps forward and we might look to follow the same route as with Lump Sum last year. He probably wouldn't want the ground any softer than what is was on Friday, which will suit some of those spring festivals. 25-11-24

He's a lovely horse but he's still quite raw and weak. We were pleased with the way he won on his debut in a bumper at Ascot and he ran well in a Listed contest last time. The time was very good and we lost nothing in defeat. He's a good mover with a brilliant pedigree so he's one to look forward to next season. I won't be rushing to run him over hurdles this campaign. 05-01-24

runners.name: Kings Hill
runners.comment: Will need to run a lot better than in his last three handicaps; opposable
runners.spotlight: Irish raider who is 1-13 over hurdles and will need to run a lot better than in his last three handicaps; opposable.

quotes.race: thurles.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Kings Hill needed a horse to go with him. He got there at his ease and he learned plenty being out in front like he was. He will want further on nice ground. His time of year is coming and it's good to get that out of the way - Paul Gilligan, trainer

runners.name: Washington
runners.comment: 2-3 for Harry Derham and reasonable to put a line though his latest Newbury effort
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 for this yard when bagging a valuable pot at Fairyhouse in December (2m, yielding) and he never gave himself a hope at Newbury in February by racing too freely on soft ground; can do better this time, despite his tough mark.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "100% Football Acca Boost On Self Service Betting Terminals" Handicap Hurdle (Listed)
quotes.quote: Washington won at Chepstow and I considered the Greatwood but I thought Cheltenham would not suit us at all. I knew this big galloping track would be perfect for him. It's very very rare in horse racing that a plan comes together but this one actually did - Harry Derham, trainer

quotes.race: 3 As Leisure Motorhome-Caravan Sales Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paul [O'Brien] gave Washington a good ride. I'm very pleased with him - he's been with us a while and taken time to come right, so I'm glad he has rewarded the patience of his owners - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Cheltmas Bet £10 Get £20 Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a very strong performance from Washington as it's difficult to win these races under a penalty. He was keen enough early on but came through well in the end although I may well have gone too soon - Lewis Stones, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won well at Chepstow the other day. He'll show his best in fast-run two-mile handicap hurdles and there's a race at Doncaster in December I'd love him to run in, worth £50,000. I think the track will suit him well. 01-11-24

He's a nice type but I was very disappointed with his recent effort at Newbury, where he was pulled up. I'm not sure if it was the fitting of a hood or the fact he was dropped in, prompting him to sulk. We'll go back to 2m next time with a more positive ride and see if that sparks him back to life. The positive is that he's around his last winning rating. 22-12-22

runners.name: Grimaud

prev_owners.owner: Riviera Equine Sarl, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

runners.comment: Recent maiden winner and he's an unexposed handicap debutant for a top yard
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France; made it fourth-time lucky in maiden hurdles when comfortably justifying odds-on favouritism at Gowran (2m, soft) four weeks ago and he's an unexposed handicap debutant for a top yard; hard to dismiss, for all that he may prefer softer ground.

quotes.race: Golf Classics At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Grimaud had the form and would have wanted to be winning that so it's nice for him to get off the mark. He wouldn't mind the ground a bit better. It's very testing and he did well to get through it - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a few times in France, winning at La Teste De Buch, and looks nice a nice recruit. 28-10-24

runners.name: Slugger
runners.comment: 3-4 for this yard but limitations were seemingly exposed in the Morebattle at Kelso
runners.spotlight: Races prominently; hit the ground running for Harry Derham in completing a hat-trick but that came at a cost mark-wise and limitations were seemingly exposed when fourth in the Morebattle at Kelso (2m, good to soft); questionable whether he can unearth the improvement he'll need to take this.

quotes.race: Paul Harrington 50th Birthday Celebrations Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Slugger has done it really nicely. He's been a bit keen in his life but he settled really well and jumped well. He's at an age where he could keep progressing - Harry Derham, trainer.

quotes.race: Simpsons Malt Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Slugger jumped really well. It came as a bit of a surprise because he's been very awkward at home, he's been very keen and doing things the wrong way a little bit. His schooling has been fairly good, but I thought Sean gave him an excellent ride there. The hood has really helped him today - Iain Jardine, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Moon Chime
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson
runners.comment: Up 11lb for his Stratford win but that was only his second run back from wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Had some good bumper form and has gone 3-6 over hurdles, last time quite impressive at Stratford (2m handicap, good to soft); perhaps won a bit too easily for his own good with the handicapper coming down hard (up 11lb) but that was only his second run back from wind surgery; each-way claims.

quotes.race: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It's nice to see Moon Chime back and like the horse we thought we had. We had his wind done after Carlisle and at Ludlow last month it didn't work, but everything fell into place there. I think we'll look at the two-mile conditionals' race at Aintree [on April 4]. We've got a great lad in Nick Slatter who has won on him so the race could be tailor-made for him. Then possibly we can go on to the Swinton at Haydock. He loves a good quick two miles and we can look at better races again - Graeme McPherson, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Horse Racing Tips Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked as though Moon Chime was being held but as long as Lucinda's horse is up, that's the main thing. He is a nice horse. The ground is tacky enough and we probably won't go on ground as tacky again next time. He's going to have an easy ten days then we'll make a plan - David Killahena, join trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Moon Chime hung last time when he was third at Kempton but was better today and he has an engine. It was always the plan to sit handy and pick them up and it's nice he's got his head in front over hurdles - Brendan Powell, jockey

quotes.race: Join Our Bet Club At Vickers.Bet Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very good. I'm delighted for Nick [Slatter], he's done all the work with Moon Chime at home as he's a tricky type. He'd shown us plenty at home so I was hoping he'd run well. I'd like a bit more ease in the ground for him but we'll see whether we'll go again in the next few weeks - Dave Killahena, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Manuelito
runners.breeder: Natton House Thoroughbreds & Mr G Bishop
runners.comment: Noticeably strong in the market when making all for a 2l success at Newbury; up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Goodish ground seems the key to him and he was noticeably strong in the market when making all for a 2l success at Newbury two weeks ago (2m; good to soft); 4lb higher here but he's an uncomplicated 5yo who should run well.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were hoping for a run like that and Manuelito didn't let us down. He might have one more run. He's quite versatile but he definitely does go on this better ground - David Pipe, trainer.

runners.name: Lario
runners.comment: 0-6 for current yard and doesn't look on an overly generous mark; cheekpieces first time
