runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner for previous yard; has shown improved form for this operation without managing to get his head in front and he doesn't look on an overly generous mark; the cheekpieces may trigger something but others are more intriguing.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think we've seen the best of him. He ran really well on his first start for me at Newbury but did quite a lot wrong, pulling too hard. We gave him two more runs to give him some more experience. He's fairly handicapped and could start at Sandown on November 10 or we'll wait for a two-mile handicap hurdle at the Tingle Creek meeting. 01-11-24

I bought him from my good friend Christian von der Recke in Germany where he was ridden by Ryan Moore on his latest run at Dusseldorf. He is a nice prospect with plenty of size and scope and will be running in juvenile hurdles. We've had him gelded and he is cantering away happily now - I can see he has bags of ability. 13-10-22

runners.name: Afadil
runners.comment: Third in this last year when 6lb higher; very nearly won the Imperial Cup last time
runners.spotlight: Finished a 3l third in this 12 months ago off a 6lb higher mark, so has to be of strong interest having turned a corner in his last two races, the latest when collared late on in the Imperial Cup (good to soft) after looking in control at the last flight; tongue-tie joins regular cheekpieces; hard to knock.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish County Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Afadil enjoyed the ground and was given a great ride by Freddie (Gingell). He'll have an entry in the County Hurdle but perhaps the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree might be the race for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Remus Uomo Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought Afadil would win, we thought he was still quite nicely handicapped. He ran very well at Ascot, where we beat him with a 50-1 shot. He ran a bit free in front there so we dropped him in a bit today. He got a pound for Ascot, which I thought was okay, and he had a four-year-old's allowance. Whether he'll run again I don't know. The only possibility is the Swinton Hurdle. He's a tank of a horse and if he's in good form and we were happy, we could well look at it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Invest Southwest Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Afadil will love the soft ground so I'd expect he'd go to Haydock and we'll try to keep them apart. He and Rare Middleton will get entries in the Triumph - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second at Musselburgh this month. He will be given an entry but would need the ground to be good to run and he's probably better on a flatter track, so Aintree may suit him better. 8-2-25

runners.name: Shes A Saint
runners.comment: Classy mare, still lightly raced; able when fresh and could have been saved for this
runners.spotlight: Smart novice in 2022-23 season, winning twice (2m) and runner-up in Grade 2 (2m4f) and Listed (2m/3m) races; missed all of last season but was second in a Cartmel handicap last May after 448 days off and could easily run well back from another break; races prominently.

stable_tour.quote: She's taken her racing really well. She won the other day and was down at the last and then stayed on. She's got solid form behind Luccia. She'll be going and she'd have an outside chance. I'm happy with her. 12-2-23

runners.name: Luttrell Lad
runners.comment: Ran well in this last year and he's back after a return to winning ways at Taunton
runners.spotlight: Beaten 6l in this 12 months ago and then ran fourth in the Swinton; big-field handicaps hold no fears and he returns after exploiting his reduced mark at Taunton (2m, good to soft); can give a good account off just 3lb higher.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Maiden Hurdle (Arc Summer Novices' Brush Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad is nice. He had very good bumper form and it was nice to get him started off over hurdles. He can be a bit fizzy but we went a good gallop there and it allowed him to settle and jump well. Day one is out of the way now and there's plenty to look forward to - Tom O'Brien, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Luttrell Lad was very green at Stratford first time. He learned a lot and he kept on well here - Richard Johnson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's gone for a winter break and will be back in the spring but he's a good horse for us. We got him handicapped on the Flat [75] and his last run was probably just one too many. 08-11-22

He's been a decent horse for us, winning over hurdles as well as running a cracker when eighth in the County Hurdle at the festival in March. I was happy enough with his reappearance effort at Haydock last month and then he looked like he was going to win at Hereford on Saturday but got caught late on having started racing way too soon. Unfortunately he's been plagued with problems; he's got a suppressed immune response without a shadow of a doubt and has been very difficult to train. As a result he'll never achieve what he possibly could have done. He's incredibly genuine and a lot of horses wouldn't have faced the bridle suffering what he's been through. He's had to have constant treatment and the owners have had to be so patient - for them it's like owning two horses in training as he has to have constant physio. I'd still like to think he has a nice handicap in him, but he's a mystery. I don't know if he'd stay as far as 3m. When we first got him we thought he'd be a real speed merchant who'd want top of the ground, but he's not as fast as he thinks he is. 20-12-23

runners.name: Old Gregorian
runners.comment: Solid third in the Morebattle but again he may have no more than place aspirations
runners.spotlight: Likeable 6yo who ran just about his best race when splitting Alnilam and Slugger in the Morebattle Hurdle at Kelso a month ago (2m, good to soft); Conner McCann rides again off a 2lb higher mark; may have no more than place aspirations.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance. Old Gregorian got a lot of confidence from his last win and he'll be better again when he steps up to two and a half miles. He jumps hurdles quickly and well - Alan Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He finished behind El Elefante at Perth in April and we may have got him wrong - we thought he was a sharp three-year-old but he just seems like a relentless galloper. I was delighted with his performance at Kelso when he won first time out this season. He has a good future in front of him and will keep developing for the next few years. 15-11-23

runners.name: Jack Hyde
runners.owner: Paddy Brennan Racing Syndicate Jack Hyde
runners.comment: Another improving novice, who hasn't been overly stretched to win minor races at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Another improving novice, who hasn't been overly stretched to win minor races at Southwell (2m/2m4f; good to soft); this demands another career best (by some margin) but the potential is there.

runners.name: Diamonds For Luck
runners.owner: Mrs Diana L Whateley & Aiden Murphy
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap debutant who arrives here after three no-nonsense novice wins
runners.spotlight: Unexposed handicap debutant who arrives here after three no-nonsense wins in 2m-2m3f novice events, on soft and heavy ground; he might not necessarily need the mud (effective on good to soft) and could easily be on a kinder mark than many in here.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's very soft and for a second I thought he was going to get stuck in it turning in. Diamonds For Luck came to me with a big reputation. He was cantering both times when falling in his point-to-points and I thought he was a certainty when running in a bumper at Taunton last April but he came back a sick horse. He'll have one more run before the spring and will be a nice horse with time. He'll make a nice chaser next year. Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Hamsiyann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: May yet have more to offer as a hurdler but this drop back to a sharp 2m is worrying
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the 2m2f Chester Plate on Flat in May, so it came as no surprise to see him improve for the 2m5f when winning well at Cheltenham in November (good; 10lb higher today); his run over 3m at Musselburgh was too bad to be true but this drop back to a sharp 2m is worrying.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Intermediate Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All I wanted was for Hamsiyann to come back safe, it didn't matter whether he won or not. I was hoping he would avoid bad luck and have a bit of luck on his side. He was lucky that the horse who fell three out didn't bring him down. I gave a good bit of money for him a couple of years ago, but he's only coming to his milk now. That was sweet - Tony Martin, trainer.

runners.name: Cormier
runners.comment: Limited appeal on what he's shown in two handicaps following a long absence
runners.spotlight: Has had a lot of racing under both codes and he hasn't been overly competitive in two handicap hurdles following a long absence (latterly in new cheekpieces); it's a big ask to stage a sudden revival in this competitive a race.

quotes.race: White Horse Kids Eat Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Cormier is tough and consistent and always manages to pull it out of the bag. He stays two miles so I was a bit worried about the trip, but he loved it. They were Brian's [Ellison] orders to bring the horse wide - Harry Russell, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Morebattle Hurdle (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cormier was very keen when we first got him but he's settled now. He's grown up a bit and he's a lot easier at home. Early on Sean said he was off the bit, they were going that quick, then he's come hard on it round the top bend. If anything he got there too early but he tries. Taking the hurdles out didn't bother him because he's won a few on the Flat. Cheltenham will be different but we know he acts round there. Whether he's good enough doesn't matter, he's won a 100,000GBP race and his owner lives just over the road from Cheltenham - Brian Ellison, trainer.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cormier made one mistake at three out, I know it's on a different course but he did exactly the same thing in the Greatwood. He came back on the bridle fairly quickly after and I was always happy. Every time I asked he was always giving me a bit, he's a nice horse and they'll have plenty of fun seeing where he ends up. It could be here in March (County Hurdle) - Jonny Burke, jockey.

quotes.race: williamhill.com Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Cormier has got very good hurdle form and he's fresh off a run from Pontefract where he won quite easily. My only doubt for today was the sun drying the ground out but his class brought him through it and he got away with it. His owner Dan Gilbert loves dual-purpose horses so I'd say he'll do a bit of both - Ben Robinson, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in the Greatwood but the ground was too quick for him. We're going to go novice chasing now, which has always been the plan this season. We haven't started schooling him over fences yet, but he likes the soft ground and the intention is to head to Newcastle in January. 20-11-22

runners.name: Country Park
runners.comment: Made a respectable handicap debut at Ascot and dropping back to 2m could benefit him
runners.spotlight: 1lb out of the weights; point winner; still a maiden under rules but made a respectable handicap debut at Ascot (2m3f, good; first-time cheekpieces) last time and dropping back in trip with a solid gallop on the cards could benefit him.

stable_tour.quote: Second at Uttoxeter in June and third at Carlisle last month, he'll stay further and a step up in trip in handicap company off his mark off 112 should suit him. 06-11-24

runners.name: Dominics Fault
runners.comment: Retains potential but has something to prove under these ground conditions
runners.spotlight: 1lb out of the weights; quite a spike in form to win so well at Lingfield in December (2m, soft) and he was going well when brought down three out at Sandown (soft; after a 9lb rise); retains potential but has something to prove under these ground conditions.

runners.name: Tapley
runners.breeder: Stephen Kemble Bloodstock Ltd & G Peck
runners.comment: 66-1 when well held in the Imperial Cup last time and he is again up against it
runners.spotlight: 2lb out of the weights and has never won above Class 3 level; 66-1 when well held in the Imperial Cup last time and he is again up against it.

7:30.race_name: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Haku
runners.comment: Rare poor effort in Kempton handicap last month; he's the sort to bounce back though
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m4f AW winner in the autumn but he turned in a rare poor effort when last of seven in 1m4f Kempton handicap last month; he's the sort to bounce back though.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Tools At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Haku is a legend, he's gone up through the ranks and he always gives his all. He's a favourite in the yard and it's great that he can come and do his job here - Mark Loughnane, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Humble Spark
runners.comment: Bagged third AW win of 2025 here 3 weeks ago; scored readily there so not taken lightly
runners.spotlight: Bagged his third AW success of 2025 in 11f handicap here three weeks ago; scored readily there so he's not taken lightly despite a 4lb weights rise.

runners.name: Story Horse
runners.comment: A two-time scorer (up to 1m6f) in 2024; needs considering after a break reverted in trip
runners.spotlight: A two-time scorer (at up to 1m6f) in 2024 but he ended the campaign with two below-form efforts over 2m2f at Newmarket in the autumn; he needs considering after a break reverted in trip.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It was a really nice, straightforward performance. Story Horse was unlucky not to win the last day as he was very impressive at Lingfield. It was nice to see him get his head in front and I had a very smooth trip round. It couldn't have been easier - Saffie Osborne, jockey.

runners.name: Ancient Myth
runners.comment: Failed to go on in three runs for Karl Burke last spring; has bit to prove for new yard
runners.spotlight: Camelot gelding failed to go on in three runs for Karl Burke last season, beating only one in 1m4f Chester maiden in May; changed hands for 13,000gns and now returns for his new yard after ten months off with a bit to prove.

runners.name: Caballo De Mar
runners.comment: Progressive and completed a hat-trick over C&D latest; big shout with cheekpieces back on
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who made light of a six-month lay-off when completing his hat-trick over C&D 16 days ago; up another 4lb but he merits serious consideration with usual cheekpieces refitted.

runners.name: Gibside
runners.comment: Signed off for 2024 with success at York in October; can't be discounted on Tapeta debut
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who signed off for 2024 with success in 2m York handicap in October; he can't be discounted on his Tapeta debut despite a near six-month lay-off.

runners.name: High Court Judge
runners.comment: Sixth win of 2025 here in March; not clear run when fourth at Newcastle latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Gained a remarkable sixth success of 2025 over 11f here in March and he didn't enjoy the smoothest of passages when fourth of six in 2m Newcastle handicap 23 days ago; he must enter calculations.

6:55.race_name: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.name: Las Ramblas
runners.comment: Promise in novice events last year; still open to progress; interesting on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Promise in novice events last year, winning at Newcastle (1m, AW) in February then fourth at Nottingham (1m2f) in May; had gelding/wind operations since; still open to progress and is interesting on reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a work in progress but is very promising and holds some fancy entries. I think he'll develop as we get through the season and time will tell how good he is. We might look at a novice for him next month and go from there, but he'll stay ten furlongs. I really like him. 25-04-24

runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.comment: Two wins at Southwell this year; ran respectably twice last month; remains in form
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful form this year features two wins at Southwell (7f/1m); ran respectably in the Lincoln Trial at Wolverhampton and C&D event last month; again likely to give his running.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Bajan Bandit made all when he won at Haydock then we were duped by a shower of rain half an hour before the race last time there and held him up. This looked a competitive event but he won well enough. At some point we'll try him over a mile again but there's no rush - Grant Tuer, trainer.

quotes.race: Due Diligence Standing At Whitsbury Manor British EBF Blagrave Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward, very professional and Bahan Bandit travelled nicely. We thought we would sit back before getting a tone of the race but when the split came he got his head down and found the gap nicely. He was a little bit green at one stage, but his raw ability came through and he has hit the line strong. The ground is a touch quick for him so he will improve and he will come on massively from this run. He will improve with a bit more ease in the ground, but it shows that he is a good horse and he will go on anything - Cieren Fallon, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Richard Hannon's yard and when he arrived here he had a mark of 79 but his first run for us was disappointing. We felt a mile stretched him then and dropped him to 7f, which proved to be the right thing as he won at Haydock on his second run. He added to that at York in July off a mark of 80 and he's now shot up to 87. We tried him again over a mile last week at the Ebor meeting as there were no 7f alternatives and he ran a cracking race. That trip on fast ground is definitely him and it looks like there could be a big prize in him. He has a touch of class and it is onwards and upwards. Looking ahead there are options at Doncaster and York to consider. 30-08-23

runners.name: Feel The Need
runners.comment: Has shown respectable form at Southwell this winter; met traffic issues last time
runners.spotlight: Respectable form at Southwell this winter features a 1m success in December and close third in February; best to forgive latest effort (met traffic issues); remains of interest at this level.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his return and can take a step forward from that. There are some nice races for him this month and there should be plenty of improvement to come. 04-05-23

runners.name: Silver Trumpet
runners.comment: Ran well in higher grade over C&D on reappearance; fighting chance off same mark
runners.spotlight: Has done his winning in Class 5; however, ran well in Class 3 contest over C&D last month on seasonal debut; fighting chance off same mark back down a grade.

runners.name: Paradoxical
runners.comment: Strong record at Wolverhampton since wearing cheekpieces; unplaced Chelmsford Thursday
runners.spotlight: Record of 11112, all at Wolverhampton, since wearing cheekpieces; likely player in the retained headgear, provided he transfers the form back to Southwell (second attempt here); beat only one home at Chelmsford Thursday.

runners.name: Chola Empire
runners.comment: Fairly useful 7f handicapper; suited by Southwell; return to 1m is the question mark
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful 7f handicapper whose consistent form this year features a Southwell success (3-7 at this venue overall); return to 1m is the question mark.

runners.name: Narmar
runners.comment: Better than his form figures for new yard suggest; interesting off a reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo who looks better than his form figures for new yard suggest; last two efforts, both over 7f at Southwell, suggest this return to 1m will suit; interesting off a reduced mark.

quotes.race: Join The Listowel Races Supporters Club (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: We got racing early. Henry said Narmar is a real galloper and the strong pace really suited. He handles nice ground and wants all of the mile trip on nice ground when there is no gallop. He parked when he got there so cheekpieces might help him. He's a nice horse going forward - Gary Carroll, jockey

runners.name: Kingdom Of Time
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden who has solid C&D form and is threatening to win a race of this nature
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who has form figures of 224 since handicapping, the second-place finishes over C&D (including behind a subsequent triple scorer); threatening to win a race of this nature and has clear possibilities back here.

runners.name: Overnight Oats
runners.comment: Latest win took his record at Southwell to 3-5 and strike-rate under Hector Crouch to 5-8
runners.spotlight: Nosed ahead in the final strides to beat Down To The Kid in C&D event three weeks ago, taking record at Southwell to 3-5 and strike-rate under Hector Crouch to 5-8; with those stats he's one for the shortlist.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: When I won on Overnight Oats at Wolverhampton I thought he had a few more races in him but he was limited in what he could run in. We had to step him up to 1m2f which didn't suit and then back down to 7f where he ran a bit flat. This is a more testing 7f than Lingfield and he was back to his best - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: JRA Handicap
quotes.quote: We stuck at 5f for too long with Overnight Oats and all we were doing was getting his brain to work too fast. As soon as we put the hood on he's settled and Ray (Dawson, jockey) said you can go further if you want. He's in at Newmarket on Friday and we'll see how he is. I don't like running them back quick but he's a toughie - William Muir, joint-trainer, talking to RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: He was on a five-timer at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day but didn't get the best of runs and finished sixth. He's in good order and enjoying his racing and is leading the £100k bonus. He's got to run another three times in January, three in February and three in March, so I've got to get another nine more runs into him, keep him sound and earning points. He could go to Lingfield or Southwell this Friday. 01-01-25

runners.name: Clear Angel
runners.breeder: Framont Ltd, R S Cockerill & Monceaux
runners.comment: Achieved best AW results off much lower marks in 2022; absent since last June
runners.spotlight: Well treated on turf form but achieved his best AW results off much lower marks in 2022, so brings mixed messages; absence since last June adds to the uncertainty.

runners.name: Epidavros
runners.comment: Largely consistent on turf last year, winning twice; the switch to AW is an unknown
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent on turf in her first season last year, winning twice; ran creditably on final outing; the switch to AW is an unknown but market support should be noted.

runners.name: Down To The Kid

prev_owners.owner: GB Civil, N Sennett & I Furtado
Gb Civil Engineering & The Giggle Factor

runners.comment: Has produced form figures of 221 here since dropped back to 1m; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Three-time 1m4f winner at Southwell; has produced form figures of 221 here since dropped back to 1m; incurs a 5lb penalty for his Class 6 win last week but remains well treated on historical data; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't show much last year but hit the lids in style this year with back-to-back wins at Southwell in the spring, each time over 1m4f. He was denied his hat-trick back at our local track by a nose. He was disappointing last time but had had had a much-needed break so was always going to be better for the run. There is more to come from him as he is still relatively lightly raced. 29-08-22

runners.name: Eden Storm
runners.comment: Yet to win for current yard and doesn't look the percentage call in this field
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Wolverhampton for previous yard; currently in a consistent vein of form but is 0-8 for current stable and doesn't look the percentage call in this competitive race.

5:50.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap

runners.name: Jimmy Speaking
runners.comment: Won twice over 6f this time last year; proven fresh, but still to prove he wants this far
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 6f at both Chelmsford (Polyrack) and Ascot (good) around this time last year; has won after a seven-month layoff so his 162-day absence not an issue, but is still to prove that he wants this far.

runners.name: How Impressive
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner and beaten a neck here last time; back up 3lb but still well treated
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer and dual C&D winner who had dropped 6lb below his last winning mark when beaten a neck here a fortnight ago; back up 3lb, but still well treated on previous form and another big effort seems likely.

runners.name: Little Boy Blue
runners.comment: Has a good record fresh, but sole AW win came as a 2yo; vulnerable to younger legs
runners.spotlight: Off six months but has a good record fresh as when making a winning return from 230 days off at Epsom (7f, good) last July; sole AW win came as a 2yo, though, and he may be vulnerable to younger legs.

quotes.race: Marathonbet Festival Of Racing 7th-9th August Handicap
quotes.quote: Little Boy Blue took a fair hold on me early, and while I expected him to go well, I did not expect him to go that easily - Ryan While, jockey

quotes.race: 32Red.com / EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Little Boy Blue is a fast little horse with the a sprinter's back end on him. He can only keep improving - Luke Morris, jockey.

runners.name: Ten Commitments
runners.comment: Looked unfortunate not to finish closer on stable debut/reappearance; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Dual winner for Jamie Osborne, the latest at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in October; fifth of eight on his stable debut/reappearance over C&D three weeks ago, but he may have been placed with a clearer run; each-way claims if building on that.

stable_tour.quote: He's proved to be reasonably consistent in his last few runs. He'll go for the Leger Legends race on Sunday to be ridden by Jimmy McCarthy, my assistant. He's rated bang on the 70 limit and the race should suit him. He's a little bit awkward early in his races, but if it all happens smoothly he can win off his mark. 11-09-24

runners.name: Ash Wednesday
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Record on Tapeta this year reads 111511 including a win over C&D; hard to dismiss
runners.spotlight: Record on Tapeta this year reads 111511 including a win over C&D (only defeat when minus the tongue-tie); had just a neck to spare last time and is up another 4lb in a better race, but hard to dismiss one with a profile like his.

runners.name: Secret Strength
runners.comment: Second of seven over C&D five weeks ago; up another 2lb but still shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Dual Lingfield winner (7f, Polyrack) who was making his first visit here when second of seven over C&D five weeks ago; up another 2lb but still shouldn't be far away.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: If you look back at Secret Strength's old form he was the best horse in the race if he could find that again. People latched on to the jockey booking too, but I said to David [Allan, rider] he was in great order and was fit as I could've had him - Shaun Lycett, trainer.

runners.name: Tasever
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Newcastle regular (four wins), but not sure how he will cope on his first visit here
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who normally plies his trade at Newcastle (all four wins have come there), but he didn't run very well in two starts at Wolverhampton so not quite sure how he will cope on his first visit here.

quotes.race: Leslie Burton (Fisher) Handicap
quotes.quote: Tasever ran a blinder too and I hope he'll get his win soon - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Bobby Joe Leg
runners.comment: Three wins over C&D, but finished well behind Ash Wednesday at Wolverhampton 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is best known for his Newcastle exploits (ten wins), but he has won on Tapeta elsewhere including three times over this C&D; finished well behind Ash Wednesday at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) 11 days ago, though, and needs to put that performance behind him.

stable_tour.quote: A winner of 14 races for us, he's been in the form of his life this winter. He was placed off a mark of 71 and he's never won off a mark that high. He was in such good form last season I was expecting a disappointing one this year, because when you've come up you have to come down again, usually, but he's been running so well. My Mum and Dad bred him, so he's obviously quite special and he's been knocking about here for a long time. He's picked us up some of that Arc bonus the last two winters and has been a tremendous family servant. He ran at Newcastle on Tuesday evening and finished fifth. 17-04-24

runners.name: Wilde And Dandy

prev_owners.owner: D Fravigar, S Jones And Partner

runners.comment: C&D winner in December, but failed to beat a rival here last time; has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Still 4lb higher then when winning over C&D in December and failed to beat a rival here (1m) three weeks ago (took a keen hold after missing the break); return to this trip may help, but he still has a bit to prove.

8:00.race_name: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Combustion
runners.comment: 4-4 on AW since returning in January including a win over C&D; respected despite penalty
runners.spotlight: 4-4 on the AW since returning in January including a win over C&D; first three successes came in 0-50 classified events, but he showed he could do it in handicap company as well at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) a week ago; has a 5lb penalty for that, but is still respected.

runners.name: Silky Robin
runners.comment: 0-16 but 1lb lower than when twice runner-up earlier in year; each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: 0-16 but 1lb lower than when runner-up at over this trip at Chelmsford (Polytrack) and Wolverhampton (Tapeta) earlier in year; each-way claims again.

runners.name: Noble Consort
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd & Julie Camacho
runners.comment: Has done well since returned to this trip; a player if ready to go after three months off
runners.spotlight: Had been racing over further but has done well since returned to this trip, winning at Newcastle (Tapeta) in December and finishing second of nine back there the following month (winner also landed her next two starts); a player if ready to go after three months off.

stable_tour.quote: He's a well-bred gelding who goes back to Golden Horn on the dam's side of his pedigree. He was previously owned by Clipper Logistics but Julie Camacho loved him and asked us to buy him for her to continue training him. He had his first run on turf at Haydock last week but didn't get a clear run and ended up seventh of ten behind Sedgemoor. Hopefully he'll have a big three-year-old campaign. 14-06-24

runners.name: Lady In Havana
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.comment: Two wins here for David Loughnane, but poor in both starts since returning for this yard
runners.spotlight: Dual winner here (6f/7f) for David Loughnane and 5lb lower than for the most recent, but poor in both starts since returning for this yard after seven months off in December; off another 106 days since and only of interest if positive in the market; drawn widest.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady In Havana has learned quite a lot but the penny is still dropping and hopefully we can have a nice, fun winter with her. Every stride she took the penny was dropping more and she'll be an exciting prospect for the team - Laura Pearson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Agent Mayfair
runners.comment: Runner-up to Combustion the last twice, but pull in the weights with him may not be enough
runners.spotlight: Sole success when making all in a 0-50 classified event here (5f) in February, since when he has finished runner-up behind Combustion at both Chelmsford and Lingfield (6f, Polytrack); 5lb better off compared to their latest meeting a week ago, but that may not be enough albeit he still holds each-way claims; stable also runs Under Curfew.

runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.comment: 2-41 on the AW and had no excuses at Wolverhampton on Monday
runners.spotlight: Seven wins on turf and although successful at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) in February, his strike-rate on the AW isn't so good (2-41); didn't appear to have any excuses in an amateurs' event back there on Monday.

quotes.race: Best Free Tips At valuerater.co.uk Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Under Curfew travelled beautifully. I was told to follow our other horse [Bezzas Lad] but he went off too quick. We slotted in and he couldn't try any more for me ? I couldn't stop screaming from two out - Mollie Phillips, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath in May and then again at Salisbury last month.  He was second at Bath last Friday night - it looked an easy opportunity for him with just three runners, but they're never easy and 5f on very fast ground probably just caught him out - he's more a 6f horse really. The winner of the race is possibly all right. He'll run in the Bullet at Brighton on Friday. All ground comes alike to him and he's in good form. 07-08-24

runners.name: Pembrokeshire

prev_owners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster

runners.comment: Quiet in three starts on the AW (0-14) since returning for this yard in February
runners.spotlight: 8lb lower than when successful at Ayr (7f, good) last summer, but quiet in three starts on the AW (0-14) since returning for this yard in February; needs a resurgence now back down in trip.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Pembrokeshire completely boiled over in the paddock last time and ran his race before he even got down to start. Dom [Hislop] has done a good job leading him up, he's kept a lid on him and got him down to the start in one piece. He had a good gallop to aim at, he was able to get into a rhythm and I thought he stayed the seven [furlongs] quite well - Iain Jardine, trainer.

runners.name: Devilwala
runners.comment: Won at 100-1 at Wolverhampton eight days ago; hard to know what to expect this time
runners.spotlight: Smart in his younger days, but given his recent form his 100-1 success in a 0-50 classified event at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) eight days ago was still a big shock; the drop in trip may have helped, but hard to know what to expect under his 4lb penalty this time.

quotes.race: Deepbridge Innovative Investing Handicap
quotes.quote: Devilwala handled the ground and we went wide the whole way. Tim [Easterby] said I wasn't to hit this horse as he looked like he was going to win at Ayr last time but finished second - Jason Hart, jockey.

quotes.race: Darley Dewhurst Stakes (Group 1)
quotes.quote: That was a nice surprise. Devilwala might come back for the Craven next year - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now EBF Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Devilwala is a lovely horse. There's room for improvement as he was a bit green, but he showed a lovely attitude. When the second horse came to me, he pulled out more and was hardly blowing afterwards. I've got a lot of time for him and he has a bright future - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Mumcat
runners.comment: A bit in and out since winning at Wolverhampton a year ago; record of 3-51 a concern
runners.spotlight: A bit in and out since winning off 4lb higher at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) a year ago, twice finishing runner-up in five starts in 0-50 classified company this year; record of 3-51 a concern and she isn't well drawn.

runners.name: Miss Billie
runners.owner: David Tate Danny Lawson Michael Wigham
runners.comment: Just beaten in a 0-50 classified event over C&D in February, but held since and now 0-17
runners.spotlight: Front-runner whose best recent effort was when beaten a neck in a 0-50 classified event over C&D (first-time blinkers) in February; twice well held since, though, and is now 0-17.

runners.name: Balmy Breese
runners.comment: In the frame in three of his last four starts in 0-50 classified company, but is now 0-26
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three of his last four starts in 0-50 classified company, but has more to do back in a handicap and is now 0-26.

4:45.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM 'Confined' Maiden Fillies' Stakes (2 Runs Or Less) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Carlyle Square
runners.comment: Modest form in two runs this winter; handicaps more suitable after this
runners.spotlight: Down the field on her debut for William Haggas (1m, Polytrack) in November and again never threatened on her stable debut (C&D) six weeks ago; handicaps more suitable after this.

runners.name: Cast Party
runners.comment: Two promising 1m runs as a 2yo; more to come this year and holds leading claims
runners.spotlight: In need of the experience when third at Newmarket on debut last September (1m, good to firm); improved when second at Kempton the following month and she remains capable of further progress; looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Champagne On Ice
runners.owner: Mrs J Magnier & Mrs P Shanahan
runners.comment: Debut second (1m) was encouraging but backward step dropped to 7f latest; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Second at Kempton on debut (1m) in February but she took a backward step at Chelmsford three weeks ago (7f); returning to 1m with a tongue-tie fitted could see her bounce back.

runners.name: Halcyonic
runners.comment: 50,000gns yearling; half-sister to a Flat/hurdle winner; worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: 50,000gns yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to 9.5f-14.5f Flat (RPR 96) and 2m hurdle winner Homer; dam unraced sister to 1m3f Listed winner Prudenzia; starts out at a manageable level and she needs a market check.

runners.name: Jet Black
runners.breeder: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, Cad Racing
runners.owner: Team Valor, Cayton Park Stud, A Singh
runners.comment: Modest form in two 2yo runs; bred to do better at some point
runners.spotlight: Ran to a modest level in two 2yo runs; bred to do much better and she's in good hands but her progress may coincide with a switch to handicaps.

runners.name: Luminoso
runners.comment: 430,000euros yearling; half-sister to 1m4f winner in France; Irish Oaks entry; of interest
runners.spotlight: 430,000euros yearling; fourth foal; half-sister to French 1m4f winner Imperious Man; dam French 8.5f AW winner, half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Sofast; entered in the Irish Oaks; betting to guide.

runners.name: Peaceful Spirit
runners.comment: Modest form on last summer's debut (7f) but sent off at just 4-1 there; can do better
runners.spotlight: Prominent in the betting for her debut at Haydock last August (7f, good to firm) but looked in need of the experience, beaten 5l into sixth; bred to do much better in time.

runners.name: Previse
runners.comment: Half-sister to Listed winner Juncture (RPR 109); lots to like on paper; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to 7f 2yo/1m winner Juncture (including AW Listed/US; RPR 109); dam unraced sister to 11.6f winner Guild, half-sister to winners Promising Lead (1m2f Group 1) and Visit (6f/7f Group 3); appealing pedigree and the betting should be revealing.

runners.name: Shimaleyah
runners.comment: Improved at second attempt when a close 4th over C&D last month (met trouble); e-w shout
runners.spotlight: In need of the experience over 7f here on debut in February; better effort when keeping on for a close fourth over C&D 16 days ago and she would have finished closer but for traffic issues at a crucial stage; this might be a deeper race though and more minor money perhaps her best hope.

runners.name: Stellenbosch
runners.comment: Third at Newbury (6f) and Newmarket (7f) last July; bred to stay; good form chance
runners.spotlight: Two promising runs at Group 1 tracks last summer, third at Newbury (6f, good to firm) before filling the same position at Newmarket (7f, good; winner useful) two weeks later; bred to stay this far and she's one to take seriously back from an absence.

5:20.race_name: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Niminy Piminy
runners.owner: Mrs Simon Marsh & Hon Mrs Peter Stanley
runners.comment: Created a favourable impression when making a winning debut at Lingfield in December
runners.spotlight: The only newcomer in the field when making a winning debut at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack; 14-1) in December, creating a favourable impression in the process; not sure dropping a furlong is ideal given how well she hit the line, but this more galloping track should help and she is much respected under the penalty.

runners.name: Captain Parma
runners.comment: Disappointing 1-2 favourite when fourth of seven on debut here (1m); watch market
runners.spotlight: Showed up for a long way but didn't get home when fourth of seven on his debut here (1m) three weeks ago; was sent off 1-2 there which suggests much better was expected; interesting to see if the money comes for him again.

runners.name: Havachoc
runners.breeder: The Rumble Racing Club - White Chocolate
runners.comment: Some appeal on breeding but stable doesn't have many go in first time.
runners.spotlight: £25,000 yearling; dam 7f 2yo/1m2f Flat (RPR 95) and 2m hurdle winner, closely related to 7f Listed winner Qaysar, half-sister to winners Cirona (1m Group 3) and Chares (1m 2yo Listed); some appeal on breeding but stable doesn't have many go in first time.

runners.name: Itsneverjustone
runners.owner: Ian Oconnor & The Fox And Hounds

prev_owners.owner: Ian O'Connor & The Fox And Hounds

runners.comment: Showed ability in his last three starts last year; off six months having been gelded
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in his three completed starts last year, particularly when third of 13 at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) on his final outing (first two won their next starts); returns from six months off having been gelded in the meantime; market informative.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to Aberama Gold and El Hombre, who have won 20-odd races between them. He looks a pretty smart colt who I think will progress through the ranks each season. 30-05-24

runners.name: Some Boy Me
runners.breeder: The Hon Mrs R Pease & Anthony Boswood
runners.comment: Well beaten on his Thirsk debut last September; major improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Sent off 125-1 when a well-beaten sixth of eight on his Thirsk debut (7f, good to soft) last September; half-brother to an AW winner but will need major improvement to figure; stable also runs the newcomer Rosemary May.

runners.name: Sunshine Mag
runners.comment: Stable can get them ready first time and market confidence would be interesting
runners.spotlight: 10,000euros yearling, 30,000gns 2yo; half-brother to 5f/6f winner The Thin Blue Line (including 2yo/AW/Bahrain; RPR 89); dam fourth over 1m1f in France (73), out of 1m2f winning sister to Italian Group 2 winner Oriental Fashion; stable can get them ready first time and market confidence would be interesting.

runners.name: Zous Your Daddy
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.comment: Placed in two of three starts last year; watch market on stable debut after 197 days off
runners.spotlight: Beaten just a neck on last August's Kempton debut (7f, Polytrack) when trained by Simon Pearce and bounced back from a tilt at Group 3 level with a creditable third of 11 at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm); makes his stable debut in a first-time tongue-tie (same owners) after 197 days off; market useful.

runners.name: Eagle Strike
runners.breeder: Michel Dardenne, Scea Haras De Gratte Pa

prev_owners.owner: Yorkshire Moors I & Hzs Stainless Steel

runners.comment: Beaten a long way on his Redcar debut in October; has undergone wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way into tenth of 15 on his Redcar debut (1m, soft; 22-1) in October (underwent wind surgery in February); half-brother to a French AW winner, but he will need to have improved plenty to make his mark in this.

runners.name: Rosemary May
runners.comment: Would be a rare winning newcomer from the yard
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to five winners including Eastern Legend (10.3f-1m6f Flat, RPR 96; 2m hurdle), Greer (6f/7f including 2yo/Qatar; 92) and Faakhirah (7f AW 2yo; 84); dam 6f (2yo)/7f (Group 3) winner (104); would be a rare winning newcomer from the yard.

6:20.race_name: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap

runners.name: Bust A Moon
runners.comment: Just pipped over 6f on last week's stable debut; 3lb well in; key player back at 5f
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Eve Johnson Houghton but went close to justifying favouritism on his stable debut at Chelmsford last week (6f), leading in the final furlong but outstayed by the rallying winner (pair clear); 3lb well in and should have the pace for 5f; big chance.

runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.comment: Has shown winning potential in minor handicaps of late and she is more appealing than many
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability at a modest level since moving into handicaps, placed at Newcastle and Wolverhampton before a midfield finish in a stronger race at Newcastle three weeks ago; more appealing than many.

runners.name: Watkins
runners.comment: Isn't progressing and beaten 6l when 4th at Chelmsford last week; new trip/accessories
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress for George Boughey and beaten 6l into fourth on last week's stable debut at Chelmsford (6f); new combination of accessories tried now dropping to 5f for the first time; due to be 3lb lower from Saturday.

runners.name: Monticristo Boy
runners.comment: On the up in AW nurseries in the autumn; still low mileage and he's high on the list
runners.spotlight: On the up once switched to nurseries in the autumn and quite possible there will be more to come this year; feasibly weighted and he holds strong claims back from 139 days off.

runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.comment: Showed speed but ultimately well beaten in 3 runs in Ireland in 2024; stable/h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed speed in three runs in Ireland last summer but ran to just a modest level; more realistic task now making her debut for Rebecca Menzies but not obviously well treated.

runners.name: Trust Sergei
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs S Matheson & Mr S Goodwin
runners.comment: Improved for the switch to handicaps when 3rd at Wolverhampton (6f) last month; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in novice/maiden company but he offered more when third of 11 over 6f at Wolverhampton on last month's handicap debut; drop to 5f could prompt further progress.

runners.name: Lilchita
runners.comment: Little solid form and the drop to 5f isn't enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Little solid form and the drop to 5f isn't enough to tempt.

runners.name: Master Zack
runners.comment: Unplaced all nine starts but has shown promise at a low level; new accessories combination
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all nine starts but he has shown some ability at a low level; tongue tied for the first time and the hood returns but others are more appealing for win purposes.

runners.name: Baby Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Better effort when beaten under 3l here (6f) five weeks ago; more needed but it's possible
runners.spotlight: The addition of cheekpieces saw her take a step forward when beaten under 3l over 6f here five weeks ago; still only seventh of ten on that occasion though and more needed to win.

stable_tour.quote: An interesting horse as she's Curious Rover's full-sister. She has started to come to hand and we like what we're seeing. We expect her to be on the track in August. 14-06-24

runners.name: Miss Campanella
runners.comment: Poor form in her six starts, including three AW handicaps this year; hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Poor form in her six starts, including three AW handicaps this year; hard to recommend.

8:30.race_name: Weekly £5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Royal Jet
runners.comment: Down the field in three 7f runs for new yard this year; due to be 3lb lower from Saturday
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three 7f runs since joining Tony Carroll; not beaten all that far on the latest occasion but he'll be 3lb lower from the weekend and he has something to prove back at 6f; yard also run Port Hedland.

runners.name: Asadjumeirah
runners.comment: Solid claims on this year's best 6f form, for all that has come at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Newcastle this winter and he finished second at that track twice last month; disappointing over 7f here last week but could prove more potent back at this trip.

runners.name: Thunderous Love
runners.comment: 6f turf win off this mark last May; mixed bag afterwards; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Sprung a 25-1 surprise at Salisbury last May and she makes her seasonal reappearance off the same mark; subsequent efforts were more miss than hit, however, and she has a five-month absence to overcome.

runners.name: Tough At The Top
runners.comment: Likely improver upped in trip and switched to low-grade handicaps; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three runs in 5f novice/maiden events but there has been promise and he looks a likely improver now upped in trip and switched to low-grade handicaps; interesting.

runners.name: Port Hedland

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Earl Cadogan

runners.comment: Two positive runs for new yard; Hector Crouch takes over tonight; good chance back at 6f
runners.spotlight: Often flattered to deceive for Henry Candy but he has fallen in the weights and both runs for Tony Carroll have both been positive; Hector Crouch takes over tonight and the return to 6f can help; still time to come good.

runners.name: Galileo Glass
runners.comment: Won a 7f handicap here on Wednesday but vulnerable under a penalty at today's trip
runners.spotlight: Placed a couple of times this year before putting his head in front over 7f here on Wednesday night (for this apprentice); not a straightforward ride and could prove vulnerable under a penalty back in distance.

runners.name: Araifjan
runners.comment: On a losing run but did run well at Wolverhampton last September; 144-day absence to defy
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner but none since November 2023; went close at Wolverhampton last September but ended 2024 with two lesser efforts; 144-day absence to defy.

runners.name: Arlington
runners.comment: He's been in good form in classified races this year, finishing second three times; chance
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins at Newcastle last year; runner-up in three of his five runs this year, the latest when beaten a nose in a classified event two weeks ago; should remain competitive back in a handicap.

runners.name: Lions Dream
runners.comment: Ended losing run last month (6f, Wolverhampton); creditable effort latest; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Ended a losing run in a 6f classified event at Wolverhampton three weeks ago and ran respectably under a penalty back at that track last week; should remain competitive.

stable_tour.quote: He's owned by The Horse Watchers, who are a seriously smart bunch of lads who know everything there is to know about form. This one came from Richard Hughes and I think he has a lot more to offer. He has been a little disappointing but shows me plenty at home and needs to transfer that to the track. I don't think he felt that comfortable on the all-weather and I'm hoping he can get it together on the turf. 22-03-23

runners.name: Company Minx
runners.comment: Placed over C&D eight weeks ago but in a minor classified event; others are stronger
runners.spotlight: Recorded her first placed effort for some time when third of nine in a C&D classified event eight weeks ago; even that form needs bettering returned to handicap company.

3:05.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: Pepsi Cat
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Developed into a useful 5f performer last year; begins new campaign from good mark
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing mare who developed into a useful 5f performer last spring; not seen since struggling in a Listed race last September, but is back in calmer waters here and begins her new campaign from a good mark; respected.

runners.name: Grace Angel
runners.comment: Needs to bounce back from last month's poor run but may have a fitness edge today
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf last summer (5.2f/5f); seemingly a shade too high in weights on AW afterwards and ran poorly when last in action three weeks ago, but has edged back down to a workable mark and is the only one in this line-up to have run since the autumn.

quotes.race: Retro Industrial Cleaning Services Handicap
quotes.quote: Hopefully we can get Grace Angel to Bahrain after that as she just missed the cut-off point last winter. She loves fast ground, so would be ideal for over there - Darryll Holland, trainer.

runners.name: Regal Envoy
runners.comment: In excellent form on AW in autumn; 146-day break may have checked his momentum
runners.spotlight: In excellent form on AW when last season in the autumn, winning twice under Brandon Wilkie at Chelmsford (6f/5f); also very well suited by this track but 146-day break may have checked his momentum.

runners.name: Miss Show Off
runners.comment: Lightly raced filly who ran well when fresh last summer and may still have potential
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced filly who won over 6f as a 2yo and returned from long absence with close fourth on handicap debut at Sandown (5f, good) last summer; not seen since a lesser effort the following month but could still have potential.

stable_tour.quote: She's a sweet filly who won last time out at Newbury - her third run - when beating Al Hujaija in determined fashion. She has been given a rating of 85, but we liked her enough to give her an entry in the Princess Margaret Stakes at Ascot last weekend, although she didn't go there in the end. She wants good ground and any rain would weaken her chances. 02-08-23

runners.name: Jacquelina
runners.comment: Made remarkable progress last spring; returned from break with two lesser runs in October
runners.spotlight: Made remarkable progress as a 5yo last spring, winning five times at around 5f (various ground) and shooting 30lb up the ratings; however, she returned from a break with two down-the-field runs in October and will need to be back in prime form after her latest layoff.

quotes.race: Trade Centre UK Handicap
quotes.quote: I can't believe the amount Jacquelina has improved. It's kind of by default that she has because she ran on the heavy ground at Windsor and we didn't think she'd like it, but since she's run on soft ground she's just improved. To go and win like that today under a double penalty was pretty impressive. I wake up at about 8st 6lb and this saddle is about 2st! She's got an entry at Hamilton on Thursday but there's also a couple of options at Thirsk for her - Grace McEntee, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Pop Star
runners.comment: Signed off with emphatic 5.7f course win in October; resumes on 10lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Won three times last year, looking as good as ever when signing off with 4l success here (5.7f, soft) in October; would appeal slightly more over that longer trip, though, and resumes off a 10lb higher mark.

quotes.race: Simonstown Maiden
quotes.quote: Pop Star got a setback and has missed a lot of time. He was quite green late on but I was more than happy with him. He is quick, if he gets seven he is definitely stakes class - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Tourist
runners.comment: Consistent for Hilal Kobeissi  last season (two 6f wins); back in trip for stable debut
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 6f and was largely consistent for Hilal Kobeissi last year; makes stable debut after 223-day absence but, given his tendency to race freely, this drop back to 5f could be a good move.

runners.name: Connies Rose
runners.comment: Had career-best spell of form last spring/summer but lost her way in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Had career-best spell of form when cheekpieces were added last spring/summer, collecting three wins (5f-6f) along the way, but had lost her way by the autumn; suited by this C&D and seems versatile regarding ground but needs five-month break to have done her good; had wind op in November.

quotes.race: HAC Plumbing Supplies Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Connie's Rose loves racing - there is no mare tougher.  She has a good routine at home - she doesn't do a lot or see another horse - and she's a joy to train.  I'm still undecided if she prefers 5f.  We thought she was going to be a 1m-plus horse as she was slow, green and didn't know how to gallop at all, but she got a lot quicker at home.  Would we get more improvement holding her up at 1m?  We don't know.  We may try it in future but we don't want to change anything that's working at the moment - Grace Harris, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: So Smart
runners.comment: Front-runner; won twice (once over C&D) last season and is well drawn to attack today
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who gained one of last season's two wins over C&D (good to firm) and the other off today's mark; can't blame the soft ground for his below-par run in October but is well drawn to attack on his reappearance.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Live Racing Results Handicap
quotes.quote: He pinged the gates but did find the ground on the quick side, So Smart changed leads a couple of times but got away with it in the end. He likes to front-run because when he's in behind he doesn't do a whole lot, if something comes to him he goes again. He's an older horse so it's good to change things (headgear) and it's worked tonight - Kieran O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

4:15.race_name: 8 Places On The National With DragonBet Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
4:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: George Sansevero
runners.comment: Out of a fairly useful 5f-7f winner; hooded on debut; best watched
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam 5f-7f winner (RPR 85), sister to winners Nepotism (5f 2yo) and Eugenic (1m-1m3f); wears on a hood on this belated debut and is best watched.

runners.name: Reteti
runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Has shown some ability in bumpers but seems unlikely to pose a threat on Flat debut
runners.spotlight: Displayed ability in two of his three bumpers, the most recent last summer, but seems unlikely to pose a significant threat on Flat debut.

runners.name: Good Eye
runners.owner: The Upt North Darn South Syndicate
runners.comment: Remote when third in 10.7f Dundalk maiden in January; overlooked on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in heavy-ground Naas bumper on debut in January and was remote when third on the Flat at Dundalk (10.7f, AW) later that month; overlooked on first start for new stable.

runners.name: Gennadius
runners.comment: Left behind by smart rival on debut but still shaped with significant promise
runners.spotlight: Out of a Listed-placed 7f 2yo winner; left well behind by smart rival when second on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) in January, but shaped with significant promise and has obvious scope for improvement.

runners.name: High On Hope
runners.comment: Close second in Class 3 AW handicap (7f) on seasonal debut; sets the form standard
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in very valuable 6f sales race on last of five 2yo starts and made pleasing reappearance when close second in Class 3 Southwell handicap (7f, AW) three weeks ago; sets a good form standard and looks well worth a crack at 1m.

runners.name: Teroomm
runners.comment: Kept on strongly for very promising fourth in valuable 7f Kempton maiden in November
runners.spotlight: First foal from a very useful and well-connected 6f dirt winner in UAE; 11-2, encountered traffic before keeping on strongly for very promising fourth of 12 in valuable Kempton maiden (7f, AW) in November; open to considerable improvement this year and a likely contender.

runners.name: Papa Oscar
runners.comment: Has very good pedigree but his two 7f AW runs this year have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Has very good pedigree but was disappointing odds-on favourite on debut at Kempton (7f, AW; raced too freely) in February, while his subsequent fourth of six at Newcastle (7f, AW) was also underwhelming; needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Sofian
runners.owner: Sas Logistics Contracts Ltd Nikki Evans
runners.comment: Made the frame in a soft-ground maiden last summer but faces a tough task here
runners.spotlight: Belied triple-digit odds when fourth in Ffos Las maiden (7.3f, soft) last summer, but finished well down the field on nursery debut in September (7f) and faces a tough assignment here.

runners.name: Havana Tobouggaloo
runners.comment: Out of a bumper/fair 1m4f Flat winner; probably one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam bumper and 1m4f Flat winner (RPR 79), sister to useful bumper/hurdle winner Shalone; probably one for a bit further down the line.

4:50.race_name: On Course Values Online Dragonbet Handicap
4:50.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: King Of Speed
runners.comment: Not in bad form and was second to Darvel in a division of this 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been running badly on the AW and he was second to Darvel in a division of this 12 months ago.

runners.name: Darvel
runners.comment: Returning from a similar absence when winning a division of this race 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Not in flying form when last seen but he was returning from a similar absence when winning a division of this race 12 months ago; 3lb lower this afternoon.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Chamings, the last day I rode Darvel, was confident that he's got a lot more ability than his mark shows, so I knew when I was in front and started galloping away that he wasn't going to stop - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Bet £10 Get £10 With vickers.bet Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't know much about Darvel so that's why we ran him relatively quickly. He was rather disappointing us a bit on the all-weather, but he hadn't ran for a long time and probably needed it. We haven't had many runners, they haven't ran during the winter, we had a good second at Ascot and they're coming good now - Patrick Chamings, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with his step up to a mile at Haydock, although the very testing ground wouldn't have suited him. He kept on well and should make decent progress this year. 11-05-21

runners.name: Thats For Sure

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxiii & E Burke

runners.comment: Respectable in both runs for current yard (at 1m) and didn't get the breaks last time
runners.spotlight: Had lost his way but respectable in both runs for current yard (at 1m) and didn't get the breaks last time; tries cheekpieces.

runners.name: My Ambition
runners.comment: C&D winner but has been well beaten in divisions of this race the last two seasons
runners.spotlight: Winning for a third time here when prevailing narrowly from Monks Mead over C&D three runs back (last July); could go well, though has been well beaten in divisions of this race the last two seasons (when reappearing).

runners.name: Outrace
runners.comment: Tries first-time blinkers and has responded well to new headgear in the past
runners.spotlight: Hasn't beaten a rival in his last three races but responded positively to a change of headgear (cheekpieces) when winning at Wolverhampton in November; now goes in blinkers.

runners.name: Soi Dao
runners.comment: Perhaps flattered when a close fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) as she had the run of things
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner who was perhaps flattered when a close fourth at Wolverhampton (9.4f) as she had the run of things.

runners.name: Johnjay
runners.comment: Only win in 15 starts came over C&D on his first run of last season
runners.spotlight: Only win in 15 starts came over C&D on his first run of last season; plenty of good runs in defeat since then and his yard is having winners.

runners.name: Monks Mead
runners.comment: Out of form last October but was thereabouts on three occasions here last year
runners.spotlight: 7f turf and 1m Polytrack winner; out of form last October but was thereabouts on three occasions here last year; now gelded.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Monks Mead was very green at Windsor and Chelmsford, and then just ran in what looks like a good race at Newbury. I thought Ollie (Searle) gave him an excellent ride. I must say I was surprised the odds were so big because it's not a massive surprise he has shown some ability today - Mark Usher, trainer.

runners.name: Expecto
runners.comment: Capable performer in Ireland but perhaps best watched on first run since last June
runners.spotlight: Won as a 2yo for Jim Bolger and competitive in 1m-1m1f handicaps last year; bought for 7,500gns; perhaps best watched on first run since last June.

runners.name: Baynoona
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.comment: Ran a bit better back at 6f last time having been running over middle distances
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden with her third trainer; tailed off over middle distances in first three runs for this yard before showing more on her return to sprinting at Wolverhampton (6f); profile isn't overly convincing.

runners.name: Villalobos
runners.comment: Six wins during his career but he's become a hard horse to predict
runners.spotlight: 25-1 success at Kempton in January (1m) was a sixth career win, but he's become a hard horse to predict.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Villalobos is a big brute and a bit of a character, but when everything falls right he has the ability. He's pretty consistent in the way we ride him ? we always want to make plenty of use of him as he's a big, galloping horse. We got an easy lead and I kicked plenty early enough as I know he keeps galloping. I know him well and on other horses you might be a bit worried about kicking that early, but I know he's a tough boy - Adam Farragher, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Too Much Trevor
runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Final run at Yarmouth wasn't too bad (1m, soft) but he's 0-12 and lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Final run at Yarmouth wasn't too bad (1m, soft) but he's 0-12 and lacks a recent run.

stable_tour.quote: He was second on his debut at Leicester in a three-horse race, but that doesn't tell the story. He was very slowly away and lost several lengths yet still managed to run on and get second once the penny dropped. I am not saying he would have beaten the winner but he would have been much closer. 10-05-23

runners.name: Admiral Fitz
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut on the Flat but shown poor form, as was also the case over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Makes handicap debut on the Flat but shown poor form, as was also the case over hurdles.

runners.name: Alyara
runners.owner: Lynn Cullimore Pete Ponting Joe Ponting
runners.comment: Record of 3-48; notorious for being a hard puller and goes without headgear today; risky
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-48; notorious for being a hard puller and goes without headgear today; risky.

2:30.race_name: Happy Birthday Lynn Cullimore British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Qualifier) (GBB)
2:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: Agent Keen
runners.comment: Half-sister to 6f AW winner Bank On Kent (RPR 60); dam multiple 5f AW winner
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 6f AW winner Bank On Kent (RPR 60); dam multiple 5f AW winner (including at two; 74), half-sister to winners Radio Gaga (7f Listed), Ardbrae Lady (1m Group 3) and Obe Gold (6f 2yo Listed); has to be of interest.

runners.name: Coinin Caisc
runners.comment: Half-sister to 6f AW winner Perfect Dream (RPR 58); dam 5f 2yo/6f Listed winner
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to 6f AW winner Perfect Dream (RPR 58); dam 5f 2yo/6f Listed winner (106), half-sister to 7f 2yo/1m Listed winner On Her Toes; stable's newcomers are usually best watched but this filly appeals on paper.

runners.name: Senorita Vega
runners.comment: 28,000euros yearling; relatives needing longer trips to do their winning
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to winners Celestial Path (7f/1m; RPR 111; 2m hurdle) and Juanito Chico (7f/1m; 96); dam placed 1m (66), half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Chachamaidee; may need further.

runners.name: Anthelia
runners.comment: £6,000 yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to winner Punchbowl Flyer (6f; RPR 108)
runners.spotlight: £6,000 yearling; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Punchbowl Flyer (6f; RPR 108) and Machocamacho (Spanish 7f); dam 5f/6f 2yo winner (83), half-sister to Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Applecross; stable can ready a newcomer.

runners.name: Canyouhearthedrums
runners.comment: £6,000 yearling; stable has won last two renewals of this race with Group-class fillies
runners.spotlight: £6,000 yearling; fifth foal; half-sister to 5f AW 2yo winner Lord Gorgeous (RPR 81); dam once-raced (53) half-sister to useful 6f/1m winner Raatea; stable has won the last two renewals of this race with Group-class fillies.

runners.name: Officially
runners.comment: 4,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to 5f 2yo winner Grey Gray (RPR 76)
runners.spotlight: 4,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to 5f 2yo winner Grey Gray (RPR 76); dam 7f winner (72), closely related to winners Vital Equine (7f 2yo Group 2; 2,000 Guineas runner-up) and Vita Lika (1m2f); trainer also runs Coinin Caisc.

runners.name: Paroda Diva
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd, Roger Thompson & Partner
runners.comment: £10,000 yearling; bred to stay further than this
runners.spotlight: £10,000 yearling; sixth foal; half-sister to four winners including More Mango (US 7f/8.5f turf) and Diva Ready (US 5.5f-8.5f turf); dam 1m-1m2f winner (Group 2; RPR 105), out of 1m2f Group 3 winner; should stay further than this.

runners.name: Rejjien
runners.owner: Mrs T Burns & Mrs S Loughnane
runners.comment: Dam 6f winner, half-sister to winners Solo Mission (7.5f-1m4f) and Invasor Luck (1m4f)
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 6f winner (RPR 96), half-sister to winners Solo Mission (7.5f-1m4f) and Invasor Luck (1m4f); market can guide.

runners.name: Sayidah Poets
runners.comment: 2,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to Italian 6f-7.5f winner Siguanaba
runners.spotlight: 2,000gns yearling; second foal; half-sister to Italian 6f-7.5f winner Siguanaba; dam maiden (third 10.5f in France) sister to useful 7f/1m winner Brave Hero; the market should tell a tale.

1:55.race_name: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Bath Racing Handicap
1:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: Fair Dinkum
runners.comment: Won off 2lb higher on AW last June but looked out of sorts towards end of last summer
runners.spotlight: Scored off 2lb higher mark at Lingfield (1m5f, AW) last June but looked badly out of sorts towards end of last summer; cheekpieces removed after one use; leap of faith required to support him on this first start since September.

runners.name: Inlet
runners.comment: Went down fighting when upped to 1m6f in February; headgear on for turf debut
runners.spotlight: A maiden after six AW runs but went down fighting when upped to 1m6f at Wolverhampton in February and will play a major role here if able to replicate that form on her turf debut; sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mamdoh
runners.comment: In very good form on AW since cheekpieces were added but has very poor turf record
runners.spotlight: Has form-figures of 12122 on Tapeta since cheekpieces were added in February and is very well suited by today's trip, but had very poor record on turf last year (for previous stable) and still needs to prove himself on grass.

runners.name: Spitfire Bridge
runners.comment: Went close here last summer but was out of form on AW during winter; headgear switched
runners.spotlight: 0-8 on the Flat and 0-9 under National Hunt rules; now 7lb lower than when going close here (1m5f, good to firm) last summer but was badly out of form on AW during the winter; swaps cheekpieces for first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Man Of The Sea
runners.comment: Won four times in Jersey last year but has fitness to prove on this reappearance outing
runners.spotlight: Won four times in Jersey last year (twice over hurdles) and ran well in defeat over hurdles when back on the mainland in October; has fitness to prove today, though, and was well beaten here when fresh last spring.

quotes.race: NB Surfacing Handicap
quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea won well. Mr Mulholland said before the race he was in great form. He was a bit outpaced the last day at Windsor but he stays all day. He pinged the gates, I kept hold of him and he ran all the way to the line - George Rooke, rider.

quotes.race: Come Racing 11th November Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Man Of The Sea jumped and travelled, I was able to sit off the good pace and when I got stuck into him he saw it out to the line. He has plenty of experience and it stood to him. He did it well and hopefully there's another day in him - Billy Lee, rider

runners.name: Cornish Storm
runners.comment: In good form on AW and over hurdles this year; likely contender again
runners.spotlight: Close third on latest Flat start, at Kempton (1m4f, AW) in January, and subsequently won a maiden hurdle; could plausibly have untapped potential over this new trip and will be fine on today's ground; shortlisted.

runners.name: Wannabeawallaby

prev_owners.owner: Catch Us If You Can Racing & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Began this year with two heavy defeats on AW and is now 0-13
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who began this year with two heavy defeats over 1m4f on AW in January; very well handicapped on some of last year's form and will be suited by this move back up in trip, but others look much less risky; tongue-tie/blinkers both removed after one use.

5:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: Palazzo Persico
runners.owner: Johnny Hall And Mrs David Nutting
runners.comment: Won on AW in December and is back on a workable mark but can't be relied upon heavily
runners.spotlight: Fit from the AW and now only 1lb higher than when scoring in first-time visor at Chelmsford (1m2f) in December; also suited by fast turf but was below form when upped to 1m4f last month (wore blinkers) and is not one to rely upon; no headgear today.

runners.name: Waterloo Sunset
runners.comment: Returned from long absence with very respectable AW run in February; interesting
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf but was placed on only previous visit to Bath and returned from long absence with very respectable 1m2f AW run in February; probably better suited by this sort of trip nowadays; interesting.

runners.name: Meet Me In Meraki
runners.owner: Spiers & Hartwell Ltd & Mrs E Evans
runners.comment: Not himself last time but has possibilities if back on song for this turf return
runners.spotlight: Ran as though something was amiss on latest outing five weeks ago, but began this year with front-running success at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) and has possibilities if back on song for this first venture beyond 1m2f.

runners.name: Starfighter
runners.comment: Dual AW winner in January but much less prolific on turf and on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m4f winner at regular haunt Wolverhampton (AW) in January, but is much less prolific on turf and returns to this surface on a fairly tough mark; others preferred.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter has been a slow burner since he joined us from Ed Walker's and it's just taken a bit of time to get him right. He was rated higher a few years back so hopefully there's bit more improvement there and he'll go on the turf - Mark Loughnane, trainer.

quotes.race: Lester Brunt Wealth Management Handicap
quotes.quote: Starfighter deserved that he had been frustrating really. He has never really done much wrong, maybe he had been hitting the front a bit early or not quite getting home. Today he went through to the line and there was no doubting his temperament. He could step forward now - Ed Walker, trainer.

runners.name: Mrembo
runners.comment: Consistent last season; has fitness to prove today but resumes on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Very consistent (albeit without winning) last season and has 2-4 strike-rate at this track; has fitness to prove after six-month absence but resumes on a good mark; cheekpieces the headgear of choice today.

runners.name: Baikal

prev_owners.owner: Jerry Stevens And Rosie Leena Kavanagh

runners.comment: Returned to the Flat with two good AW runs at start of year; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Out of form over hurdles towards end of last year but returned to the Flat with a win at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) in January and was second off today's mark over that C&D the following month; does not have a compelling Flat turf record but still enters calculations.

runners.name: Jimmy Mark
runners.comment: Off since respectable AW run in October; does not have much margin for error off this mark
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m2f at Ffos Las last summer (good/good to soft) and is also very well suited by this track, but we haven't seen him since his respectable AW fourth (1m3f) in October and he probably doesn't have much margin for error off current mark.

quotes.race: Bresbet Rewards Loyalty Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: They went off at a gallop and Jimmy Mark needs someone to pace make for him and Callum gave him a great ride - Peter Lindsey, owner.

runners.name: Ladypacksapunch

prev_owners.owner: M Clarke, J Devine, P Munnelly & A Regan

runners.comment: C&D winner off basement mark last summer; absent since down-the-field AW run in December
runners.spotlight: Belatedly opened account with C&D (firm) win off basement mark last August, but has been absent since down-the-field AW finish in December and her stablemate Baikal has less to prove.

runners.name: Aquifolia
runners.comment: Unplaced all seven starts, the last three times off today's basement mark in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all seven starts, the last three times off today's basement mark in the autumn (1m2f-1m5f); connections are persisting with her but she needs to show considerable improvement on this seasonal debut.

3:40.race_name: Dragonbet - Born From The Betting Ring Handicap
3:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick 7.8)

runners.name: Dreambird Dolly
runners.comment: Just glimmers of ability before struggling when 40-1 for handicap debut (5f AW)
runners.spotlight: Just glimmers of ability before struggling when 40-1 for handicap debut (5f AW); has to step up.

runners.name: Elland Road Girl
runners.comment: Did well to be a closing fourth at Wolverhampton last time after missing the kick
runners.spotlight: Ex-David O'Meara; still lightly raced and did well to be a closing fourth at Wolverhampton last time after missing the kick; that was over 6f but this stiff track will help back in distance.

runners.name: Royal Accord
runners.comment: Faded over 6f at Wolverhampton and today's drop back to an extended 5f could work
runners.spotlight: 0-7; just behind of Elland Road Girl at Wolverhampton (6f) when always prominent before weakening; today's drop back to an extended 5f could work.

runners.name: Kameko Spirit
runners.comment: Prominent racer who has failed only narrowly in her last two races on the AW (5f)
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but he's a prominent racer who has failed only narrowly in her last two races on the AW (5f); her two no-shows on turf came in Newmarket novices so forget those; won't find many better opportunities than this.

runners.name: Fregola
runners.comment: Has finished seventh or eighth in all her seven runs, four being handicaps (5f-7f)
runners.spotlight: Has finished seventh or eighth in all her seven runs, four being handicaps (5f-7f); has a lot to prove.

runners.name: La Mer Grise
runners.comment: Has a lot of ground to make up with Kameko Spirit on their recent AW clash
runners.spotlight: No places in eight starts and has a lot of ground to make up with Kameko Spirit on their recent AW clash.
